description:
Them grits are on fleek. Them people are perfect. I'm so happy for this place. 

Cocktails mess me up and every time they are made at a level that is unparalleled.

Oh yeah, and the grits. Holy cow.
author: Anthony B.

description:
During brunch, we trailed several foods: 

Shrimp and grits 4/5: Not too heavy, juicy shrimps that were cooked perfectly (just wish there were more) and I liked how they added sausage and a poached egg to this dish. 

Fried chicken and waffles 1/5: The waffle wasn't crispy and was cakey. The fried chicken was really dry and overcooked, the breading was way thick and not well seasoned. I couldn't finish my piece. 

Gumbo 3/5: Flavor was okay, but it felt lacking in ingredients and felt a little bare.

Banana foster bread pudding: 5/5 Delicious!! The texture was awesome. The outside was caramelized and crunch and inside was soft and gooey. Very flavorful and rich. 

Service was lacking. Our waitress wasn't very warm and it was hard to get ahold of her when we needed something so we would often end up asking someone else.
author: Lexi R.

description:
My husband and I were craving some fried chicken and The Front Porch has been on my radar for a while, so we decided to come for dinner on night and it was kind of disappointing!

The night started out great because we were 20 mins before our reservations on a Sunday night and we were able to be seated right away by the hostess. 

We ordered the fried pickles, the four piece fried chicken plate, and the baked Mac and cheese. The fried pickles came out and was really tasty, hot and fresh and paired really well with the spicy aoili. But after that it all went downhill... After we got our pickles it took a full 30 minutes until we got our next dishes. During that time I saw that they did have a lot of orders going out for to go, and I understand they have to fulfill those but I think it's also important to care for your customers in store. During that time the waitresses never came to check on us or to let us know what's going on or how much longer the food would take. But usually I don't mind waiting if the food was worth the wait. Unfortunately it wasn't.

When we finally got our chicken I was expecting some juicy chicken with explosive flavor but instead we got four pieces of pretty dry chicken with bland flavor. The crust was crunchy though. The collard greens were actually pretty good, and the mashed potatoes and gravy were only subpar. The mac and cheese did come out hot and bubbly so that was actually some good mac and cheese.

Overall I am really underwhelmed by both the service and the food here. Definitely not worth the time or money to come here.
author: Hilary C.

description:
Met up with a friend of mine for dinner here on a Saturday night.  This restaurant has a rather dark interior but we were here early enough to snag one of the tables outside.  The menu is basically soul food. 

We were given nice corn bread as amuse and we had the squash fritters as appetizers.  Both were great. I ordered the 4 piece fried chicken with collared greens and mashed potatoes and my friend had the vegan jambalaya. 

The fried chicken was good and not really greasy though it's not the best fried chicken in town (to me, that belongs to Brenda's).  The collared greens and mashed potato were great though. I would come back here again for the chicken. Maybe even get the bucket. 

Service was good and attentive and it's great value - our meal including one drink, tax and tip ended up being $45 per person. It's amazing value for SF these days.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Come here hungry and leave here full and satisfied. Whenever I am in The City and want some good Southern food I choose to stop by The Front Porch. As the name suggests, it is very warm and welcoming place to start out your day. The food and service has been great every time I stop by and they change out some of their menu items every so often to keep things fresh. On our last visit, we tried out their Corn Bread Pudding. The server did warn us that it was on the sweeter side but we got it as an app anyways. He was right, it was sweet, but very good. It had the consistency of a dense cake, with all of the great flavors of a corn bread. You also can't go wrong with their Mac & Cheese, Gumbo, Shrimp & Grits, or their Chicken & Waffles.

I would highly recommend stopping by this home to try out their delicious food. You won't be disappointed.
author: Camera P.

description:
Arrived here right before the kitchen closed.
Sat outside. The dinning area inside was PACKED! Love seeing that when I walk into a restaurant! Gives me great hopes. 

Started off with the fried okra!!!!! 
It was delicious!!!! 

Next ordered the 
Chicken & waffles 
Mac & cheese 
Chicken fried steak 
With a sweet tea( just like grandma makes it) 

The chicken fried steak was amazing also everything that it came with made it taste even better!! The chicken waffles. I was hoping to bite into this sweet melting waffle, that wasn't the case. The fried chicken was okay. The Mac & cheese was good!! If your in the area try it out!
author: Dorothy M.

description:
Mmm, I'm craving their fried chicken again as I write this review. I've had The Front Porch bookmarked for ages but never had a chance to try it until recently. It's a popular spot but they take reservations, so definitely make one! 

The interior is dimly lit and quirky, super cozy and cute. The lighting makes it a little hard to take pictures that do justice of the delicious food - the photos I took just don't do it justice! 

When you're seated, they give you each a little cornbread muffin, which were really tasty. I would order more of these next time!The menu is pretty extensive so we ordered a bunch of things to share. For four people, this was plenty of food:  the fried green tomatoes, the braised beef, shrimp and grits, and fried chicken thighs. Everything was soooo good and cooked to absolute perfection. Stand-outs were the fried green tomatoes and their famous fried chicken. They even had gluten-free fried chicken on their menu for my gluten-intolerant friend, which was a bonus, since fried food is generally a no-go for her. We had a great experience here and can't wait to go back!
author: Josephine M.

description:
Came here with a group of 10 for dinner with a reservation.
They don't seat you until your entire party has arrived, so tell those typical stragglers the res actually 15 mins earlier than it is.

They have indoor and limited outdoor seating (with heaters!) but it's packed pretty tightly as most other places in SF.
The decor is pretty divey, so I wouldn't recommend it for a nice date, unless you're the kind of people that only care about the food.

Our table ordered two buckets of chicken and a mixture of the 4 pieces of fried chicken and short ribs mostly. Cause you can never have enough fried chicken.

The staff was great at taking care of our large party. They were attentive and came by regularly to check up on us.

The chicken was very good and the sides as well. The collards that came with the chicken were a little acidic for my taste, but balanced well with the Dr. Pepper braised short ribs. The short ribs themselves were tender and had nice sweetness to them, but I didn't enjoy the sides so much.

Their cocktails were strong, but very good. I can't remember what they were called, but it looks like they rotate them, so might as well try them all!

Overall, I had a good experience here and would definitely return.
Now i'm out to try the best fried chicken starting in the Bay!
author: Connie T.

description:
The Front Porch rocks! Great food, atmosphere, and service.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday and had a fantastic meal. I recommend making a reservation before you get there, even if it's 15 minutes prior. My bf did that and we were still able to get a table. 
The atmosphere is so fun and I love the whole vibe of the place. 

I wasn't planning to drink that morning, but their Bloody Mary has apparently won some kind of award so I gave in. It's soooo good and perfect for those who like them spicy (5/5)!! My bf got the coffee cocktail and it was such a nice balance going back and forth with the Bloody Mary. 

As for the food:
Spicy Shrimp and Grits (4.5/5): delicious! Great flavor. I just wish there were more shrimp.

Pulled pork and sweet potato hash (5/5): sooo good. It's actually not only sweet potato-- there's still chunks of regular potato in there, which is perfect. Flavor is on point and eggs were poached beautifully.

I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Christina W.

description:
Delicious food...and boy do they know how to do fried chicken!

Came here for a dinner with 9 people and we had to sit outside since its not a very big restaurant. Thankfully they have blankets AND heat lamps so it wasn't bad until you actually had to leave the restaurant!

We had Kevin and Felix help us all night...they were awesome!! I think Kevin is the owner? Super personable and super attentive! We didnt have an empty glass the entire night!

Notable shoutouts -
1. Fried Chicken - duh
2. Mac and Cheese
3. On tap cote de rhone....yasssss!!
4. Deep fried pickles...more batter than pickles..but who's complaining??
5. Catfish Hushpuppies - i'm from North Carolina so clearly this was a given..and i had no regrets!! sooo good! I didn't even know you could make Catfish Hushpuppies!! 

Everything was sooooo good! Delicious food, great service, and cute ambiance! Definitely come here! You won't regret it the slightest!!
author: Jennifer S.

description: 1st time here, place was busy but nice to have the option of outdoor seating especially on a rocking chair. Ordered the chicken and waffles with a side of grits. Two thumbs up on the grits, the fried chicken and sweet iced tea. The waffles,  well... their waffles right. Overall the experience was a good one. I will be back to try other menu items.
author: Alex R.

description:
OVERALL: Another delicious dinner at the Front Porch! I'm glad I finally brought the bf here, and he and our out-of-town friend thoroughly enjoyed it. We definitely ate too much but it's hard not to with so much good food on the menu.

RESERVATIONS: We had dinner at 7:30 on a Thursday. I made the reservation online day in advance, plenty of openings. There would've been no wait on the porch (no reservations, dog-friendly seating).

THE COST: $60 total per person, including tax/tip. We got several drinks, 2 starters, 1 side, 3 entrées, and 1 dessert.

THE FOOD:
* Free cornbread - 3 stars
Not great, not terrible. On the dry side, definitely need that butter. 

* Gumbo w/ Chicken, Andouille ($8) - 2.5 stars
Too much soup, very little rice & chicken. 

* Crawfish Hush Puppies ($11.50) - 2.5  stars
Too much of the bread, which was dry, not enough crawfish filling.

* Tea Brined Pork Chop ($24) - 4 stars
Pretty delicious. The pork was moist and had great flavor. I loved the brown butter yam puree also.

* Burger ($14.50, +1 Cheddar, +$2.50 Bacon) - 4.5 stars
Very delicious. Soft bun, juicy moist patty, definitely very oily but worth it. However, the fries were terrible. They looked like the type I like (thick, almost wedge-like, with a light crisp and soft filling), but they were incredibly dry, all bad crisp with no filling, and clearly had been frozen.

* Fried Chicken, 4 piece ($19.50) - 3.5 stars
Depending on the cut, some of the meat was dry, some more moist. The breading was nice & crunchy.

SIDES
* Baked Mac & Cheese ($8.50) - 4 stars
Yum, loved this, tons of great cheese & soft, well-cooked macaroni.

DESSERT
* Bourbon Pecan Pie ($9) - 3.5 stars
Very rich, with buttery crust and nice filling that wasn't just compacted puree but had a lightly crumbly texture.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I'd say this place is pretty average in terms of lunch/brunch offerings. Maybe because I live in San Diego and we have so many brunch places. We ordered the spinach benedit, baked egg and girts, and chicken and waffles. Honestly, nothing that would blow your mind (but that's just me!). 

We had a dog with us so we had to sit outside. The wait was about 20-30 minutes which was fine. However, our waiter was really nice. He informed us of all the items on the menu and checked up on us multiple times.

3 stars for food, 5 stars for service.
author: Andy L.

description: I would've much rather gone to Popeyes. Chicken was extremely dry with bland skin that you had to bathe in their "special" hot sauce aka regular Tabasco sauce.  Collard greens were undercooked with way too much vinegar. Mashed potatoes were extremely basic with the exception of its slight taste of rosemary and quarter-sized (literally quarter-sized) amount of gravy. There was nothing special about the gumbo either, and the rice was extremely tough, almost tasted stale. On top of all that our waitress did not check up on us once. If you're looking for good soul food this is not the place.
author: Gel L.

description:
This place has amazing southern creole cooking and I'm here for it! I've only gone here for brunch but I gotta say I was definitely impressed. 

The number one thing they're known for is the fried chicken and it does not disappoint! It's large pieces of chicken, fried to perfection, seasoned well, and is juicy. It takes about 25-30 mins because it's prepared fresh, so be aware of that. 

Brunch items we got:
- fried chicken & corn waffles
- eggs Benedict with andouille sausage and Cajun hollandaise with tater tots
- side of cheese grits
- beignets

The chicken and waffles were my favorite besides their cheese grits! The waffle was crispy, a huge amount of chicken and it was all cooked to perfection. They also have house made hot sauce that was perfect to pair with the chicken. 

The cheese grits do not mess around!!! So good and full of butter and cheese and they were damn delicious. Definitely would try the shrimp and grits next time. 

The Benedict was very rich and comes with a huge portion of the sausage. The tater tots were fried but paired with caramelized onions that brought a delicious flavor to them. 

Didn't try and drinks besides their lemonade but it's real lemonade! Not too sweet and perfectly tart. I like that you can get it both sparkling or still. 

Definitely make a reservation if you don't want to wait a long time for a table!
author: Amy W.

description:
The Front Porch feels like a dark garage but the food casts some wattage on the table.

The wattage shines +'s:
+ Fried chicken and waffles ($17). Crispy and tender. Finger lickin' good? Ya to some extent. I prefer a little spice to my batter but all parts: breast, thigh, and leg were moist and tasty. The waffle tasted pretty good too.
+ Biscuit and sausage gravy. We were starving and both whetted our appetite. Pretty hefty biscuits. Not flaky but good.
+ Service. First seated and greeted on a Saturday 10AM. Super friendly from start to finish. Coffee refills done timely and check arrived when asked. 
+ Vibe. By 11AM the place was packed. Great for groups who want to slide into booths. Some seats are recycled van seats.
+ Reservations can be made. That's huge. I hate waiting in line.

The wattage flickers -'s:
- Coffee. It tasted acidic and burnt. Blah.
- Healthscore is 86 out of 100 on our last visit.
- Dark. I don't mind working in the dark but if the sun is out, I will take it. Entering a dark diner drains some of the pep in my step.

Great neighborhood gem in Bernal Heights. Glad I tried it and would like to try the other entrees.
author: Yiven C.

description:
Go through yelp for reservation. Opens for brunch and dinner. They also own the rock bar across the street. 
Walked in on a Thursday night, busy but don't have to wait too terribly long. 
Sat in the patio with heat lamps, rocking chairs, and people watch! 
Fun drink menu - tried the Pinot noir from Germany and donkey d's hot ass margarita
Fried okra - super crispy but didn't love the green mayo sauce 
Chicken liver Pate - delicious stuff, ask for extra bread. Also came with real Dijon mustard and jam 
Fried chicken with collard greens and mashed potatoes
author: Christina T.

description:
What a hidden gem! Well, hidden for me as I just moved to Bernal Heights and wanted to check out the local food scene; not disappointed! I chose The Front Porch for our family Easter brunch since their menu could accommodate everyone: a vegan, a carnivore, keto- and everyone in between!

We had reservations, which was a great idea, of course, as there was quite a wait without one. We were seated immediately and the service was amazing, especially considering it was Easter. We started with the okra appetizer: it was crispy nuggets of okra with a creamy aioli. We indulged in the mac & cheese, which was the creamiest I ever had with a perfectly broiled top.

My daughter had the vegan dish, which she rated a big thumbs up, while my other daughter had the fried chicken and waffles, which looked sooo good and she reported as AMAZING! Also a very generous portion, so she took some home, lucky girl!

I had the baked eggs & grits. Not just any grits, but grits that had huge chunks of mushrooms with spinach and goat cheese incorporated into them. It was delicious! 

I will definitely be back and highly recommend checking them out!
author: Sheila K.

description:
Ate here with a large group and ordered the Bucket of Chicken. We had some collared greens and garlic mash but man that chicken was bomb.

Currently its the best Fried Chicken I've ever had. Crispy, fried to perfection skin. The meat was super tender, moist and flavorful. I would like to find somewhere that could top this because I can't imagine what that would taste like!
author: William T.

description:
I came here with a friend, and we split the crab hush puppies special and a 4 piece fried chicken dish.

--Food--
I'm not sure about the prices in the area, but felt that the food was a bit on the pricy side for what we got.

Complimentary corn bread--very cute and yummy

Hush puppies--they were delicious! Both my friend and I loved them, and the sauce we had to spread on it (not sure what it is). On the denser side.

Fried chicken--I've read reviews raving about the fried chicken, and the waitress noted that it was the dish that was the most well known. However my friend and I did not like it very much. The chicken was on the juicy side, but did not have much flavor. I didn't particularly like the breading on the chicken-it was a bit on the dry side, and not very flavorful. I was mainly disappointed because I had high expectations. The mash potatoes and gravy that came with the dish was very good, but neither my friend or I could stomach the collard greens.

--Service--
The waitress was very nice, but it was hard to get service. We had to wait over 10 minutes before someone came by with water. I spent half the time trying to catch someone's attention since we were ready to order, but couldn't really see anyone. We sat right by the kitchen and there was only 4-5 groups seated, so I wasn't sure why service took so long.

Overall, it was a decent experience, but I'm not sure I'll recommend the restaurant to anyone, but also won't dissuade anyone who's interested in the restaurant.
author: Elaine Z.

description:
So Southern so Good!  Our first time there and we would go back. Too many yummy choices- will have to return to have the Fried Okra and Short Ribs.  

We reserved through Yelp for 6:30 pm - a perfect time as it wasn't busy yet. As the evening wore on, the place filled up so I'd recommend reservations. Parking is hit or miss - it IS the Mission District and the city after all. 

After ordering, we were served little muffins, then the Fried Green Tomatoes and Deviled Eggs (so colorful and delish!).  Two bottles of hot sauce accompanied these - "The Front Porch Rocks" and "Fucket get the bucket" -not burning hot but gave a bit of a kick. 

For mains, we chose the Chicken and Waffles instantly. Then the Root Beer Beans and BBQ Ribs, and the Mac n Cheese which came bubbling in a little skillet.  Since we were sharing it didn't matter that each dish came out separately. 

The Ribs practically fell off the bones and were so succulent!  The fried chicken was tantalizingly fragrant, and perfectly crisp on the outside, moist and tender inside.  

Though we were beyond stuffed, we had to try the Beignets with the dipping sauces, and the root beer float for the teen. The root beer was not too sweet which worked great w the scoops of vanilla ice cream. The beignets were presented in a cute little paper bag and were liberally sprinkled with powdered sugar. The apricot (peach?) sauce was nicely sweet and tart; chocolate was okay; and the bourbon caramel - whoosh!  Awesome. The beignets however were more air than solid - HUGE air pillow in the middle. So dipping was limited to the outer shell. It was just okay. 

The mains were pricey ($25-28) though not bad by SF standards. Our whole bill not including tip came out to $115 for three of us. 

Have to return.
author: jeannie l.

description:
This place is definitely worth coming back to. I have made reservations using Yelp for 7:45pm on a Friday night. We came about 30 minutes early and decided to check in and surprisingly they got us seated right away! 

It was a full house, we got seated in the middle tables in between the booths and the bar. It's pretty dark in there but assuming they're going with the whole "front porch" theme it was a nice type of ambience. 

The service was great! Our host was super friendly, and our waiter (didn't catch his name :[ ) was so attentive. 

I went with my partner, Jeffrey, and he ordered the 4 piece fried chicken with collared greens and garlic mashed potatoes, which takes 30-45minutes to make btw. I ordered a burger with bacon and their homemade cheese and it comes with their creole fries. I also ordered their baked Mac and cheese. 

We did wait awhile for our food since Jeffrey ordered the fried chicken, but we didn't mind at all since they told us before we ordered that it would take awhile. They did give us some complimentary cornbread which was buttery and soft. After 40 minutes of waiting, the food came! I was happy they brought both our dishes at the same time and it all looked so good!

My burger was... FANTASTIC. It was medium well, my personal preference, the cheese was oozing off the patty, and the bacon was super crispy! It was visually and texturally appealing. Don't even get me started on the fries. I loved the seasoning they used, it definitely had a kick to them.

However the baked Mac and cheese was a bit bland. Nothing exciting about it besides the skillet and the cheesy ness of it. 

I did try Jeff's fried chicken which was crispy and very flavorful. I didn't like the collard greens too much (I don't really like vegetables so take my opinion with a grain of salt) and the garlic mash definitely had garlic. 

All in all, this place has personality, a hipster personality, and tasty good. Would come back again.
author: Jonathan A.

description:
This could easily be a six star restaurant! I loved everything about it. The fried chicken was finger licking good, the sides that accompanied said chicken was perfect. Even the little bit of seasoned popcorn was delicious. The ambiance is relaxed but intimate, and the service was impeccable. Our server was on top of his game and definitely seemed like he enjoyed working there. 

If you love yourself and fried chicken, treat yourself here. We made a reservation on Wednesday evening and thankfully because it became a full house quick. 

I would love to bring family and friends here. Anyone who is a foodie would appreciate the front porch!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
While opposites might attract....they don't always make for great dinning partners per say....me I love Bourbon and Southern comfort food. My girlfriend prefers Soylent ( like can you mix Tito's with that stuff?). I've wanted to come here for years.....and finally convinced everyone to try it!!!!

Front Porch can turn the pickiest eater into a fried chicken junkie...it's that good.

As a matter of fact their apps are pretty delicious too: take the fried Okra and Pickles: each is fried to perfection (okra is hard to pull off) and served with a very tasty aioli.

Front Porch's  version of red beans and rice with sausage is also pretty lip smacking good: Beans are perfectly cooked, rice is light and fluffy with a great flavorful sauce ( not too spicy). The sausage is perfectly smoked...great snap to the casing.

All four of us split a bucket of their famous Chicken....get it. Their chicken is crispy, moist, and not greasy. Is it the best? No way but it's very good.

Creative drink menu with plenty of cocktails, wines, and beers to choose from. I especially liked my Front porch swing cocktail. A lovely bourbon cocktail with essences of fruit.... delicious. We also had spicy ( Donkey D's) and regular Margaritas.... they're strong and flavorful.

Finally I'd pass on the desserts: Beignets we're totally forgettable as was the pineapple upside down cake.
author: David G.

description:
We really enjoyed our time and the amazing food here.
We took reservations ahead of time and were seated promptly, but the booths are on the smaller side!

We got the green tomatoes for appetizers - a great one to start with
Then the group ordered their yummy fried chicken that is made to perfection
We also tried their pork ribs and short rib
The chicken is my favorite and the pork ribs came second
Their servings are a really good size and their mashed potatoes are a great addition !
author: Jad A.

description:
If u want a rich meal where everything is done well and the service is friendly this is a good stop. The fried chicken is the mainstay and it was well prepared. Everything in the menu is pretty heavy from the creamed corn to the macaroni. Heavy and tasty. 

I thought one of the best dishes was actually the pate. Coupled with the nicely done toast it was just a nicely done pate.

Be steady for heavy pours of booze and perhaps a long wait, all though to get some pretty great food.
author: Ian C.

description:
A cute and busy place for some delicious Southern food.

It's called the Front Porch but they only have 2 tables for outdoor seating so that's a little of a bummer. The interior is a little dark but the food is definitely tasty.

Food: 4/5
Fried chicken with gravy and tater tots - good breading, crispy and doesn't feel soggy. The gravy is thick and packed with flavors. The tater tots were really good, moist with crisp. 

Hangover macaroni dish - I can't remember the name but my friend got this and I gave him the basic look but it turned out to be really good. It was like the fancy version of hamburger helpers with the delicious seasoning.

I missed out on the chicken and waffles though. I really wanted to try that but didn't want to wait for 25 minutes for my food but there is always next time because I will be back.
author: Ngoc P.

description: Always a delicious place to eat. Solid portions for a San Francisco brunch place and dog friendly outside seating.
author: Rohan D.

description: The best meal on my trip in San Francisco. Wait wasn't to bad and great food. The Mac n cheese best of the best and the shrimp and grits was amazing.
author: Julius T.

description: This place is like hidden gem, if you are down for southern, soulful food. Definitely recommend sitting outside on a sunny day. Highly recommend beignets (powdered pastry) as a starter, it was really good. Fried Okra was okay, it tastes good but has strange texture to it if you haven't tried okra before. The signature food is definitely chicken and waffle! Waiter said it may take ~ 30min for chicken but it came out ~15-20min when I ordered with the starter. Pulled pork was just basic- it was too much veggies compared to how much pork came in the dish. There are some cute, funny orders on the menu you can give it a try, e.g "feeling so fancy slushie"  Overall, food, service, and little porch outside was good! I would like to try some of their fun orders next time.
author: Adel A.

description:
Was excited for this place after hearing it about from a friend. I love chicken and waffles but was not loving the corn meal in the crust of the fried chicken. I also thought the chicken was a bit dry for me and I can't put my finger on the odd flavor in the waffle mix. 

The other item we tried was the shrimp and grits. Not as cheesy as Brenda's but light and tasty. 

Cute spot. Outside seating available and the chairs were rocking chairs. Don't think I'd come back but I like that it's low key and there was no wait on a Saturday at 11am. Didn't try the beignets but they looked light and fluffy.
author: Lindsay C.

description:
Came for the bucket of fried chicken, stayed for the ...

Ok so the fried chicken wasn't that good. It seems they use the same breading on the chicken and the fried okra, which was also just ok. The cornmeal breading threw me off- albeit crisp, it was laid on pretty thick and didn't pack much flavor.

We also tried:
-fried okra (the aioli saved it)
-cheesy grits and eggs
-beignets (fried too hard)

$29 is pretty good value for a chicken bucket, and they have a cute outdoor area with rocking chairs that would be great for a sunny day--but I think I would rather go to Brenda's Meat and Three or the Hard Knox Cafe to get my fried chix fix.

Let-down.
author: Cindy T.

description:
One of my all time favorites in SF. Not only is the food fantastic, it really feels like you've been transported to the South when dining here (ok, maybe without the sweltering humidity - but I take that as a plus!)

Any place that serves chicken out of a bucket gets bonus points from me.

Highly recommended.
author: Jimmy S.

description:
I came here during dinner for a bachelorette party and enjoyed the service and food. Our table was given complimentary cornbread that was warm and tasty. Some of the things we ordered were:

Fried pickles: a little on the tart side, but were yummy

Fried okra: not as slimy but some pieces were hard or undercooked

Fried chicken: the skin and batter was crunchy and flavorful, while the meat was very moist

Gumbo: could have used more seasoning, but overall not bad

Mash and gravy: tasted good and paired nicely with the fried chicken

Mac n' cheese: creamy, rich, and comforting

Cream of corn: nice side to add that wasn't fried

Overall, I would come back to try their other dishes. It doesn't beat the food I tried in NOLA, but it's the closest I can get to it!
author: Sharon R.

description:
This place was great from start to finish. I loved the cozy atmosphere and all the quirky things to look at. When I told the waitress how cute it was, she told me that our kids were sitting on a Ford van seat!  

Service was very friendly and welcoming.

The menu was just what we were looking for, which was some southern comfort food. When I told the waitress I was unsure about ordering the fried chicken because it came with 4 pieces, she told me I could just order two. That was a great solution for me. The chicken was so good and crispy, just perfect. I also ordered mashed potatoes and gravy. The portion was generous and it was also 5 star. 

My husband had the spicy shrimp and grits, which were really tasty. I didn't try my son's short ribs but they looked so good l and so did my daughter's burger.  

Someone there even has good taste when it comes to music. The playlist was 70s and 80s, which can be really bad or really good. But in this case, I was into it and it kind of fit the whole atmosphere.

For dessert we all had beignets, something you rarely see on any menu. My daughter was excited to see them, since we haven't had them since our last trip to New Orleans. Other dessert options I'd try if I went back a few times are pecan pie and peach cobbler. 

This place is a southern food paradise right in the city!
author: Erika B.

description: Me and my family had a great time here! The host was so nice to my son and we had very good service the entire time. I really like the quirky decor. We tried a lot of different apps deviled eggs, fried okra, fried pickles. The best though was the special fried green tomatos topped with blue crab. It was heavenly. We also had their famous fried chicken it did not disappoint, with greens, garlic mashed potatoes and gravy, and creamed corn with bacon (words cannot even describe how good this corn was---just get it). And finally dessert. The strawberry shortcake was not as good as I expected it to be but the bourbon pecan pie is a must have.
author: Barbara N.

description:
I can't say enough about how great the food is here because I was taught not to eat with my mouth full. 
We have a short list of cities we will take a trip to just for a certain restaurant like Melbourne Florida for Ceratto's Italian Deli and The Front Porch is now on the list. 
Our son always talked about chicken and waffles, chicken and waffles when in college in Florida but I never cared for it. Well The Front Porch must make it right because it is beyond fantastic.
Grits, same experience. Collard green as close to a spiritual experience as I'll ever have. Binets were like sitting at Cafe Du Monde and the first time I've had them outside of New Orleans done right.

Off the beaten track, a hole in the wall, probably the only reasonably priced restaurant in Frisco and a religious foodie experience. All I can add is GO, GO. GO!
author: Joe C.

description:
The Front Porch feels like a dark garage but the food casts some wattage on the table.

The wattage shines +'s:
+ Fried chicken and waffles ($17). Crispy and tender. Finger lickin' good? Ya to some extent. I prefer a little spice to my batter but all parts: breast, thigh, and leg were moist and tasty. The waffle tasted pretty good too.
+ Biscuit and sausage gravy. We were starving and both whetted our appetite. Pretty hefty biscuits. Not flaky but good.
+ Service. First seated and greeted on a Saturday 10AM. Super friendly from start to finish. Coffee refills done timely and check arrived when asked. 
+ Vibe. By 11AM the place was packed. Great for groups who want to slide into booths. Some seats are recycled van seats.
+ Reservations can be made. That's huge. I hate waiting in line.

The wattage flickers -'s:
- Dark. I don't mind working in the dark but if the sun is out, I will take it. Entering a dark diner drains some of the pep in my step.

Great neighborhood gem in Bernal Heights. Glad I tried it and would like to try the other entrees.
author: Ellie J.

description:
I'm so happy to have visited The Front Porch! A friend made a Saturday dinner reservation for seven; we showed up and realized the reservation was actually for the following week! Normally that'd be the end of it and we would have reluctantly left and I don't know, subjected ourselves to sad fast food. But no. Kevin was sympathetic and told us he wanted us to have dinner there. So he made it work, and our group loves him for it. 

The seven of us split two buckets of fried chicken and a few sides, including grilled asparagus and baked mac and cheese. The fried chicken is hands down some of the best I've had! It was flavorful and juicy. The mac and cheese was absolutely delicious, and the grilled asparagus was cooked perfectly.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Another diner, drive-in, and dives goodie that I of course give a go at.

Tucked way in SF with a very dive bar like feel, I was very excited to give this place a go!

Staff was very attentive when we first entered, which was awesome.  By the time we got our food and needed extra utensils, plates, or water they were no where to be found.  Although extremely nice when interacting, they weren't the most helpful.

The food unfortunately fell extremely short for me.  I ordered the "Fried chicken" which comes with 4 pieces of fried chicken, mashed potatoes, and ham hock collards.  The chicken was extremely dry with the breading falling off.  I should have been alerted when it came out rather quickly.  The mashed potatoes had a strange aftertaste that I can't exactly describe.

The HOT SAUCE...I'm a lover of all things spicy and hot sauces.  I was extremely excited to try their house hot sauces, but again fell so short.  The hot sauce had an overpowering smell and after taste of apple cider vinegar that it was off putting.

Little disappointed with all the amazing reviews that it has, maybe I'll try it again in the future.  Currently, huge miss.
author: Victoria K.

description: Ordered the chicken and waffles. I was told that chicken takes about 30 min but I'm used to waiting in lines in SF so I didn't mind. The disappointment came when I tasted the food. Chicken was not well seasoned and waffle had a salty taste. None of it was reminiscent of New Orleans flavors.
author: Karina V.

description:
Walk in the door and get ready to be rolled out. This southern comfort food spot is everything. 

I arrived with my party at around 9:00 with no reservation. They took my name and number. In about 20 mins I received a text and we were sat. 

Upon being sat we were promptly provided with waters and a small corn muffin for each person.

We started off with an small appetizer of deep fried green tomatoes. They come four to an order. They were cooked perfectly. A balance between the crunchiness and sweetness of the tomato. 

We followed up with the 10 piece fried chicken bucket. Warning, this is definitely meant for at least a party of four. We paired it with some mash potatoes and collared greens. 

I loved the mashed potatoes and how they put a pocket of garvey in the middle.

They also have two delicious home made hot sauces available at the table. One more flavorful and another more so just super spicy! 

The chicken was so juicy and as much as my party wanted to finish the bucket. We were defeated. 

We will definitely be back!
author: Nick F.

description:
I love this place. The food is on point, the cocktails are very yummy and original. The chicken is seriously to die for.

They do what they can to help out with big(ger) groups. Service is perfect. 

I always leave here with a very satisfied belly and a slight buzz!
author: Styn V.

description:
Went here for a friends birthday dinner - we had a reservation and were seated promptly. The cocktails (okie dokie artichoke, match man, old fashioned vacation ) were well received and reordered. The cocktail with passionfruit was a little overpowering and the bartender was nice enough to fix it.

We ordered garlic fries and fried okra for apps, which were served with a flavorful aioli and some kickass hot sauce. 

For entrees we got the veggie burger(5*), etouffee - can be made vegan which was great and friend chicken.

The fried chicken was disappointing, we didn't find it to be seasoned as well as the other food we ate all evening and it was too oily , 2 of us shared the 4 piece plate but we barely got through 1 piece each .

The server was very pushy that we order our entrees soon walking by every couple of minutes -  even though we wanted to enjoy cocktails and apps for a bit before we ordered - the restaurant had lots of empty tables so i failed to understand the push. They never came to check if food was good once we got it.
author: Anju J.

description: This place is so fun for brunch!  Shrimp and grits is amazing!  Chicken and waffles was great, even though i'm not a big fan of savory waffle (theirs is cornmeal and bacon waffle).  The cocktail selection is big which is nice, lots of different types of mimosas and harder options.  The interior has that fun dive/hole in the wall decor that is a good conversation starter.  We will be back for dinner soon!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
We got reservations at the time this place opens just because we weren't sure how busy it'd be for a walk in. PS - There's parking in the back! We didn't see until we walked to the front. 

We ordered: Gumbo w/ chicken, Bucket o'chicken, Garlic Masher & Gravy, Biscuits, and Beignets. They give you cornbread and omg sooo good we were tempted to ask for more but we had already ordered some biscuits. The gumbo came out first and gosh was it good. Brought back memories of when I visited New Orleans. I highly recommend getting some! You can def taste all the spices. Garlic masher and biscuit was your typically mashed potato. But let's be real, the star of the show would be the bucket! The fried chicken was super crispy! I thought it was kinda cool how they serve it w/ popcorn too. You should eat the chicken w/ their spicy sauce they bring out. We were going to buy some to eat with our leftovers but forgot, wahh. ):

Overall, I can't wait to come back for the chicken and gumbo! Perhaps we'll even try to the mac and cheese too?! Hehe. Buckets for everyone!!
author: Breanna N.

description:
For a 4 star rating and at 2300+ review count, I was expecting a solid dining experience. Well, I was mistaken because this place wasn't as good as I had thought it would be. 

Rating:
Food-3/5
Value-2/5
Service-4/5

What we ordered:
Collard greens
Mac and cheese
Ribs with mashed potatoes
Burger 
Bucket of chicken 
Libations 
=$150 


Final thoughts: 
Let's just say, I thought this place was just ok, but not "knock my socks off" kinda good. I've had better southern food elsewhere and for half the price. Therefore, the dinner just didn't cut it for me and I'd probably wouldn't recommend going here as a first choice.
author: Briana H.

description:
Fried okra
Hush puppies
Liver pate
Etouffee with shrimp
Shrimp and grits
4 piece chicken 
& we drank water.
=$120 with tax &tip

Came by with no reservations, wait was 45 minutes. Fine with us, we went down the street to go grab some tacos to wet our appetite. The food was just ok, nothing special. The chicken was dried, the gravy was too sweet on the mash and the collard greens had a weird sour aftertaste.
author: Chantha S.

description:
The food is great! The staff were discussing the previous drunken night. Where a waitress described being licked by another employee. 
As well as bleeding injuries from the latest tattoo. 
It was after this that I lost my appetite. 
Another man sat at the bar debating who he should fire. I'd expect more professionalism from the employees to match the excellent food.
author: Lawrence S.

description: This place was on triple D which is why I went. It has a dark atmosphere and plays oldies. The food is sooooo delicious. Must tries Are the fried okra and the biscuits the pork chop is a great meal, and the Mac and cheese is flavorful. Definitely worth a stop if you're in the area!!
author: Denise C.

description: Amazing food, cool vibe, and really nice staff! It's definitely worth the wait if you don't have reservations. We had the shrimp and grits and a roast beef/shrimp po boy special. They were both so tasty and the po boy was so big that we ended up taking half of it home. Can't wait to go back again!
author: Laura M.

description:
Catching up on reviews - that said, The Front Porch is a great restaurant and not to be missed.

We came for a late dinner with our son and thoroughly enjoyed our meal as well as the ambiance of the place. Our server was terrific and we wanted for nothing during our meal. We shared an order of their beignets before our entrees. Our son had the Chicken & Waffles, my wife had the Spicy Shrimp & Grits and I had the Pulled Pork Hash. Everything was very tasty and piping hot.

Definitely will return the next time we are in SF.
author: Dave W.

description: I haven't been here in awhile. I use to come here frequently before Ms. Ollie left to open Ms. Ollie's in Old Oakland. A few things has changed for sure. The service is really warm and attentive. However it gets busy up in this joint. I had the chicken gumbo that I had to send back. The roux was a bit bitter to my liking. The fried green tomatoes were fancy with corn and sauce and the fried chicken was hot and crunchy.  I sat at the bar and thought that I might ear hustle and people watch through the bar mirror. Yeaaa about that.....I was in between a couple looking at their cat on the pet cam...gawd@ the bar really....and these hella rude hipsters that just walked up and sat at the 2 seats on the other side of me. They didn't ask if anyone was sitting there and the bartender had to tell them that one of the 2 seats were taken. The one closest to me takes my menu and gets up and start to look at it even though I requested it again to order something else...where da fuq are the manners. No "excuse me are you looking at that menu or do you mind if I take a look at that menu. Then they are talking hella loud and one starts to open mouth throat laugh....gawd annoying.  The servers are hard working and nice.
author: Stacie J.

description: Came here for a surprise date night. Love the atmosphere and staff was friendly. We went with other couples and decided to try lots of different dishes. OMG loved everything!  Fried okra, bacon wrapped dates shrimp and grits, green beans with bacon sauce** a favorite among us all, bucket of chicken
author: Teresa G.

description:
AMAZING food and great service! My boyfriend and I are visiting SF for a week and this place was on our must try list ever since we saw it on Diners, Drive In's, and Dives. I highly recommend making a reservation as it seems to make everything move more smoothly. We ordered the biscuits, the baked mac and cheese, the grilled asparagus (not pictured), and the shrimp and grits.

Biscuits: served with a rosemary butter and some kind of jam. It was so hot and flakey, definitely made to order. This ended up being my boyfriends favorite dish out of the ones we ordered.

Mac and Cheese: If you are a mac and cheese fan, this is a must get. I am usually not a fan of baked mac and cheese because the top is usually too crusty and the cheese usually gets hard and clumpy when the dish cools, however this was NOTHING like that. The cheese was creamy and delicious and never got hard. By far the best homemade mac and cheese I have had.

Grilled Asparagus: nothing special but a really good way to balance out all of the heavy, rich foods. 

Shrimp and Grits: Another amazing dish! the shrimp was perfectly cooked and the grits were so creamy. The andouille sausage was also delisiou, and I don't usually like sausage.

The service was also great and very attentive. They were very straight forward about how long it would take food to arrive (most things are made to order so the wait for the food takes a little while). The atmosphere is like a cozy little mom and pop restaurant and the friendly staff adds to that as well.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Great vibe. It looks like a cafe from the outside.

We ordered the burger, and the bucket of fried chicken, which comes with 10 pieces of chicken. We also got the asparagus and the baked Mac n cheese. They were all so delicious! Only thing is that I wish the chicken was a tad bit more cooked! Not saying that it was raw or anything. Just had a little bit of smell to it. But really, it was still good.

The service was great. The servers were a pleasure to speak to. Overall, had a great time!
author: Do P.

description:
First, they were incredibly flexible with my reservation so props to them for that.

Second, they have amazing (and free!) cornbread with yummy butter.

Third, my shrimp and grits (while spicier than I expected) was delicious.

The only thing I didn't love were my mashed sweet potatoes which I thought were going to be yams but I think they ended up being mashed potatoes with sugar. What... Is that a thing? Even if it truly is, the waiter should've known I wasn't expecting that and should have warned me. If I had known, I would've just ordered the regular mashed potatoes. I stole some from my friends who ordered it and the regular mashed potatoes were so much better.
author: Charles L.

description: The Front Porch is INCREDIBLE for large parties! You'll want to book ahead of time, but the staff is super friendly and accommodating. BONUS: the yelp reservation tool works like a charm.
author: Morgan P.

description: I've been to FP on several occasions and they have a above average fried chicken, but their sides and appetizers are excellent. The fried okra, fried pickles, and Mac and Cheese are really scrumptious. There short ribs are above average as well as their shrimp and grits. The gumbo is very average. Their biscuits are incredibly flaky, moist, and buttery. If their entrees were a little better overall, they would score closer to a 4.5 overall. For the Bay Area, my favorite for Southern/Cajun is Angeline's Louisiana Kitchen in Berkeley.
author: steve y.

description:
The Front Porch is a restaurant as quaint as its name.  However, the dramatically lit reddish ambiance makes for a perfect place to go on a date.

We had reservations for 3 and were promptly seated upon arrival.  For a Monday, the place was packed.  Service was great:  attentive & friendly. Staff works together.  So anyone was happy to serve.

We really enjoyed ourselves here.  I did find that two of our spoons were dirty but were swiftly replaced.  Our chosen "Porch Bevies" were the "Okie Dokie Artichokie" (an orange bitters bourbon cocktail with a refreshing, hint of sweet taste) and "Donkey D's Hot Ass Margarita" (refreshing cocktail with just the right amount of jalapeno kick).  I deviated to a nice glass of albarino once the food started arriving.  

Our ravenous appetites took over when ordering.  So the overload of fried fare really hit us food coma style towards the end.  Our indulgences:  

Chicken Gumbo with andouille and okra - great flavor but very skimpy in the ingredients which took away from the gumbo's full flavor potential 

Crawfish Hush Puppies - good but more breaded action than crawfish which was barely present.

Fried Pickles - The skinniest pickle slices inside the batter was sad.  I would pass.  The pickles themselves aren't very "dill" either.  The Tabasco aoli was a tasty dip though.

Cajun Boudin Balls - pork & chicken liver with dirty rice and honey mustard dip was full of the meaty flavors.  This one delivers with the honey mustard dip.  

Fried Okra - These were tasty bite sized pieces with the breaded coating used sparingly.  The jalapeno dip could have used more jalapeno is all.

For the entree, we shared the 4 piece fried chicken.  Yummy, yummy, tasty, juicy goodness...and that includes the breast also!  The coating was thick enough with a light flavor not to over power the fresh chicken taste.  Garlic mashers were satisfying.  The collards greens were decent.  I didn't taste any ham hock though.

The other main entrees look enticing.  There is a pleasant, upbeat energy to the atmosphere conducive to fun.  I would love to eat at The Front Porch again!
author: Elizabeth S.

description: It was ok. A bit disappointed that the fish fry was overly salty. The batter on the fish was the exact level of saltiness that you get with dumping a ton of salt on movie theater popcorn. The fries were equally as salty. Stick to the sides which are a meal in itself.
author: D M.

description:
If you're thinking of how to #treatyoself, what could be better than Southern food?  Comforting and homey, greasy and heavy.  Mmm mmm mmm.  That was exactly my line of thought this weekend, so I looked up a good chicken and waffle place, and Yelp pointed me to The Front Porch.  Thank God it did.

The chicken was quite tender and juicy - not bland but if it's not flavorful enough, they have a nice hot sauce too you can lather on.  You get three pieces of Mary's sustainable chicken along with a huge waffle, so it's quite a meal.  The waffle was almost just perfect, made with cornmeal and bacon (how can you go wrong with that combination?!).  I only wish it was a little crispier on the sides, but that's just me.  Once you leave the chicken on top for too long it can get a wee bit soggy from the steam.

Note that you do have to wait about 25 minutes for the chicken and waffle though, so get yourself a starter or something to drink while you're waiting.

This front porch is definitely my favorite front porch.  I'll be back for more when I need some comfort.
author: Helena Q.

description: I absolutely love this restaurant! The environment, is great for a group hang out. The staff is amazing, super sweet, and very helpful. The food was SPECTACULAR!!! The mac n' cheese, the chicken, the corn bread, and the mash potatoes are to die for!!! Definitely recommend!!!!!
author: Maymo S.

description:
This place is a bit overrated in my opinion... 

The food was ALRIGHT. My boyfriend and I got the fried chicken with mac and cheese and the greens. The fried chicken breast was dry, but the chicken leg was good!  Our chicken was on the burnt side. The seasoning could have been better. There was no spice to it, it was just nicely crisped. The mac and cheese were mediocre too. Nothing special. Something I could easily have made at home. The greens were also too spicy. 

On a hunt for the best fried chicken, and this place isn't the place for it. I suggest going to Oakland for some bomb ass fried chicken.
author: Frances T.

description: I just moved to this area and always see this place super busy for brunch on the weekend. So I finally went there. It's a very cool San Francisco styled place. Darker from inside. I ordered fried Okra (I know sounds weird) but trust me it was really good. It comes with a sauce and totally goes with it. Then I ordered a bucket o' chicken and shared it with my husband. It was huggggeeeee. I think 4 people can easily share one bucket, it comes with 10 chicken pieces fried to perfection. They are mostly famous for their bucket of chicken and waffle and chicken. Same thing. It's really good. Nice people, nice staff, tons of parking space.
author: Sumbal A.

description:
Oh my.. everything about this restaurant makes me want to go back immediately.

Recommendations:
* Fried Okra: mindblowing. Who would've thought fried okra would taste so good??
* Fried Chicken (4 pieces with mash potatoes and gravy, popcorn, and collard greens): super moist, flavorful, crispy, and huge portions. Be prepared to share or take some home.
* Shrimp & Grits: shrimp was delicious. Overall balance of the dish was great.
* Freshly squeezed lemonade (sparkling): just right!
* Their sauces are bombdiggity! They have a variety of spiciness levels.

Love the ambiance. Great vibes if you're hanging out with friends and family.
author: Jenny H.

description: I'm a huge fan. Love to get a drink at the Rock Bar and walk over in time for my next drink and reservation at The Front Porch. Always greeted by a smiling face, and love the wait staff. The food is delicious, comforting, and consistent. Pretty much everything you could ask for in a local spot.
author: Bjorn P.

description:
Bruce: are you and MJ free for dinner Saturday night?
Me: of course, what do you feel like?
Bruce: Front Porch? Been wanting to try their fried chicken.
Me: Thumbs Up
Bruce: A bucket of chicken awaits!

Between three people...

Four cocktails 
Fried Pickels
Deviled Eggs
Shrimp and Grits
Porchetta 
A Bucket of Chicken
Collards
Mac n Cheese

Five Stars!
author: James G.

description:
Omg loved this place. My husband and I are from the south so we were really missing some southern comfort when we stumbled upon this place. Got mashed potatoes, Mac and cheese, burger, all the southern comfort foods and it was glorious!

Also loved the vibe, cozy little nook of a place really gives the feeling of being home in a neighborhood spot.

Can't wait to go back!
author: Maansi D.

description:
Came here for brunch on Saturday and was delighted by how good their signature chicken and waffles were. It took about 25min for the food to be served, but it was definitely well worth the wait!

The chicken was crispy on the outside but tender and juicy on the inside. It was super flavorful and well seasoned. The waffle was delicious as well. The portion was huge and I could only finish half of it!

If you're not in the mood for waffles, you can order just a side of chicken as well (or go for the bucket of chicken).

The mac and cheese is a hot favorite as well, but everything soon becomes way too heavy for brunch and you can barely finish the food.

I had a great time, and the food is mighty delicious. Highly recommended!
author: Christina N.

description:
We were able to get in here with a group of 10 on a Sunday afternoon, having made reservations the day before, so massive props to them for taking us in.

Yes, the chicken is amazing. I also had the pulled pork hash which I definitely recommend, it was very flavorful.

Their drinks... not so much. Outrageously priced and under poured. Charging $8 for a quarter wine glass of watered down mimosa was almost enough for me to drop my rating a bit more... seriously, what gives? Picture attached.
author: Annette D.

description:
Never again!
Food: I ordered the New Orleans Style Beignets which were ultimately flavorless. I ordered the country breakfast with fruit and tater tots. I ordered my egg scrambled. My eggs were well over cooked and tasted just like eggs from Denny's.. yuck. The biscuit that came with my meal was hard as a rock and nearly frozen. I asked the waiter to heat the biscuit up for me, and that didn't help at all my biscuit literally tasted like flour. All in all the fruit I ordered on the side was the best part of my meal. 
Atmosphere: This is a very small restaurant! I was only in a party of two so I didn't anticipate on waiting too long, especially because the host said we would be sitting at the bar since we didn't have reservations. We waited at least an hour to be seated. An hour is not that long to wait, but you have to take into account there is no where for you to sit and wait for a table. After waiting the longest hour of my life the host immediately sat us in a table for two outside. San Francisco in March is FREEZING! Host didn't even ask if it we wanted to sit outside. The outdoor seating did have a small heater above only 1/2 of the table, that was on my half of the table, and was on full blast the entire time I was at this restaurant....I couldn't feel even the slightest bit of heat! I was freezing the entire time! 
Price: Overpriced for the quality of food you receive. Substitutions cost anywhere from $2-5.
author: Angelica N.

description: This is my favorite brunch spot in SF. Everything is tasty, service is always great, and the vibes are relaxing. The outside patio is worth the wait on a nice day.
author: Erika K.

description:
Another stellar dinner at the Porch. Wow can't believe it but I've been coming here since day 1. 

Kevin and his gang never let me down. On a cold foggy SF night nothing like a warm welcome, comfy seats at the bar, and the food coma inducing fried chicken. Yeah it's that good. My partner had finger lickin' short ribs - super tasty. 

Only crimp on the evening was a cranky lady in between us and another couple. Poor staff could do nothing to appease her even though she ordered everything on the menu. The poor thing spent all evening eavesdropping and taking photos of her food.  I always feel sorry for lonely people that draw attention to themselves by criticizing what they order at a restaurant.   Oh well, no pleasing some folks.
author: Kenneth S. L.

description: Went on National Fried Chicken Day and so we ordered the 4 piece chicken meal and it was magnificent. Amazing, crispy, juicy! It came with the best collard greens I've ever had and mashed potatoes. The meal started with some incredible corn bread that we wolfed down and we ordered fried okra and the gumbo. The okra was really good (and that comes from a man who is not fond of okra) and the gumbo was incredible. The service from Michelle was also fantastic and she made great drink recommendations! I highly recommend the Front Porch!
author: Roger M.

description:
TL;DR  Hidden gem, super awesome southern brunch order the fried okra or fail at life

The Front Porch is easy to pass up but the rocking chairs in the outside seating should give evidence to a unique experience.  The interior is pleasantly decorated in and eclectic 1970's bohemian fashion evoking memories of the endless summer that California has always be legendary for. Lighting is low so it takes tine to get your eyes adjusted but then the decor makes up for it.  An old school bar dominated the main eating area. This is a brunch post so no libation was ordered today.  The food is decidedly southern.  Being a Texas transplant this of course merited extreme scrutiny so we ordered the biscuits and gravy, fried okra and the country breakfast plate.  

The okra is off the freaking chain. Perfectly deep fried the spicy batter really compliments the  okra perfectly. I haven't had this good an okra since Amarillo. The biscuits are freshly made and not massive monsters most chain restaurants like to put out. The dough is sweet an is perfectly set off by the real white flour gravy.  Southern food test passed with flying colors!

The country dish consisted of tater tots (spicy and stupidly addictive), perfectly done eggs, and REAL HOUSE SMOKED BACON.  WTF?? You can taste the mesquite smoke!  The tots were covered by a bit of spicy chili sautéed onions. We are so coming back here for the ribs. 

A note on the staff.  I never saw the bottom of my bev. This is a huge win. The staff was attentive without  being overly in your face.  An excellent brunch!
author: Hector A.

description: Food was fine not phenomenal.  Best part was being able to reserve for brunch which has become a luxury in sf!!
author: V V.

description:
Out standing food. Great for the family. Service was good. 

We had chicken and Waffles and shrimp and grits. Both were better then average.
author: Adam W.

description: The people is so welcoming. Super chillax spot to grab a drink or get food drunk.  Either way.... you cant lose. Reasonable prices. Parking can be a problem, but... your in San Francisco.  Its a problem in general.  Make sure you make reservation. And come early to find parking and give yourself time to look at the menu and drink menu. This place won 2nd place for their bloody mary.
author: Amy D.

description:
My friends & I finally made it to the Front Porch & we were so impressed! Definitely should make a reservation, the restaurant is very small. 
Our server was so funny & friendly. Made our experience even better.

There were 5 of us so we went with:
2 orders beignets - Very fluffy!
Shrimp & Grits - Prawns were cooked perfectly & the grits were very cheesy & creamy! YUM
Tater tots 
Chicken & Waffle - Perfectly cooked chicken & freshly made waffle. The waffle wasn't too sweet as well.
Biscuits & Gravy - Delicious!
Flounder Po'Boy - I was pleasantly surprised, so good! Fried flounder to perfection & the bread was so soft! 
Hangover Helper - MY FAVE! Fancier take on the ever so cheap but delicious Hamburger Helper! The sauce was so yummy & the egg on top was an added bonus. I loved Hamburger Helper as a kid so this dish totally took me back. 
I can't wait to come back to the Front Porch. I love brunch & this is the perfect brunch spot! Cool hipster vibe with delicious food!
author: Nari M.

description: Extremely friendly service. Make a reservation because it gets busy. Food was delicious with a fun atmosphere! A unique place to go for some comfort food.
author: Reese V.

description:
Been here with friends a handful of times recently because it's roughly between our neighborhoods. 

It's always a bit more expensive than I expect for how casual and comfort-foody it is, so we usually stick to the buckets of chicken, which scales a little better for our budget. On a recent trip we learned you can add pieces (such as to split evenly among an odd-sized group) for a few dollars per. 

Despite the cost, I know I'm in for a reliably tasty meal (and drinks!) in a place I'll feel comfortable wearing whatever-- our most recent visit was Halloween, in costume!
author: Krista L.

description:
I went here this past Sunday for brunch. We ordered:

Fried Okra: Not a huge fan, but only cause Okra is slightly slimy. So if you are already versed in the weirdness of Okra and love it... go for it...I'm not judging you or anything....

Bread pudding:
SUPER amazing. It was in the starter section, but this is clearly heavenly dessert.

Veggie Benedict: 
I ask them to add spinach and goat cheese. They really load up on the goat cheese. The bread they use is english muffins. They came with a side of tater tots. I wasn't blown out of mind, but it was pretty tasty.

Shrimp and Grits:
The shrimps are HUGE. We are talking tiger prawns style guys. The grits are tasty too and I am usually not a fan of grits.

My only gripe with the place is the lighting. It is like eating in a cavernous tomb everytime I go. There are no windows in the restaurant. There is a very small outdoor seating area in the front, but all that means in SF is, "Do I want to be cold and have light or warm and be in the dark?" I felt like I was stepping out of a three day binge at a Vegas casino when we left the restaurant. I also feel like this complaint will never be address though, because I am sure the vibe they are going for is dark. 

Other than the lack of light this is a must try brunch spot of SF.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Had the shrimp and grits, Mac and cheese and beignets. Shrimp and grits were awesome, the others were pretty good but we have both had better. Enjoyed the cantaloupe shrub cocktail as well but the tequila cocktail with mint had a little left to be desired. 

Nice and close to Mitchell's ice cream for dessert nearby
author: Byron A.

description:
Review for Sunday Brunch: 3.5

My bf and I came right at 10:00am opening time and chose outdoor seating since it was nice and sunny. It looked kind of dark inside and this place IS called the Front Porch right. The outdoor seating was great today and has rocking chairs which actually weren't the comfiest.

Food:
They have a seasonal menu. Don't ask about the crawfish which has 60+ likes on the front of the photo page, because they didn't have it today :(

1. I did like the beignets though. Delicious and would reorder. It came in a cute baggie with 4 pieces.

2. Fried chicken and waffles- MUST have. It's a 25 minute wait but it's so crispy on the outside and so moist and juicy inside. 

3. The hangover cure- mac and cheese with beef and an egg. I'd pass next time. It wasn't very remarkable.

4. Iced coffee- it was okay. Would reorder if I need a kick of caffeine.

Service was great. 

Overall, I had a good meal. I highly recommend the chicken!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Soul food with a steep price.

My friends and I came to The Front Porch on a Saturday night. Thankfully we reserved before or otherwise we would have had to wait for a very long time. The place was busy and lively, and there was a lot going on. 

Something that bothered me was the poor lighting. It might have been just our table, but I could barely read the menu. My table had to use the flashlights on our phones to even properly read the menu. Another thing that bothered me was the lack of service. There were often times that my table tried to order something or get a refill on water, but the service was not there. This might have been due to how crowded the restaurant was at the time.

Moving on to the food: my table ordered shrimp hushpuppies (deep fried cornmeal) as an appetizer and I personally ordered the fried chicken dinner (4 pieces of fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy, collared greens, and popcorn).

The hushpuppies were disappointing. The hushpuppies were small, and there wasn't very much shrimp at all, and they only gave four hushpuppies for 8 dollars, which is a little outrageous to me.

The chicken dinner though was great. The chicken dinner came with four big pieces of chicken meat. Two white meat pieces and two dark meat pieces. The fried chicken was extremely juicy and the breading was good. In my opinion, this place has really great fried chicken. The mashed potatoes were plain, and the gravy was not good, almost every other gravy I've had with mashed potatoes were better. The collard greens had a very strong tangy taste. Which might be a turn off to some people, but I personally enjoyed them. Also, the chicken dinner came with some popcorn which was fun to eat.

Overall, this place has great fried chicken and collard greens, but everything else seemed average/mediocre. I would recommend people to try the fried chicken, but given the price and quality of everything else it would be difficult to recommend anything else.
author: Anthony Y.

description:
Pretty good food. 

I got the ribs. Probably won't get them again. They we're cooked well, but the BBQ sauce was not great. 

Wife got the fried chicken. It was really good! But the greens that came along with it were awful! 

Neat experience. Doubt I will be back.
author: Jeffrey O.

description:
This is probably the best place to get chicken fried steak. I've never had such a good, flavorful piece of chicken with gravy along with cheese grits before. Everything was for sure on point. 

I originally came here for the crawfish hush puppies but was disappoint to not see it on the brunch menu when we arrived, so for only that reason I'm docking off a star. Aside from that not a single thing was bad. I also got the hangover helper which was good but I think I should have stuck to the baked mac and cheese. 

My friend got the po' boy fried chicken (burger) and was very tasted. I feel like the fried chicken here is very breaded but the batter that it is fried in is a bit different from other places. I think it has more of a cajun spice to it which I really like. I do normally prefer my fried chicken to have a decent amount of crunch but it was a little more than I was use to but it wasn't a bad thing. I would definitely be back at this place and probably try the shrimp and grits along with the hush puppies which they have later in the day. A neighboring table got the shrimp and grits and I literally drooled on myself as they brought it out.

TIP: You should make a reservation online so you don't have to wait super long.

VIBE: It's pretty much a house that was converted into a restaurant/bar. Very cool but I wish there was a bit more lighting inside the joint.
author: Andrew T.

description: You can't go wrong here if you like some of the best fried chicken and tons of soul food! The owner Kevin and his wife genuinely wonderful people! Great for brunches as well and you have to try one of their famous bacon rimmed Bloody Marys!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Made an online reservation super last minute, i'm talking 30 minutes before I even headed out the door. I've never eaten inside of this place, it always seemed too busy so I usually take my order to go. I booked the reservation and was in just like that. The wait staff here was super nice and attentive, even with a packed house. My husband and I started out with cocktails, and boy were they good. They ran out of liquor for one of our drinks and recommended to switch the ingredients around a little bit, but it still ended up great. 

We ordered quit a few things for the two of us. Crawfish hush puppies, fried okra, gumbo, the chicken meal, and the shrimp and grits. I honestly would come back specifically for the grits. They are so damn good. I recommend it highly if you're into grits. 

Everything else was mediocre. I'm not a huge fan of their fried chicken, just because i'm super picky and specific on how I like mine, but the flavor of it isn't bad and I can see why everyone comes back here for it. The rest of the food isn't even really worth the review. Ill just put it in a way that I just probably won't be ordering any of those items again. 

Those grits though. I'll come back for those, definitely.
author: Karen T.

description:
I am extremely surprised by all the reviews. My review is mainly of the fried chicken and mac n cheese. Their fried chicken was disappointing. It was bland and the skin tasted like it was fried twice. It also tasted a bit burned. The chicken itself was juicy but I couldn't ignore the taste of the skin. 

The mac n cheese was recommended by many reviewers and even the waiter. Unfortunately, it was also bland and nothing special. 

My friends and I weren't impressed. We all agreed that it's an upscale KFC. The prices were ridiculous for the quality. Then again, it is in a good location and the restaurant is a nice hang out spot for friends and family.
author: Ala M.

description:
Great food, great bartender (thanks, Joey) and over all a great experience . 

I def plan to come back buuut with friends ! 

Cheers !!

Dan
author: Daniel H.

description: This place has the best by far, fried chicken in town. The biscuits are also very tasty. I suggest that you get a reservation because it is a very small place that gets crowded real fast. They have very nice staff and I really recommend you go there.
author: Alexthebest 8.

description:
The Front Porch has been around for a long time and still remains a spot for good food, good service and a fun time.  This is a neighborhood spot that reflects the surrounding area.  It's funky, fun, doesn't take itself too seriously and contains hidden gems behind the simple porch setting outside.

I had my eye and stomach on the spicy shrimp and grits.  It's one of my go-to dishes, especially when I'm in the South so I was eager to see how the Front Porch interpreted this dish.  My friend ordered the 4 piece fried chicken, which came with mashed potatoes and collard greens.

The shrimp and grits were creamy and dreamy.  I thought the dish was boldly flavored but not particularly spicy.  I did add some hot sauce to the dish.  The shrimp was tender and fresh.  There were pieces of andouille sausage in the gravy.  I would definitely order this dish again.

The fried chicken was okay.  I only tried the breast meat and found it juicy and tender.  The crust clung to the meat and was well seasoned.  While it wasn't my favorite it was still quite good.  The potatoes were okay but needed the gravy.  The collards were well prepared.  I could have eaten another portion of them.

I ordered the French Quarter cocktail, which I found refreshing, elegant and not too boozy.  My friend ordered the margarita, described as "hot ass".  Indeed, it was darned spicy!  Buyer beware.  This drink definitely has a kick.  

The room is dark and the room can get loud.  The tables are on the smaller side so folks will get to know their neighbors.  I saw families with young children, groups of friends, couples on dates with what appeared to be a mostly local crowd.  

Parking nearby was not that difficult.  It's a good idea to make a reservation as the restaurant was full the entire time we were there.   Another solid SF neighborhood gem.
author: Melissa L.

description: Nice location. The restaurant literally looks like someone's home- and guest are entering on a street level basement. But hey it's SF- so quite normal. Keith the owner greeted us at the door and escorted us to our seats. They have happy hour until 630, our reservations was 615- we arrived a little late (625) - but the waitress and Owner were so gracious they gave us a happy hour appetizer, and a round of house wine (happy hour priced). We tried the ribs, shrimp and grits, fried chicken. flounder, Mac and cheese, hush puppies, and the brownie with vanilla ice cream. Of the dishes the most memorable was the shrimp and grits, Mac and cheese, flounder, ribs. The hush puppies were DRY, the friend chicken wasn't seasoned well, we had to send the brownie back because it was ICE cold. Overall the atmosphere is quaint, cozy with great music playing in the background. The food is decent - I would likely return to try place for a second time.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Ambiance: dark, casual
Service: good! Prompt and friendly
Food: 5 people

- fried chicken: crispy, tender & juicy! The bucket came tasty pop corn
- friend okra: crispy and light
- Mac and cheese: creamy and tasty
- asparagus :  well cooked ! The cheese was a nice touch
- chicken gambo: sort of smokey. I've had better
author: Mily W.

description:
this place was a nice little hidden gem. fairly small restaurant with an eclectic/cozy ambiance. 

the food was really tasty but i felt like it was a bit overpriced... or it could be that the ambiance was rather casual so i felt like the prices would be cheaper. nonetheless the food didn't disappoint. 

we ordered quite few different things- fried chicken bucket (good & very moist but flavoring didn't knock my socks off), short ribs (very tender&flavorful!), beans/rice, shrimp/grits (would re-order!!), cheesecake & a couple other things that i can't recall (must've not been too memorable)

overall, i liked the food here but didn't feel like it (or the ambiance) justified the price. also, i feel like i've been to some hole in the wall southern restaurants with better food/prices. parking is also rather difficult. i may be back .
author: Lauren E.

description:
Great little space. Yummy Food. Make sure to make reservations

We came here on a Friday night. Make sure you make reservations or else you'll be waiting in the cold. The hostess/carry-out podium is right inside the door, so there isn't any standing space. You will have to wait outside. The porch does have a few rocking chairs, but they were full when we came by.

We were seated right away and brought a couple pieces of baby corn bread. It came with some whipped butter. 

For a starter, we ordered the deviled eggs with bacon bourbon jam. If you notice the pricing, it costs $6.66. Very cleaver. The deviled eggs were good. The flavoring is all in the bourbon jam. 

For dinner, we shared the fried chicken: 4 piece. It came with garlic mashers & gravy and ham hock collards. I've had my fair of southern cuisine and I am really impressed with the flavors. The chicken came with 2 larger pieces, a wing, and a drum. The outside of my first piece was flavorful and crispy and the inside was juicy. My second piece was a little different. The juices from the collards had leaked over so the skin was soggy, but the inside was still juicy. 

I also tried their hot sauces. The red/orange one was tangy like buffalo sauce. The yellow one has a slow heat. The more you eat, the hotter it feels. 
 
The only reason this wasn't a 5 star experience was where we were seated. We were right by the kitchen and they have an open window for food. It was very hot and we were constantly overwhelmed by the grease and smoke coming through.
author: Junella T.

description: Great place if you enjoy glass in your wine! Came here for my birthday and my girlfriend got an extra treat in her drink. The mildly apologetic attitude of the staff and the mediocre food did not make up for it. Be careful.
author: Colby S.

description:
I really wanted to give this place 3.5 stars but I rounded up since I'd go back to try other items in the menu. The front looked cute and had water bowls for your dog. The service is a bit slow, and since I'm a firm believer in good service when you go out to a sit down restaurant, I didn't think it measured up to other restaurants that are in the same category. It was a bit overpriced considering the menu items. I also personally don't think it's helpful to tell your customer that everything is good when they're trying to narrow down their options.

Anyway, we started with the fried green tomatoes. They were delicious. The sauce that was plopped on top was a bit overwhelming and given in excess, but it tasted fine if you scraped some of it off.
