One of us ordered Shrimp and Grits with Andouille Sausage Gravy. The dish comes steaming hot with creamy grits, four tender jumbo shrimp and a good portion of andouille sausage in the gravy, which has a pleasant level of heat. If you want it hotter you can always add their house hot sauce. 

Also ordered was the Vegan Breakfast a mix of vegetable with crispy grit sticks. It's a generous portion and our friend really enjoyed it. 

I think I ordered the best breakfast dish:  Baked Egg and Grits with Spinach, Mushrooms, Goat Cheese and Bacon Crack. This arrives in an individual cast iron pan. Be careful, it's really hot. The sunny side egg sits atop creamy Grits that are enriched with the goat cheese and hide the morsels of mushrooms and Spinach. The caramelized, slightly sweet bacon is scattered on top of the dish. Each spoonful is different, depending on what combination of the ingredients you get, but each mouthful is pure comfort food. 

The service and food are terrific. The restaurant has a very high noise level making it harder to hold a conversation, but it's ok to just silently commune with such delicious food. If you want to chat walk down the street to Mitchell's ice cream and talk while treating yourself to another mainstay of the neighborhood.
author: Gail N.

description:
Came here on a Monday night right at opening, it was not crowded and we were seated as soon as they opened the doors.  I agree with some of the other reviews that this place is UNUSUALLY dark! lol  At the time was fine since we had been out in the sun all day and it was a particularly hot day so being in a dark sort of underground feeling environment was welcoming at the time, but under normal circumstances I don't think I'd enjoy it much-unless I was only there to drink at the bar...then the dark is always weloming. :)

As for what we WERE there for, which was the GRUBB! We were really disappointed with our meals, here is what we ordered; 

boiled peanuts- good, but overpriced @ $6 for a large handful of boiled peanuts

deviled eggs; 4 eggs, I think they were $8 ?  The eggs were okay, they came on top of a sour pickle which had a nice flavor, but they were a tad bland. 

Ceasar salad: The lettuce was fresh, the dressing (what little of it there was) had a good flavor, but the salad was small & didn't have enough dressing to cover all the leaves...again no flavor. 

4 piece chicken dinner: Everyone else seemed to think that the chicken was awesome, but I found it to be VERY bland-as if it was simply rolled in plain flour and fried...The chicken was juicy, not dried out, but had no flavor at all.  The collards were good, tangy, tasty.  The supposedly "garlic" mashers were just mashed potatoes no garlic flavor at all.  The popcorn was fine, but I wanted food, not popcorn..

Fish fingers with fries: This should have been an easy home run, but the fish fingers smelled "fishy" & not in a good way.  The fries were good, but the fish fingers were not, only half of one fish finger was eaten.

Shrimp with grits & andouille sausage: This was the most flavorful dish at our table, but it was very overpriced at $22.00.

My group felt that food was very bland, not flavorful at all.  In addition to the food not being very good the prices were VERY high......For people who have milder pallets & a lot of money to burn this would work, but I really need flavor in my food and maybe even a little kick since it's supposed to be Cajun... I think this place has a great ambiance, but the food is not there yet, at least not in my/our opinion.  :(
author: Wendy S.

description:
Fried chicken.  Garlic mashed & gravy.  Corn bread.  Dinner of champions.

Place was totes jumpin on a Thursday night.
We ordered the bacon wrapped fried dates stuffed w goat cheese for our appetizer, & the 4 piece chicken dinner, all to go.  4 pieces of chicken, garlic mashed & gravy, collard greens, corn bread.  Sat at the bar & had a couple of glasses of Pinot Noir while we waited.    

The dates were fantastic.  They don't skimp on the goat cheese either.  Decadent & divine.  Get them!

This was some of the juiciest fried chicken I've ever had.  Really something; extra crispy on the outside while juices dripping from the inside...literally.  There are more than a few stellar fried chicken options in SF, granted.  But TFP is definitely on that list. 

What can I say about the garlic mashed?  They were creamy & garlicky.  I love garlic.  Delish.

The mini cornbreads were an added bonus I wasn't even aware came with.  Also delish.

I'm lukewarm at best about collard greens.  They were nice & spicy, but my heart & focus were all about the fried chicken & the mashed.  I took a few obligatory bites, that's it.  I'll probably forgo them all together next time.

Now about my spy dishes.  AKA...dishes I didn't order or try, but I spied because they were right next to me...

The couple seated to our right both had the much lauded shrimp & grits.  Looked fantastic.  They both cleaned their plates bare.  The best advertisement.

A gal seated to our left had the risotto.  OMG.  The aroma stopped me in mid sentence.  From what I inhaled...divine.  

It's a great space!  Small, lively, neighborhoody.  I want to bring my peeps & take the monster booth at the end of the bar that looks like it could seat 8 people easily.  

Our hostess was fabulous.  It was busy, but she dealt w us in a way that conveyed we are valued customers.  She was professional & nice.  Nice is a four letter word that many hosts/hostesses & waitstaff unfortunately have never met.  Props to her.

TFP is good food & good times.  

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: They make good cocktails and the staff is very friendly but the service is pretty subpar. The first time we went we waited about 30 mins for simple bar food. We thought it was an anomaly so we went back again a few weeks ago. Waited almost an hour for a salad and a burger. Finally had to ask the manager where the food was and suddenly it appeared. The burger was incredibly overcooked but I didn't feel like sitting there any longer for them to make a new one. A burger, a salad, and 2 glasses of wine between 2 people came to about $100. The manager noticed the burger was overcooked and gave us a free glass of wine but frankly we shouldn't have paid for that burger period. I can't justify coming back here after multiple bad experiences.
author: Erica G.

description: Solid Joint!  We came last minute and sat at the Bar for Brunch. Fried Okra - Fast & Good.  We shared the Chicken & Waffles - Spot on! and the Pork Hash....good but not great.. needs some BBQ smoke flavor and spice and it would be crave-able.... BAM!
author: Cameron C.

description:
I've been here a few times before, but today I experienced my first Front Porch brunch, and it met the high standards set by on-point dinners of the past.

I started with coffee, but there are plenty of boozy options ranging from your classic Bloody Mary to whiskey coffee and egg white cocktails. I tried the bloody, and not only was it huge (#value), but also had a unique maple-bacon rub, a special Front Porch flare.

Though it was hard to not settle for my all-time favorite Front Porch dish, Spicy Shrimp & Grits, I ended up being beyond satisfied with the Baked Egg and Grits with Wild Mushroom and Spinach. The dish came out piping hot, naturally, and the skillet was filled with creamy, goat cheese-infused grits, topped with "bacon crack" which is sweeter, maple-like bacon bits. The mushrooms and spinach were not to overwhelming, and I was surprised there weren't more in the dish. 

I'm still drooling thinking about the bacon and goat cheese---these ingredients easily made the dish. The egg was an afterthought, but it was delicious nonetheless. 

Great service and a dog-friendly porch make this spot one of my favorites in the lower mission/Bernal neighborhood.
author: Rachel H.

description: I found this place because of yelp. But seriously I hated it. I went with my boyfriend and we ordered a bucket of fried chicken with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese. I don't know what it was but I just hated the food and I had really high hopes for this place. Like KFC is better than this. I ordered a lemonade and it was way to sour it was damn near too painful to drink but I hate wasting food. I will seriously never come back here. Award winning food my ass.
author: Brenda R.

description:
Really disappointing brunch experience here last weekend.  I'm just not feeling their food or their vibe.

A few months ago, I had a piece of their fried chicken, fresh out of the fryer, and really enjoyed it.  It had perhaps a few too many herbs and such that weren't necessary, but the chicken was juicy and the batter was well-salted.  So, when we were looking for a brunch spot that offered chicken & waffles and biscuits & gravy, The Front Porch came to mind.

I grew up in New Orleans, so I was excited to see some of my favorite foods on the menu - gumbo, red beans and rice, and even poboys using Gambino's French bread!  For two of us, we ordered biscuits and gravy, red beans and rice with sausage, and file gumbo as starters.  We then ordered chicken and waffles and a fried shrimp poboy as our main course.  A lot of food - way too much for two people - but I wanted to try it all.

We got the read beans and the gumbo very quickly...though it took us much longer, like halfway through our meal, to get water (we had to ask three times).  The red beans were awful.  Gummy and thick, sort of sweet and tomato-y....they tasted like old baked beans over rice.  The ratio of beans to rice was also way off.  There was much too much rice...  The gumbo was lukewarm and flavorless.  It needed a LOT more salt.  The meat was mealy and overcooked - plus, there was hardly any of it.  The okra was also overcooked and slimy.  I generally don't understand putting okra in a chicken/sausage gumbo...  The biscuits and gravy - arguably the fastest item to slap together - did not come out.

Next, my poboy arrived - not with my boyfriend's meal as we had requested.  The bread would have been good if not stale.  There was little to no remoulade. The shrimp were fried using the same batter as the chicken, which has too many herbs that just aren't thematically appropriate.  Plus, the batter is too thick and overwhelming for shrimp.

The chicken and waffles came out next.  Still no biscuits and gravy...  The chicken was very disappointing relative to my first experience.  It had hardly any flavor.  The quality of the chicken was still good, but it was just so meh tasting.

The biscuits and gravy finally arrived - last.  They were TERRIBLE.  The Front Porch biscuits are actually scones.  They are so hard and dense, you nearly need a knife to cut through them.  They're basically the type of "biscuits" that colonial settlers used to carry with them on journeys from England to the "New World" because they were rock-like enough to stand up to seawater for months...  The gravy tasted awful.  It didn't have any sausage in it, it was very under-salted, and it had this weird acidic flavor.  We couldn't place it - but this was not biscuit gravy.

Across the board, everything was bland and under-seasoned.  To make matters worse, the service is scatterbrained and the restaurant is oppressively dark and gloomy.  I won't be returning...
author: Tay H.

description:
Great service. Waitresses were attentive and friendly.

I didn't care for the breading on the okra appetizer- it was thick and too hard. Same goes for the fried chicken. It wasn't thin and crispy. It was thick and fell off the chicken when trying to eat it.

The ribs were smothered in too much sauce.  Way too much bourbon flavor too. The beans had good flavor.

Just not my kind of food I suppose. I like other fried chicken restaurants. This one isn't for me.

The restaurant was very cold too and drafty. Especially with the front door opening so often.
author: D R.

description: This establishment is truly something unique and special. Literally when I walked through the door, I was greeted, seated, and served as a family guest! Kevin, Kenny, Mundo, and of course Xtina, the most gracious hostess in town. I have no filter for patronizing but that is not what you are going to get here. You are going to get a family of staff who care more about you hearing your table conversation clearly on Thirsty Thursdays instead of being sat in a preset spot. This was amazing! Memorable moments with the staff are just the introduction. The food! Wow. Ok so this Thursday they had one of the newest featured U.S. manufactured gins' (Blue Coat Gin) on special in three different ways. Mine featured an amazing pineapple slush along with a lovely edible flowers. Then I was pleasantly surprised by a veggie burger on the menu, along with many vegetarian options for the menu staples! Also, no request is ever denied, only configured to work for you, MY FAVORITE PHRASE IN THE CULINARY WORLD. First out vegan red beans & rice... hands down best I've had, and yes I used to live in the south. Next the veggie burger, Cajun fries, baked Mac were enough to set up the night! The seasoning makes up for any meat withdrawals you may have from the veggie options. That is amazing cooking. My party had the famous fried chicken with garlic mash, veggie collards, and of course the ever so clever kettle corn that resembled an improved version of chicken & waffles. Lastly, cast-iron upside down cake completed a perfect night. Cheers to my favorite pub and *publican in South Mission! I will be back for more ;) BTW come with an open mind and be ready to feel comfortable and ready for a great time.
author: Mahdiah A.

description:
Front Porch is the perfect place for really good, heavy comfort food. Fried okra, chicken and waffles, biscuits and gravy, beignets, mac n cheese, etc. Everything was super delicious and the service was great

The only thing I didn't love was the actual restaurant space. It felt cramped and it was very dark inside. Wish they had better lighting. 

On the bright side, it's super close to Mitchell's so you can walk down the street from some ice cream after.
author: Angela T.

description:
The ultimate comfort food that leaves you yearning a fast return..after losing the few pounds you gained that same dinner night.

Great selection of appetizers and the most memorable being the crab hush puppies! Other appetizers such as the fried okra was pretty good too but the fried pickles on the other hand was too salty. We also ordered their shrimp and grits which I enjoyed quite a lot and would order again along with their fried chicken. Now speaking of their fried chicken, I thought the crust was perfectly flavored and the meat was definitely juicy. Not the best chicken I've ever had but definitely high up there!

Overall great customer service, great food, and great vibes all around.
author: Kathy L.

description:
My friend and I ended up at Front Porch because we were looking for a dog-friendly restaurant. In particular, we were looking for a spot with patio seating and heated lamps because it was a chilly evening. The patio seating at the front of the restaurant is a really neat concept because you sit on rocking chairs. If you end up sitting on the rocking bench, be nice to your neighboring diners and don't rock them too much while dining!

The space inside was packed and rowdy while the patio seating was cozy with the heat lamps, warm blankets, and pretty lights. In true southern hospitality, service was great as the waitress even brought a container of water for my friend's dog. 

I'm a bit conflicted since I loved the space but the food wasn't anything to write home about. 

+ Crawfish hushpuppies: a bit too dense for my liking. I couldn't really taste the crawfish. (3/5)

+ Fried okra w/ jalapeño aioli: I was expecting a more crispy okra but it's only partially breaded. (3/5)

+ Shrimp & Grits: good dish but could use a bit of cheese. (3.5/5)
author: Ruby C.

description: Amazing! All the food was fresh and made to order! The drinks were potent but not gross. The food read very flavorful and everyone enjoyed their meal.
author: Tonice J.

description:
This is such a cute, little joint.
We made reservations for a Saturday night & WOW, parking is no bueno dude.
There is a Safeway that EVERYONE & I mean EVERYONE was parking at & it doesn't seem to be regulated so we ended up taking our chances. I do not recommend it as I'm sure they will for sure start regulating.

There is no waiting area, you walk into the building & there is a table right there. Like I said, super cute ambiance.

We were seated towards the back, where we could see the cooks. It was pretty cool. 

They had cute little candle lights on each table & the lighting is pretty dark, SUPER ROMANTICAL :)

They gave us corn bread to snack on before they took our orders.
They provide you with glasses along with a glass pitcher so you can fill your own water which is an idea I think a lot of restaurants should adapt. Just sayin'

I ordered the Farmer's Vegan which is ansom mills farro verde with delicate squash, dino kale, brussel sprouts, caramelized onions, pumpkin seed oil. It was pretty good :) Not a big fan of squash but I enjoyed it.

Larrs has some baked Mac & Cheese that came with his order of Fried Chicken which also came with Garlic Mashers with gracy & Hock Collards.
The Mac & Cheese were bomb!
The collards were a bit salty for my taste but still good nonetheless.

All in all, it's a cute little romantical place. I'd definitely recommend making reservations.
author: Camille C.

description: Food was average, yet pricey. There was one bartender on a Saturday night, so needless to say, the drinks were slow and poor waitress kept apologizing.  The best thing about it was the waitress...she was so sweet and very attentive. Also, the restaurant is super small and only one bathroom.
author: A D.

description:
Make reservations.

Ok, now on to the review.

It's a small, dimly lit bar type of restaurant.  A few outside tables (I didn't see any heaters so it may be a little chilly) and some tables inside, as well as a long bar.  Not a ton of space and yes it does get totally booked full. So Make reservations!

I didn't try to the thing that most people talk about (fried chicken) because it's not my thing, so this review is about other food...

Gumbo: nice size bowl portion with a healthy scoop of rice.  Great big pieces of okra, chicken and sausage.  I would have liked a little more tomato-y flavor but if you like the smokey flavor, this one is totally for you.  Rich and smokey flavored gumbo.  Yum.  Could have used a little more salt too, but by no means was it bland.

Beans and rice, with meat: Yes, you can order beans and rice vegan, or you can add sausage (+$2).  And when you add sausage, they are generous with that andouille sausage!  The rice and beans have so much flavor you don't even need the meat.  This was a great dish.

Ham Hock collard greens: I wish I could have passed on this. It was really soggy and vinegar-y.  Didn't have a rich meaty flavor either.  Honestly, it didn't taste like any meat was cooked with it and it tasted like they just doused it with vinegar.

Shrimp and grits: tasty dish, big portion!

Bourbon pecan pie: this is a sweet tooth heaven.  It's sweet sweet sweet sweet.  I got it with ice cream instead of whipped cream and it needed the ice cream to cut the sweetness. If you like sweet pecan pie, get this!  I can't imagine what it would have been like if it came as advertised with chocolate sauce on it too.

I'd come back, but sadly I won't be getting those collard greens.  Sigh.

Single sex single bathrooms in the back.

Accepts major credit cards.

Street parking.
author: Traci H.

description: The fried chicken is fantastic. The biscuits were ok. Reservation recommended!
author: Ankit A.

description:
"Hunny, let's go do brunch on Sunday!?" 

...is what I said to my boyfriend a few days before Sunday when we decided to go visit The Front Porch for brunch. I happened to get my shift covered from work so I was off during the daytime which made it perfect timing for brunch time.

I had made reservations thru OpenTable for 12noon. Upon arriving at the place, there were a few groups of people waiting for a table. We informed the staff that we were here & after a wait of about 15mins, we were seated to a table. 

We had the Chicken & Waffles, French Toast, Beignets,& Sausage and beans. All were pretty good, but the fave would be the beignets. I also had the mimosa which seemed pretty strong, but it just may be that since I stayed sober for a year. My taste buds are still getting used to alcohol. Lol

Service was friendly and the vibe/look of the restaurant was definitely the cozy & southern-like. Parking can be found on the streets in the residentials or in the Safeway parking lot in the back of the restaurant.
author: Amy C.

description:
Made reservations, but came here 10 minutes ahead of schedule. Still got seated at time reserved. As we were seated, the server didn't stop by at all, until we flagged her down to order. After she took our order, she brought a small bowl of grit for my younger son (because he didn't know what it is). That was nice of her.

After she brought us water and the small bowl of grit, not a peep for 30 minutes. Again, I had to wave someone down to ask about our order. We were told "It'll be a few more minutes, we had a huge order right before you." Didn't get our food until 5 minutes later. I was not happy about the wait (35 mins) for the food.

Oh right, the food. Meh, disappointing as well. I ordered the SPICY SHRIMP & GRITS. It was satisfying (mainly because I was super hungry by then), but nothing great. The grits had a good consistency, and went well with the gravy. The Mister had STONER STEAK. Boys ordered the COUNTRY BREAKFAST and CHICKEN FRIED STEAK. Both standard, nothing spectacular. All their dishes came with potatoes, which was luke warm and bland. The food we ordered really shouldn't take that long to prepare. Overpriced food, if you ask me.
author: Em T.

description:
The hostess was rude, and wouldn't seat us because our party wasn't complete.  I thought that particular part of horrible restaurant behavior in SF was gone - but not here.  

Fucket get a bucket?  Ewww.  This chicken is just plain icky.  Strange off-taste that was really peculiar - and none too pleasing. The hushpuppy was good; the mac and cheese fair (at best).  But the chicken was weird.  Worst part was it kept coming back for the rest of the evening.  You know how when food is not good going down?  It's NEVER BETTER coming back up (with gassy, flavorous burps). We made the mistake of taking well over half of the bucket home with us; when I took it out of the frij this morning I was assaulted with that strange smell that permeated the meat.  Gag me with a spoon indeed.

The wait staff was very pleasant and helpful.

Deserts?  We had the first 4 items on the menu, and the only thing that was got acceptable scores from my group was the Beignets.  The dark chocolate was horrible (unanimous opinion).
author: Neveryou M.

description: I'm from Sacramento and This place is awesome clean atmosphere nice lighting a lil dark but ok candles everywhere good customer service and the food was to die for !!! The Mac and cheese stole the show the fried chicken was moist and crispy the mashed potatoes were creamy and peppered to perfection.. and the hush puppies were so soft and tasty I will most definitely come back and eat here
author: Anthony M.

description:
This place is good, but small-- so make sure you either come here early or you call ahead for a reservation! I went here for mother's day (mom loves southern food) and we had the crawfish hush puppies (delicious, a bit dry on their own, but there's a lot of sauces you can dip them into from your own food or you can just put hot sauce on it), gumbo (of course, delicious), an order of fried chicken, the fish (I think it was a salmon or something? My memory fails me, but it was a big hit) and some sides (collard greens, macaroni and cheese). 

So good.
author: Lai-Nin W.

description:
Not sure if other items on the menu taste better, but my shrimp and grits was so mediocre. I believe there were 3 shrimp in total. The flavor of the dish was so underwhelming and the andouille sausage just didn't taste good. I've been spoiled by Brenda's. The runny poached egg on top was tasty though. It was also quite expensive for brunch. The chicory coffee was decent. 

This place looks like a dark bar inside which it is,  but they are also a restaurant.
author: Ali F.

description: Terrific southern food and amazing cocktails. Love the chicken and shrimp. Parking relatively easy compared to elsewhere in sf.
author: Ivan Y.

description:
Overpriced, overcrowded, and a rude waitstaff to boot.

I had been meaning to check this place out for awhile as I really really really like fried chicken. Decided to meet a first date at this restaurant and was left angry and still hungry by the end of the night.

I went in at exactly 7pm, the time I made the reservation for, and told the hostess I had a reservation but didn't think my date was going to show. (she was late and not answering her phone). The hostess cut me off before I could finish and told me to sit at the bar until my date shows up. Now......I've been stood up before, and switching the reservation from a table to the bar in this situation isn't abnormal, but the bar was full except for a small slice of corner and my table I had reserved was sitting there empty....if I had wanted to sit at the bar I would have suggested it, I didn't need the hostess to as rude as she was. unacceptable.

At this point I seriously thought about leaving but was also really hungry. after sitting at the bar for 15 minutes a waiter finally asked if I wanted to order a drink, I asked for a menu and then waited another 10 minutes for someone to take my order at which point I was asked if I would like to eat at the bar or a table....yeah, how bout that table a reserved for 30 minutes ago? 

Obviously I wasnt happy and they picked up on that, I was placed at a table in the middle aisle of the restaurant and was bumped into every time and of the waitstaff walked by, knocking my coat on the floor a few times....just all in all unbelievably rude service.

Onto the food!!!
It was MEH. There are so many places in SF that serve better fried chicken, blue plate, hard knox, farmer browns....the list goes on. The pieces of chicken were small, the taste was bland and unremarkable. add this to the ridiculous prices, rude waitstaff, and overly loud environment....this places sucks, don't bother. If your in the neighborhood go to blue plate, they are right around the corner.
author: Kip E.

description: I had planned a special dinner and a play date with my dad and kind of just picked the Front Porch blindly and had never heard of it prior. Unfortunately I ended up sick so I sent my mom on the date with my dad instead. My parents continue to rave about this place. Guess my gut feeling was correct. Thanks for giving my parents a fun night out!
author: Becca B.

description:
All around AMAZING. I was looking for a restaurant that was not only reputable for being outstanding on Yelp, but one that could accommodate a large party of 8! I called various restaurants around SF and even ferreted around OpenTable! Alas, so many rejected me and told me in haste that the largest party they could accommodate was 6. Luckily, I found The Front Porch and I am so thankful I did! 

The food and service here, absolutely impeccable! The food they have on the menu is so unique, we all ordered so many different dishes to try and share. Some of the dishes we ordered were the Fried Okra W/ Jalapeno Aioli, Fried Pickles W/ Tabasco Aioli, Zapp"s Chips & Dips, Spicy Shrimp & Grits, Fried Chicken: 4 Piece, Dr. Pepper Braised Beef Short Ribs, Burgers, and the New Orleans Style Beignets W/ Powdered Sugar. All of us LOVED everything! I would say the biggest hit of the night was the Fried Chicken: 4 Piece though! Selection of drinks on the menu is also pretty awesome! The service here is excellent, our waitress was extremely knowledgable and helpful in helping us decide what to order. Can't wait to come back! Thanks for such a fun time The Front Porch!
author: Debra T.

description:
Came here for my birthday. Made reservations online. Parking can get tricky. There is outdoor seating and inside. Inside, it is a dimly lit, so it's wise not to take you older parents there. 

poke - yum! If you love poke, it wouldn't be wrong to get this dish.  

garlic mash (6.5) - perfect and creamy 

mac and cheese (6.5) - served on a skillet, it is a bit more watery than I prefer and little to no bread crumbs 

Fried Chicken Bucket (29) - they ran out of dark meat this past weekend, so we opted for the bucket of white meat, aka all breast. The meat was not as moist as I was expecting, it wasn't dry, but it definitely needed the mash potato to help...the bucket came with popcorn too, so that was a nice plus. We had left overs and it paired nicely into a spring salad the next day. 

The short ribs entree didn't come with bones. The meat reminds me of a chinese meat dish. It was lacking in flavor. 

I'd come back for the fried chicken again. Hopefully they'll have dark meat too.
author: Jess W.

description:
This place is pretty amazing! They're strong in some areas and weak in others.  The ambiance is cozy and intimate. The seating situation is a little bit messy. They give too long waiting times and take way to long to prepare a table for their next customers. 

I ordered the the Chicken and Waffles and they were fantastic. There were chunks of bacon or sausage both in my waffle and my chicken crust. Amazing! 

Bear ordered the Shrimp and Grits, not so amazing. The grits were bland, runny and just blah. Same for the shrimp which was buried under the grits. 

We ordered Beignets, they were good. 

We also ordered the  Fired Okra Served with Jalapeno Aioli and it has so much potential but it wasn't quite right. The okra was mush, the breading was all falling apart. The aioli was great!! 

I feel like this is one of those places that has mind blowing items on the menu, but you have to find them. I would go back.
author: Melody K.

description:
I'd had The Front Porch on my list for awhile, and after successfully roping in two of my friends who I knew I could count on to indulge with me in fried, greasy Southern goodness with minimal opposition/complaints, I booked a reservation a few days out for a Saturday night dinner.

We ordered the green garlic gremolata fries (with meyer lemon aioli), biscuits, mac and cheese, and of course the bucket of fried chicken. Of these, my favorite dish was probably the fries. Thick-cut fries are usually not quite my jam, but I loved them in the aioli, and the seasoning was great. The biscuits were soft and tasty as well but didn't meet my (Southern native) expectations. Ironically, I'd been most excited about the mac and cheese and the fried chicken, but the mac and cheese was a little bland (and the texture was off--especially the cheese somehow), and the fried chicken--while fried well--ultimately lacked the right seasoning and was probably not worth the years it took off our lives.
author: Kelly R.

description: We have been regulars at the front porch, everyone knows us. The dinner and brunch are very good. I am dinging the restaurant as the woman at the front desk is extremely unpleasant.  Hopefully the restaurant reads this review and does something about it.
author: N.I. G.

description:
Dropped in for a meal during Game 4 and the place was definitely popping. Perhaps too loud for some, but not overly bothersome. Small-ish TV but good enough for watching the game.
Wait staff was incredibly friendly and attentive!
My friend and I both got the burger, as it was pretty much the cheapest thing on the menu. I don't know if this place is actually expensive or if the other entrees are just huge, but we weren't really down to spend ~$25 on each entree. 

No complaints about the food though; the burger was very well made and had a lot of nice flavors going on. Pretty sizeable too, and I could barely finish my fries after devouring the burger. (Fries are awesome too--try it with their ketchup and hot sauce for a great kick)

Didn't try any drinks, but they had a very well stocked bar and it seemed like their cocktails were pretty popular with the crowd.
author: Gautam G.

description:
We stumbled upon this place early one morning after a gym work out, and thought it would be a lovely day to try something new ! I looked up some information and found that it was highly rated, so we decided to try it out. 

First, I would highly recommend sitting outside is it's a nice day and you have the option to. The inside is very nice, but super super dark. Once you leave the building, it's almost blinding outside because of the adjustments that your eyes need to make to accommodate their dark atmosphere. 

It's a busy spot, so make sure you make reservations ! 

I tried the spicy shrimp and grits, and I was worried it was going to be too spicy for me. However, only the sausage was actually spicy, and I wasn't very fond of it. Although the good wasn't spicy, it was so so so good ! It was my first time having grits, and they were amazing. So, major points for making my first grits extra delicious. I wasn't a big fan of their alcoholic mixed drinks, but mostly just because the flavors didn't sit with me. That's not a reflection on them so much as my own taste preference. 

The service was alright. The bartender was super nice, but the waitstaff could work on their attentiveness.
author: Christine H.

description: I've been here a few times, but they were specifically good about a large party I made a reservation for. Customer service was great - they were more than willing to accommodate extra people who showed up who didn't rsvp, drinks were great, fried chicken was better, I'll definitely be back.
author: Mandi W.

description:
I wanted to grab brunch without having to wander too far from home and found that this was only a few blocks away. Just a block off of Mission, the Front Porch has a divey feel to it. When we walked up, a few people were sitting on the rocking chairs outside and we had a quick wait before getting seated. There's little natural light inside leaving it kind of dark and the environment feels more suitable for dinner or a bar. 

While a lot of people seemed to order the fried chicken, the bf wasn't in the mood so we got the sweet potato pull pork hash, hangover helper, and file gumbo. The descriptions on the menu looked awesome so I was really excited. The gumbo came first with a scoop of rice on top. The bf scarfed it down but ultimately declared it wasn't as good as the gumbo at the Boiling Crab. When I tried it, it did seem less flavorful. Then, the entrees came and I was tad disappointed. The Hangover Helper just looked like mac n' cheese with an egg placed on top. The "spicy beef chili" was pretty much nonexistent. I imagined chunky chili mixed into the mac, but it was more like little flecks stirred into the cheese. Despite that, it was pretty decent mac n' cheese and the overall flavor was still pretty solid. Just don't advertise chili if there isn't going to be any! (check out the photo). As for the sweet potato hash, I thought it would be a nice sweet and savory mix that can really work in brunch meals. Unfortunately, that's not what the dish delivered. The sweet potatoes didn't even taste like sweet potatoes and the pull pork was a tad dry - probably needed to be fattier meat. 

Overall, the food was okay but not great. But my expectations might have been too high. I'll need to stop by in the future to get some of that fried chicken to see if my rating could be swayed.
author: Liza X.

description:
After a great first meal at this restaurant, my boyfriend and I took out of town guests here for dinner last night after raving about The Front Porch! Last night was a completely different tale than the first dinner.

One of the fun things about this place is that you can see into the kitchen. Great to see that mac and cheese sizzling! Last night we could also see that there were cooks with longer hair and beards not wearing any type of hair net or protector, specifically a red headed cook with a long beard. 

When our food came (bucket of chicken, macaroni and cheese, greens), my boyfriend found a very long red hair baked into his macaroni and cheese. At a first glance it appeared to just be very cheesy but that was not the case. While completely disgusting, we could deal with a hair if the restaurant is accommodating and apologetic. We had the exact opposite reaction- It was evident that they felt that we planted the hair. "This never happens to us." 

We requested a new plate and silverware. The new plate that was brought was dirty.. The server stopped coming by to check on us or offer more drinks, they only comped the mac and cheese and nothing else with the meal. 

I will be contacting the health department regarding the kitchen policies and would also be open to speaking with a manager regarding my experiences of discrimination and treatment at this location. Very disappointing to have to write this review for a place that I had previously raved about to numerous people.
author: Marie-Therese J.

description:
Make a reservation or else you will literally be eating on the front porch outside. 

The bar has a top selection of spirits, wines and cordials. After starting off with a Hendricks gin & tonic, I preffered to stick with gin but wanted something a little more snazzy. The bar man says well, "we have something that is no longer on the menu. It has champagne an herb rinse, and lime."  Yes, please! They call it the Creole gimlet. Maybe you have to be creole to get one of those hehe It was strong, with an anise aroma but without having that licorice flavor. It was really good. 

While waiting the staff brings out two small bites of cornbread. It was sweet, soft and moist with a few sprinkles of salt on top just for contrast. I'm not 100% sure the garlic butter was an optimal match with the cornbread. There was definitely a fistful of garlic mixed in, so get your kiss before spreading. 

Let me tell you though, the crawfish hushpuppies are spectacular! Big chunks of crawfish steaming inside of a crispy ball with a moist, soft, juicy inside. The aioli spread was perfect to swipe the last bite! 

On a little vent here, but hey folks, please delete that vegan Gumbo!!! That's just disrespectful, plain and simple. That's like telling someone you're going to make apple pie, but use potato's with apple flavoring. It's totally not the same. Gumbo is NOT gumbo without the shrimp, crab and sausage. PERIOD! Clearly I didn't order the gumbo.

I did order the Fried Chicken and Shrimp & Grits. The chicken takes a while to come out when ordered, so you know it hasn't been sitting under a heat lamp. When it does come be ready because whoa nelly! I burned my lip it was so hot! Crispy and moist the way fried chicken is meant to be. It's definitely not oily or over salted. The side of greens were alright - they tasted a little sweet for my liking. Popcorn was a fun touch to the plate. 

The fragrance from the roux from the shrimp & grits made my mouth water before it event hit the table. The bowl is filled with slices of garlic, chives, shrimp and andouille. They were a bit skimpy on the shrimp, 5 altogether and Trader Joe's makes a better andouille sausage. The grits were creamy, buttery and absorbed the roux marvelously. I would like to know where they get their grits from because they were excellent! 

The tables have real flowers on them and the music level is at a nice volume, so you can actually hear the person speaking across from you. Staff was friendly and warm, though not overbearing. When we were leaving we had some pieces of the chicken left to go, so they added a few more pieces in our go box. Creole treat?

The menu is limited and I do believe they run out of items on occasion. There was one on this night but I can't remember what it was. Still, a limited menu means they specialize in those particular dishes. So you know what to expect whenever you go. Will be back to sample more of their dishes soon.
author: Jaylena P.

description:
I was recommended this restaurant in Bernal Heights a long time ago and finally had the chance to try it with really good friends who love to travel for food like me! Reserving this restaurant on Yelp was a synch! 

We got there on a Saturday evening at 6:15p for our 6:30p reservations. We found it easy to find but I do recommend to come early to find parking as its not easy. It's all street parking and small parking areas. You should not bring a big car to the city anyway. Coming to the place it was a regular SF home that had a basement or tandem garage at the bottom of the house that got decorated. Nice idea. The restaurant is literally the whole basement garage floor. Inside was nicely decorated but small and tight. This is not for large crowds. We were five of us and our buddy had to sit at the end with a chair but the servers had to go around him. Many of the tables were booth like seatings. They do have a small bar area but not really comfortable to eat there. They have a few tables outside with ceiling heaters if you like to be outside? The ambiance is casual. It's very dark inside and loud. I had such a hard time to taking pictures! ;p

There front hostess was cool. Our server was ok, too... Lol She looked like a lady wrestler with a very short t-shirt that doesn't seem to fit. 

The menu was a full a page and drinks on the other and it was not a large selection. I was a little disappointed like my friends that came with me! I have heard about this place and have been wanting to go since we went to New Orleans. I had to check if the food was the same. We ordered the below:

Drinks:
Chocolate enojado - was good
Beers

Appetizers:
1)Deviled eggs with bacon-bourbon jam - ok but needs more flavor. I can make it better than this?!
2)Fried okra with jalapeño aioli - was very good
3)Crawfish hush puppies - all bread and barely any crawfish like the pictures I saw on Yelp. What happened?
4) boiled peanuts - ok

Meal:
1)Bucket of fried chicken - bucket of 10 pcs was ok size; not big at all. Had a lot of coating but pretty juicy; not worth $29. This came with sides and we got two: 
2)Mac n cheese and - very good
3) Ham hock collards - ok
4)Spicy shrimp & grits - was ok and not even spicy at all. I had to add their hot sauce to make the whole dish taste better! The shrimp was big and juicy thou...I had this in New Orleans and was not even close to it. 
5)Pan fried wild flounder - My friend let me try it and said it was pretty good but to me, the fish was cooked well and the jambalaya at the bottom was only ok; not spicy or flavorful. It did have some fresh greens in it.
6) Gumbo - it was dark but pretty good. I wish the sausages were spicy.

Stars is under three stars. All in all with ok service on a busy night and food. I will say ok place but I don't think I would come back unless someone paid for me! ;-p No wow factor for me! Sorry.
author: Edna G.

description: Loved the atmosphere. Cozy place with super friendly waiters. Food was really good too. Fried pickles were on point. Shrimp and grits were yummy and the fried chicken was a good runner up to Gus's Fried Chicken in Memphis, TN. My favorite was the collard greens. Definitely will come back.
author: Eva B.

description: There was nothing enjoyable about this experience. The table me and my friend sat at was so cramped. It was in the back next to the restrooms with people on either side of us. All I could here were there conversations. And the food was horrible. I got the chicken and waffles. The waffle tasted like Jiffy cornbread and the chicken was bland and slightly undercooked. Then I got sweet tea, which wasn't sweet at all. When I asked the waitress to take it and just bring me I've for the water, she didn't. She brought me ice and more simple syrup for the tea that I answered several times that I did not want. Of course I was still charged for it even though I never drank it. My friend ordered chicken fried steak that was overcooked. He said the mimosas were good, so that's the only thing that this place gets a star for. I, on the other hand paid 31 dollars for cornbread and water. It was 31 because they couldn't split the check by item so I just did half to make it east.  I basically sent my whole plate back and asked for the check. Waitress didn't even make sure we liked the food, which we clearly didn't. I didn't even want anything to go. Definitely don't see what all the hype is about. Before now I didn't think it was possible to have a bad waffle.
author: Tiffany J.

description:
Everything about this place has personality!!!
starting with the food, all the way down to the condiment labels!

FOOD :: 4 stars 
* fried pickles, 5 stars, are always perfectly fried, not over battered, never soggy.  the Tabasco aioli is yummy!
* fried chicken, 4.5 finger licking good!  if you F'it and get the bucket, you also get some popcorn, happy surprise!
* pork chop, 4 stars.  i've only had this three times.  of course the first time was the best, flavor was on par w/Nopa's pork chop.  second time, some parts were way under cooked.  third time just didn't have as much flavor.  i love this dish, just wish the preparation was a bit more consistent, like the chicken
* brunch items, you can't go wrong with anything you order

LIBATIONS :: 4 stars

AMBIANCE :: 3.5 stars
* "cozy" (a word I often use to describe the size of most SF apartments).  careful if you sit at the bar by the door entrance, people will hit your right elbow when passing by.  
* love the retro art

SERVICE :: 4 stars
9 out of 10 times, it's pretty spot on! servers are always friendly and accommodating

TIPS 
* street parking can be difficult
* if you order the chicken to go, it stays pretty warm and doesn't get soggy (at least when we drive back to dogpatch)
* you can buy the hot sauce
* reservations are not required, but better to have during dinner
author: Tina F.

description:
Honestly, the restaurant is super cute but the food in my opinion wasn't worth the price. 
BF and I ordered the bucket of chicken, grits, collared greens, mac & cheese, and gumbo. I personally like my gumbo thick in comparison to this gumbo that was more watery in texture. 
I expected more from the friend chicken.
The food itself was very delicious though, but it just felt like a fancy KFC to me.
author: Margaret K.

description: When you hear Southern food, you know it's good. Unfortunately I could only eat the mash potatoes due to having a wisdom tooth extraction a couple days before. But the group I went with was more than satisfied with all their orders, including mine because that was some good stuff. (Not to mention their portion sizes were on point) I will definitely be back for their other meals when I find myself in SF again. The reason for the 4 star review is the place is a little dark and only really relies on the door opening as the source for light.
author: Robert V.

description: Excellent food, reasonable price, friendly and helpful staff. Best southern food ever. Some felt the greens had too much vinegar but I thought they were fabulous. I made a reservation on Yelp but it didn't go through; they sat us down right away anyway. Such fabulous food. Best part is they are across the street from Mitchell's ice cream for dessert!
author: Isabel B.

description: Great vibe. Service was friendly. Bartender was cool. The drinks were tasty. The food was good. Spicy shrimp and grits. BBQ baby back ribs were tender to the touch. The corn muffins were ok. Sat at the bar. Next time will make reservations!!
author: Melinda L.

description:
I've been to the Front Porch many times now and would recommend it many times over. Always been seated promptly and never had a bad experience with service.

I would recommend the chicken and waffles, po boy (with chicken), and the eggs benedict (with ham). So good! Reasonably priced (to a degree).
author: Mark Y.

description:
Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives brought me here, and I am so glad they did!  The food here is incredible, and the atmosphere coupled with cool waitstaff make it a great plce for dinner.

I started with the blue crab hush puppies to start.  They were cooked perfectly...crispy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.  They were paired with a mayo-based dipping sauce.

My main was the shrimp and grits, which is one of the house specialties.  It also came with andouille sausage, which had almost a beef jerky like flavor (texture was soft though).  The shrimp were huge and perfectly cooked also and paired well with the grits and sauce.

All in all a great experience.  Cant wait to return to try their fried chicken!
author: Mark W.

description:
Very good southern/creole dining in Bernal Heights / Mission district in SF (8 min walk from the Bart).

The spicy shrimp and grits = 5 stars. Great use of sweet sausage, light and fluffy grits, great shrimp, just put some of their house made hot sauce (mix them) and it's a lovely dish. $18ish

Fried okra appetizer is really good. Not soggy, not over fried. It'll make anyone like the staple fried okra of the south. 5 stars. ($8)

Fried chicken meal is so so. ($22 I think) The 4 piece meal chicken is supposed to be famous, and it's really tender, but just doesn't have a ton of flavor outside of the nice batter. The collared greens and mashed potatoes are solid, as is the spicy popcorn. 3 stars for the price.

The corn bread free appetizer with garlic butter is a nice touch too.

Service was good, decor is cool, can book a reservation on Yelp. Overall, a good experience.

Also, lose the 'fucket get a bucket' slogan and memorabilia.
author: Chuck N.

description:
Although I enjoyed the experience, the food wasn't all that great.    We started with fried okra, which came out over-done.  I had the spicy shrimp and grits of which the best part was the poached egg.  My friend had the Hangover Helper.  The name should give it away.  It looked and tasted like Hamburger Helper.  The mimosas were mainly orange juice with a dash of bubbles.

I was looking for great southern comfort food, and this place was just okay.
author: Joey B.

description: Being from the south, and having had actual Cajun/creole food more than just a few times, I oddly prefer what the front porch did with the cuisine I thought I knew so well. The spicy shrimp and grits was incredibly flavorful, and I added a side of creamed corn that put my own mother's to shame. My wife had the flounder, and thought it was crispy, succulent, flavorful and still very moist. She wouldn't stop raving about it. Not even kidding, it was raved about louder than my own name was later that evening, and we were on our honeymoon. If and when I make it back to the Bay Area, I'll make it a point to come back here!
author: Zach M.

description: Easily 4 stars. If they could bump up service a little bit, they would be 5. The food here is amazing! Drinks might be a little on the pricy side for $8-9/pint of draft beer, but the food is really why you're coming. Just be aware that there's a wait most nights because the seating area is tiny, but if you can grab a bar stool, it's all the same. What to eat? Everyone knows that The Front Porch's fried chicken is their staple. It's 4 pieces of hot, perfectly breaded, juicy chicken accompanied by huge sides of ham hock collards and mash & gravy. For $19, it's a huge entree for two. This bad boy takes about 25 minutes to make and fry, so order a couple of sides while you wait. Off the menu, you can also order creole fries (hot, russet potatoes with skin), so get those. You definitely want the baked mac for $8. It comes in a cast iron, and the top of the plate is a perfectly browned cheese skin. YUM. Yes, the place is a little hipster, but what isn't in SF these days? The food is damn good.
author: Danny C.

description: The fried chicken Is a must. We came for the chicken and waffles but that day their waffle machine caught fire so no waffles. Their substitutes were not that appealing. I gave a it a four because of the food but the place is not as clean as you would want a restaurant but it has a hole in the wall feeling. Drinks were. It made strong enough and that was a miss as well. The place is very small and I would say max people that can go is 8 people. We were there until after they closed and they never rushed us to leave. The employees were hanging out and having lunch together as a family which is always great to see.
author: Pejman A.

description: This place was super super cozy! I wanted some chicken and waffles (been my go to meal lately) and I thought I would give this place a try. But when I got there I didn't realize the chicken and waffles was only for brunch :( boo! But I still got the fried chicken entree! It came with some veggies, mashed potatoes (which was bomb!) and popcorn. Who would have thought some popcorn on the side would make a difference? Well it did, it lured me in! The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. I actually finished it all. It was super delish. We were seated outside on a nice day with some rocking chairs to add to it. So cute and would def be back for some of their chicken and waffles!
author: Katie L.

description: They put bacon in the fried chicken batter. They put bacon in the waffles that is served with said bacon fried chicken. Do I really need to keep writing after that?!?
author: Andy L.

description:
Overall: 4.

Bucket o' chicken: 5.

Blue crab hush puppies: 4.5.

Spicy shrimp & grits: 4.

Baked mac & cheese: 3.5.

Caesar salad: 3

Porch-etta: 3.5.

Garlic mashers and gravy: 2.5.

Ambiance: 4.

Service: 5.
author: Clarence H.

description:
My friend was visiting from LA and wanted to try this restaurant.  I read the Yelp reviews and thought, "Hell Yea!  Chicken and Waffles please!"  We made a reservation for Saturday at 11:30AM for a group of 6.  This place is pretty small so I would recommend you make a reservation if you wanted to try it.

Between the 6 of us we ordered (3) chicken and waffles (they advised they require 25 minute to prepare this dish), (2) shrimp and grits, (1) stoner stack, (1) fried okra, and (2) baked mac and cheese.

The okra was a pretty good side and I really liked their baked mac and cheese.

I found their shrimp and grits (also with andouille sausage) to be delicious. But at $17 for the dish we were all disappointed in the portion.  But the biggest disappointment with this dish?  The egg was cooked medium to fully!  It was suppose to be runny, neither of the dishes had a runny yolk.  Bummed everyone out.

My friend liked her stoner stack enough.  I did not try so I cannot review.

Now for the chicken and waffles...the chicken was pretty moist so thumbs up on that.  I liked the breading enough.  But man I did NOT like the waffles AT ALL.  It's a "homemade jalapeenyo bacon waffle" sounds bomb right?  It was so damn dry.  And I did not really taste jalapeno or bacon, instead it tasted like a wheat waffle.  So disappointed.  I didn't even finish it.

As for the venue, it was pretty small and extremely dim in there.  Kinda reminded me of a dive bar.

I'd rather have Farmerbrown's Little Skillet.
author: Kim D.

description:
My husband and I made reservations here on a Sunday for brunch. I had the chicken and waffles, he had the country breakfast with eggs, and we shared beignets for dessert. 

The chicken and waffles is a pretty solid dish. A lot of restaurants get the waffles wrong, but The Front Porch did a good job. It was crispy, fresh, and had a slight sweetness to them. It came with a 3-piece fried chicken that was crunchy and flavored with a lot of herbs. Delicious! The country breakfast was standard, but the quality of the ingredients were definitely above average. The biggest disappointment was the beignets. I've had beignets from Cafe du Monde in New Orleans and these were not a good replica. They were really thick, compact, and very chewy. 

The service was a bit slow, but we were seated right at our reservation time. The restaurant is dark, so you'll need to get outside seating if you need those good food pics with natural lighting. We were also able to get street parking nearby.

Overall, the chicken and waffles and the country breakfast satisfied these two Southerners. :) We'll be back to try the shrimp and grits!
author: Jane P.

description:
Best fried chicken! Had dinner last year at Front porch for a gf's birthday. She loves southern food, so this was the perfect pick! We had a party of 6 and ordered the following:

Gumbo ($7)
Crawfish hushpuppies ($9)
Fried pickles ($7)
Baked mac & cheese ($7.50)
Hickory smoked pulled pork po boy ($26)
Fried chicken ($18)
Brown bagged beignets ($6)

The fried chicken was sooo good! Batter was crunchy and seasoned nicely. The chicken was juicy and tender. If Front porch were by my house, I'd get their fried chicken all the time! Yum!

I was super excited about trying their mac & cheese, but it didn't have much flavor. It was super cheesy and had just the right texture, but it was bland. Maybe I came on an off night, but I would definitely want to give their mac & cheese another shot since I've read such good things!

Since it was my gf's birthday, we got the beignets and asked them to put a candle in it! That was perfect cuz she was so surprised! I have a picture from when they brought out the dessert and it was priceless! 

Now, how can I get Front porch to move closer to my house so I can have their bomb fried chicken all the time?!
author: Elena N.

description:
Alright people, if you are coming here...make it worth it. This is NOT a time for a diet, or eating sensibly. This is a time to enjoy comfort food at its best.

Three of us came here on a Saturday morning for brunch. Unfortunately the people that were at our table decided to hang out for 30 minutes PLAYING ON THEIR PHONES after they paid the bill...but the weather was freaking gorgeous so we had a good time just hanging out on the rocker in front of the restaurant. (Note: people....stop being rude! You are making the wait staff lose money!)

When we sat down we were immediately engrossed in all of the food coming to the tables around us. It all looked so freaking delicious! And their naming conventions are great. 

The food here is solid. The wait staff is nice. The people that come here (at least for brunch) are an easy-going bunch, which makes it easy to enjoy the atmosphere and your company.
author: Courtney S.

description:
Decided to come here on a Sunday afternoon since I was able to make a last minute reservation for 1:30 (about 12:50 when I looked up reservation times).  

We decided to get the chicken + waffle (3 pieces of chicken) and the chicken fried steak.  Our server was really nice, she told us that the chicken and waffles would take about 25 minutes or so and asked if we wanted out chicken fried steak first.  The chicken fried steak was pretty crunchy, but with the gravy it was pretty darn good, and their roasted potatoes were pretty flavorful as well.  The chicken and waffles were good, but one of the pieces ended up being bitter because it was fried for a little too long, but the chicken was juicy and flavorful, definitely seasoned it before they fried it.  I will definitely be back to try their dinner menu!
author: Oliver W.

description: The fried chicken batter was a little over cooked.  Had a slight burn taste and very dark texture.  The fried okra as well.  And needed more seasoning.  The collard greens had too strong of a Vinegary taste.  The Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes & gravy, and desserts were awesome.   Maybe it was just a bad night for their fried selection.
author: Gerardo M.

description:
The saddest fried chicken I've ever had. It was dry, flavorless, and just a waste of a Saturday night 

I did hear the mac and cheese was good but who knows, I'm never coming back here again
author: Joey C.

description:
So to start off our wonderful evening here, we made reservations for 7, but didn't even get a table until 7:30.  You think we would at least get some free drinks for waiting 30 minutes past our reservation time but no.  Speaking of drinks, the waitress would recognize the fact that we were out of water, but then not return for ages to bring us more.  At one point I asked for a refill of my ice tea, which she verbally acknowledged, and then 10 minutes later came back to collect my glass so she could bring me tea another 10 minutes after that.  The food was subpar, especially compared to the prices they charge, and I am pretty sure the coffee we ordered at dessert was some off-brand of instant coffee.

To top it all off - my fiance has been in the bathroom for 30 minutes since we returned moaning and groaning due to food poisoning.

Soooo glad we came all the way out here from the east bay and wasted a bunch of money so we could get sick.
author: Becca M.

description: Friendly staff, great food. Mac n cheese, red beans n rice with sausage, pulled pork with sweet potato hash, and of course, the chicken. Do yourself a favor and make a res
author: Stephanie A.

description: That fried chicken was very good!! Those beans n rice and sausage was also really good too!! Even though the garlic mashers were really good, there wasn't enough garlic in them. But still good.
author: Samuel B.

description: This place is fantastic. Favorite restaurant in my hood. People come here for the chicken but the burger is the best I've had in SF, and I ain't easy to please. Cocktails are a stand-out and always served with the right mix of expertise and sass.
author: Malachi H.

description: Great place favorite! Soul food fresh great friendly staff!!! I'll be back often as possible. Try the fried chicken bloodymary is amazing. Our family had a great time of eating here.
author: Anita C.

description:
Came here for cousins birthday party. We had a table of 12 and another of 4. We made a reservation before hand and I kinda wish they made it in such a way that we were sitting on the same side and sitting close to each other. But this place is very small to accommodate large parties. 

We ordered pretty much everything on their menu. The hush puppies and the sauce were to die for! And so were the fried okras. They suggested to double up on the apps but we didn't because we all had a chance to try everyone's. We also ordered the wings. 

I had to try their fried chicken, surprisingly there wasn't that much kick that the apps had. Also, it was a bit soggy not crispy. Maybe they were rushing or something for a huge party like ours. I really liked the mash and collard greens. Overall, very good. 

My bf ordered the braised beef. Everything went together so well! The only criticism is too salty. But I'm used to not having too much salt I my food. It was really good though. Tender and juicy. 

My cousins ordered The burgers and they thought it was alright. But I don't know why they would order a burger when you can get it anywhere. They really should have gone with the southern food since that's what they're known for. 

My cousin said the Mac was good and so was the shrimp and grits. 

This is really a good place to try. I think it's really weird though how the food comes out on different plates. It's confusing as to if this place is casual or fancy. The prices, decor are definitely for a fancy place. But the attire isn't. They need to make up their mind an decide on one plate to use. This is a good place to try once.
author: Lynn C.

description: Awesome grits, biscuits, pillowy beignets, and fried chicken!! Everything I've had at this place has been on point, although their Bloody Mary was a little too on the sweet side for me.
author: Trevor W.

description:
The front porch is really someones front porch and maybe garage, lol. This restaurant was okay, I guess I had really high expectations for it. Great customer service though! 

Blue crab hush puppies 3/5
Jae's favorite salad 4/5 
Fried chicken 2/5
Mac & cheese 2/5 
Seasoned porch chop plate 1/5
author: Erika-Kelly C.

description:
I've been here for brunch twice now! If you are walking, the surrounding area is a little rough (passed by a guy getting arrested for assaulting a woman, whose face was bloody), but mostly fine. It's one of the few places near Bernal Hill that takes reservations for brunch!

The first thing you notice when you walk in is how dark it is inside. Then your eyes adjust and you realize there are lots of people around you, and the inside is just as cute as the outside. The French toast sticks ($8) are amazing!!! Crispy on the outside and gooey on the inside -- the best I've ever had. The Stoner Stack was also great (14), but the food definitely canceled out my "hike" that morning!

Everyone around us had fried chicken, which seemed a little aggressive for me that morning, but I can't wait to come back to try it!
author: Cynthia W.

description:
My parents wanted to try The Front Porch after seeing it on DD&D.  I promptly made a reservation through Yelp, and requested that we be seated outside, fully knowing that they might not be able to fulfill that request.

They sat us right away at the next available table, which was inside all the way in the back.  It was really hot back there, and dark.. My mom, who doesn't do well with heat, was feeling stuffy.  And we smelled like food when we left.

Though service was good throughout, my dad did not appreciate our server taking orders from the table next to us.  The couple came after we sat down, and yet their order was taken first.  My dad who, through many years of traveling around the world, has experienced discrimination, and is sensitive when these things happen.  I'm not sure why our order wasn't taken first, and though I'm absolutely do not believe it's racially motivated, it put a damper on our dining experience.

As far as the brunch, it was okay.  It wasn't bad, and it wasn't off-the-charts fantastic.  I ordered the Stoner Stack, which had fried chicken, cheddar, bacon, and sausage gravy on a biscuit.  And for extra, I ordered it with a fried egg.  It was heavy and one-noted.  Nothing in the Stoner Stack stood out in flavor.  I think if it came with a slaw, it would add some freshness to this heavy sandwich.  I ordered this with potatoes, which was a mistake because it just added more weight.  I wish I ordered the grits, especially since this is a Southern restaurant.  Rookie mistake which I will not repeat.  The beignets were okay too.  I'm not expecting the ones I devoured in New Orleans, but they didn't come close either.

Our 3-star experience didn't deter us from our decision to come again.  We want to try their dinner menu, and hopefully will have a better experience.
author: Vira P.

description:
Made a reservation for 10am--boom first ones in the spot yay! So, I can't attest for the long wait times or poor quality service here. The servers were very attentive and kept checking on us throughout our dining experience, which is a huge plus. We did not disappoint by giving them a nice tip!

The ambiance is very homey and the entrance is similar to a front porch; relaxing and inviting. As for the food, it is so bomb. I think I say that about a lot of things, but I kid you not. Brunch here is really good. 

My friend and I ordered the fried okra w/ the jalapeno aioli as an appetizer and it was fried to perfection and well seasoned. Also, We ordered the Stoner breakfast sandwich with grits and it was soooo good. The stoner sandwich comes with bacon, cheese, and fried chicken inside a warm and toasted biscuit. You can add egg, which I did and it was delightful. With just a few bites, I had contracted the itis, but that also be due to the fact that I practically downed my OJ and had an appetizer. But it was so worth it!

I'm definitely coming BACK and since my mom's has been asking what this place is about, I think I'll bring her along. 

Until next time,
Your new fan!
author: Tammia H.

description: The worst fried chicken I've ever had. The batter was caked on like a layer of baked dough. Disappointing.
author: Jaeve S.

description:
The Front Porch is the definitely of Southern comfort food! KFC gave me the perception that ordering a bucket of fried chicken wasn't classy, but I guess when it's a ceramic bucket instead of paper and you throw some popcorn in it, it's worth sitting around a table for instead of your couch.

We got the bucket of fried chicken that had 10 pieces to share and a couple of sides and it was a really good dinner. The fried chicken was moist and had just enough flavor and crispiness. The popcorn that was thrown in was really addicting. We also got the crawfish hush puppies with spicy remoulade which was good as well. I wish it had more crawfish in it though. And we couldn't leave the garlic mashers and gravey out which were pretty good as well. 

Overall, the atmosphere is pretty kitchy, but fun, the lighting was super dim, but the food was really good. Protip: there will be a wait so make a reservation.
author: Sophia Y.

description: I've been wanting to come to this place for the longest time! It was so good! We had the fried pickles which was awesome, creamed corn which was pretty good, the biscuits are to die for! We had the pork belly  and ribs too which was alright , but the chicken bucket was DELICIOUS!!!! We also had a benign which was good too! The ambience is also lovely and makes you feel like you are in the bayou. We also did everything family style wise, split between 4 people. Definitely will come back to try brunch!
author: Aimee E.

description: Hush puppies no long have meat apparently. They told me real hush puppies don't have meat but they used to have crawfish meat hence the nice yelp pics. However I'm sitting here right now looking at my $9 fried seasoned bread balls.
author: Lyn B.

description: As a southerner, I grew up around this type of food. As a Kentuckian, I think it's expected that my opinion on fried chicken carries a little extra weight. The Front Porch is an excellent choice for southern style food in San Francisco. I had the fried chicken (it was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside) with mashed potatoes and collard greens. My date had baby back ribs, baked beans and a side of mac n cheese. Everything was good. Was it the best southern food I have had? No, maybe not. But it's a great option if you'd rather not go south of the Mason-Dixon Line. The space was intimate, the drink menu was extensive and the service was friendly and responsive. I will certainly visit again.
author: Justin H.

description:
Came here with a group of girlfriends celebrating two birthdays. I was excited because I had this placed bookmarked for awhile. 80% of us arrived a little earlier but they wouldn't seat us. Why not? And keep saying you guys have to be done by 9pm. We were not even late. CHILL please! It was raining that day too and luckily the rain stopped when we were waiting outside. 

The restaurant itself is very dimmed and loud. The server greeted us with a smile but kind of sense she have a bit of a attitude. We are a group of 10 girls but when she was taking our order she didn't write anything down. We are like dam she is pretty good but she ended messing up our order a bit. She double order some of the sides and gave us less for some we wanted 2 of. Didn't send it back because we were hungry. But I feel like she should have wrote the orders down if its a big party. 

We ordered a lot of food. FYI Free corn bread. Started with 2 SALADS. One salad we asked for the goat cheese on the side but I think she forgot. It's okay with me but the friends who doesn't like goat cheese didn't eat it. 
For starters we got: 
GUMBO with chicken - I thought it was pretty good, not too salty with lots of flavor. Not waterly.
Blue crab HUSH PUPPIES - Was on the dryer side. 
FRIED PICKLES - It was huge pieces. Don't think it suppose to be like that and way too oily. Even from pictures on yelp, it's not suppose to be big chucks. Sliced is the normal way. 
FRIED OKRA - Pretty good. Couldn't really taste the slimy texture. 
spicy SHRIMP & GRITS - my favorite dish of the night. just enough flavor. 
We also got a appetizer that has fritos chips and ground meat. That was really good but I forgot the name of that dish. 
bucket o' CHICKEN 10 piece - my friends love it. Most of them wanted seconds. Thinking its not salty and its moist. 
Briased SHORT RIBS - It was really dry. Server said it was suppose to melt in your mouth. With 10 girls, we had left overs from that dish. 
Garlic MASHers and gravy - Nothing special and not enough gravy. 
Baked MAC & CHESSE - This was so good. I think I had thirds. Everyone like this way more than the mash. Very cheesey. YUM!
TWICE BAKED potatoes - Smooth. 

Ended the night with the new orleans style beignets with powdered sugar. If you ever had the ones in NEW ORLEANS, you will give this one a 1/10. yeah it was not good at all. Over cooked. and we also got the rocky road profiteroles.

It wasn't bad. Glad I got to try this place but not my favortie.
author: Sandy B.

description: The food was amazing.. we tried the chicken w/ mash, baked Mac n cheese, and the fried pickles and all exceeded our expectations. The ambiance is okay, a little dark for me but I loved the food and the service was great! Definitely coming back here.
author: Melissa F.

description:
I went here a couple nights ago for a late night dinner. 

First off, the place is adorable. It looks kind of dingy - kind of like a bar - but with decorative touches. Like fake indoor windows and petite white shelves spotting the wall with potted plants on them. Also, Christmas just happened so they had haphazard stockings hanging from the ceilings. Overall, the decor was adorable in an off-center and whimsical way. I liked it.

I ordered the fried okra and 4 piece fried chicken. I am going to be honest here: I'm biased because I don't like okra because I hate that slimy consistency. However, the fried-ness kind of helps to counterbalance that sliminess. The breading was really good and the jalapeno aioli was on point. Definitely has a kick to it if you're not a spicy person. 

Fried chicken was bomb af. Personally liked it more than hard knox by a margin. I would definitely come here again. They have three hot sauces available that they make in-house. I think the fucket get a bucket (mild) is the perfect companion. The fried chicken comes with mashed potatoes, collard greens, and popcorn.

I definitely am looking forward to coming back here again.
author: Josephine T.

description: This is definitely an out-of-the-way place but well worth the visit the chicken is phenomenal. And I would definitely come back and highly recommend both parties choose our course but not more than that. the food that they offer is not just comfort food . It's the personal touch and you can taste the love in the food that they make.
author: Jason B.

description: Very cool vibe. Maitre d' was somewhat rude. Fried pickles, fried chicken, mac and cheese, and vegan plate all quite good. Very accommodating to vegetarians. Excellent cocktails. Worth a visit.
author: Paul K.

description: The Front Porch is the literal love of my life-- this is my absolute favorite restaurant. I highly recommend the fried okra and the fried green tomatoes, when in season. Trendy and romantic atmosphere. Can be a bit loud but that's part of the charm. I recommend you get a reservation ahead of time or else you will be waiting hours. I wish I lived closer because I would be there much more often!
author: DeAnna V.

description: Really flavorful food, not many vegan/vegetarian options which is why the 4 stars. Would come back for their farmers vegan and cornbread bites! Drinks are strong and ingredients vary. Unique spot but customer service is excellent
author: Laura S.

description:
I was craving beignets & I yelped this spot. The pictures looks SOOO yummy but when I got my food I was not impressed at all. Spent $28 for beignets, crawfish Hush puppies & appetizer gumbo (which I was told I couldn't add shrimp even if I wanted to pay extra, they just won't do it) Anyways. The hush puppies were soo dry!  There was no crawfish to be seen or taste. The beignets out of a box is also better than this spot. The beignets were dry & tasted like fried pizza dough with a ton of powdered sugar. No taste & too chewy. The gumbo smelled delicious but when I had my first bite it was so unflavorful. Taste like rice with oil. I had to add a lot of salt for me to eat it because I didn't want to waste my money & was hungry. So that's telling you a lot if I was hungry & the food still didn't taste good to me. lol 

After my experience here, 3/3 was not great so it's safe to say I will not be returning back here. I gave them 2 stars because they were very friendly.
author: Royal H.

description:
They converted a house into a hell of a kitchen so you might as well check it out. My girlfriend and I came here in a Sunday for brunch so there was an hour wait but not to worry...there's a Safeway within walking distance and hot Cheetos were 2 for $4. Anyways, we got the shrimp and grits as well as the fried chicken with bacon over a biscuit with potatoes. 

The grits was alright...just alright. Actually to save you from some reading, both meals were just alright. The shrimp was nicely cooked however so I'll give that part of the dish a 8/10. The grits part was tasty but ehhh. Let's go with a 6/10 since I'd love for you to try a spoonful but definitely not a bowlful. 

The sandwich was better but not by much. On the real it didn't taste. There was a sauce over the sandwich but it only had a faint taste of cream and cream and some broth and more cream. The ketchup was good though. And the bacon was aite. More bacon please. 6.5/10 cuz I shoulda gotten chicken and waffles or an omelet or anything else.

Looking forward to trying their bucket of chicken. Cuz fucket, get a bucket
author: Joshua F.

description:
To be perfectly honest, Southern food isn't one of my favorite cuisines. I've never really liked some of the dishes no matter where I go, but I do enjoy certain dishes if they're made well. The jambalaya here is pretty solid but the fried chicken was a sad disappointment. Overall, the food is on the salty side and noticeably greasy and not particularly memorable or unique in comparison to other Southern restaurants. 

-JAMBALAYA - 4/5
Good texture - soft/moist but not mushy - and pretty flavorful - not too tomato-y and has a little bit of heat. Kind of heavy though, not just because it's all carbs, but because it's a little greasy

-SHRIMP & GRITS - 3.5/5
[wild louisiana shrimp, garlic, shallots, & andouille sausage red eye gravy]
Shrimp was cooked well. Sausage was flavorful but the texture was kind of weird and crumbly. The grits were more creamy than gritty and kind of rich and buttery. I think I would've actually preferred the grits without the gravy. The gravy was flavorful but too salty and made the grits too creamy (like a puree). The shallots actually gave the grits a nice, slightly sweet, caramelized onion flavor that I enjoyed

-FRIED CHICKEN - 3.5/5
Eh. The breast/white meat was very dry and flavorless. Drumsticks were a little juicier. The batter is pretty salty and incredibly greasy though. Yes, it's fried chicken but nicely fried chicken should have a crispness without the heavy oil
