-CRAWFISH HUSH PUPPIES - 1/5
Not really sure what good hush puppies are actually like, but these were really dry on the inside, chewy on the outside and pretty spongy overall. I didn't taste anything crawfish about them and they had a slight sour/acidic taste to them
author: Jessie L.

description:
Food = good. Great presentation. 

Tabletop corn bread = hot and perfect nibble to start the meal.

Starters:
Gumbo = smokey. It's not what we expected but it was okay. $8.00.
Fried pickles and fried okra = crunchy batter but underwhelmed by the pickles. Comes with tabasco aioli and jalapeno aoili. (FYI: I asked for 50/50 mix, since I couldn't decide which one to try.) $7.50. 


Entrees:
Fried chicken with collard greens and mashed potatoes with gravy = wonderfully seasoned chicken!  Sides are good, too.  He was not a fan of the gravy.  But the chicken is really worth a try.  It's moist, too. $18.50.

Side order of 2 biscuits = ginormous. They were crusty on the outside, soft on the inside.  $4.50. 

Dr. Pepper braised beef short ribs with smashed Yukon gold potatoes and broccolini = tender short ribs, flavorful smashed potatoes and perfectly cooked and seasoned broccolini.  $25.00. 


Dessert:
Butterscotch and nectarine cheesecake with poached nectarines and creme fraiche = dense, rich and delightful. $8.00.  

Service = good. They're friendly, but they get busy.  You've been warned. 

Prices = moderate.  All of the above, plus a lemonade, a sweet tea, along with the 3% SF health fee, dinner for two came out to $87.37, with leftovers. 

Seating = plenty of tables inside with a few outside, but this place gets packed. The seats in the back = car bench seats complete with seat belts, buckles and arm rests. It's dark in here but they try to spotlight the tables. Yes, they do accept reservations.
author: Fannie S.

description: If you are looking for authentic southern style food with a neighborhood eatery feel this is your spot. The food is delicious, portions are generous and the service was great. We made reservations for 5 on a Saturday and got in. We stayed in Union Square but it was worth the trip.
author: Donny B.

description: Everything that comes out of this place is something you definitely want to eat. I look forward to coming here over the course of many years and just trying every last thing. The drinks are great too. Place is decorated funky cute and has rocking chair dining on the front porch. Drinks are marvelous. Service is always welcoming even though these folks are always super busy!
author: Disco B.

description: Super impressed with their southern brunch menu. Bar selection is also on point. GM is helpful, and the decor is funky cool. There beignets were a perfect starter to our massive fried chicken and waffles.
author: Hamilton S.

description: Such a cute little restaurant with amazing food! Probably the best fried chicken I've ever had (and I've had a lot of it). The service was really nice and friendly and the portions were big and worth the prices. If I lived in SF I would probably be at this place every week :-(
author: Marissa A.

description:
My daughter and I thoroughly enjoy the place.  Quaint little restaurant with great SF atmosphere!  The hostess and our server were very friendly and courteous. 
After reading up on previous Yelp reviews, for starters we chose the deviled eggs (oh, yes!!!) and the hush puppies (very good). For dinner, we had the spicy shrimp and grits (outstanding!) and the 4-piece fried chicken (also very good!). Great mashed potatoes and collards. 
We will definitely be returning!!!
author: Gary G.

description: Cool spot with southern food. Totally different vibes whether you sit near bar, in booth or on the actual porch. I've watched this place change over last 5 years or so. Great spot in the neighborhood. Right next to Mitchels ice cream for after dinner classic dessert, altho they have tasty desserts.
author: John O.

description: Love this place!! The fried chicken and mashed potatoes are amazing! I highly recommend for anyone to come here. Also, make sure you save room to have their beignets for dessert!
author: Gianna A.

description:
Loved the decor in here and music was on point.
Pretty good spot for a 2nd date, not too loud, but enough noise to keep it private.
low lit lighting and cool art on the walls.

We both had Fried chicken with garlic mash and collard greens, and had a few cocktails while we were waiting for the food as the server warned us that it took a little while - which was fine with me.  I think I got some bourbon cocktail with sugar rim and peach - i forget the name, but i enjoyed it. Fried chicken was nice and crisp with a little kick - but extra hot sauce will do the trick. Food comes out in a little lunch tray with the sides and some popcorn on the side which makes the meal more fun.

I finished the meal with a peach upside down cake with vanilla ice cream. Dessert was mediocre but definitely come here for the ambience, music, and fried chicken.
author: David Y.

description: Getting out of the Marina/ Pac Heights culinary bubble never felt so good! When you step foot into this quirkily lit, draped and decorated restaurant - the name becomes comfortingly appropriate. Aside from the authentic southern vibe, the food here is 110% PHENOM. We shared the Crawfish Hush Puppies, Spicy Shrimp & Grits, Fried Okra w/ Jalapeño Aioli, Balsamic Roasted Fig Bruschetta and bottle of rosé. EVERYTHING was perfect. Friendly/ quick service, laid back vibe, full bar and yummy looking cocktails, not too loud or too mellow. You'll feel like you're at the classiest restaurant in Birmingham, Alabama with the added benefit of great bars and San Francisco "neighborhood vibes" to stumble into after your meal.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I had been wanting to come here for a while and im soooo glad i did!! The food is soo good. The place is pretty dark and small inside,super hipster. I regret not asking to sit outside. We made a reservation and were seated as soon as we got there. Our waiter was super friendly and constantly asked how our meal was or if we needed anything else.we were a bit disappointed that they only serve chicken and waffles for brunch and thats the whole reason we went, but the dinner definitely made up for that

We ordered fried okra for an appetizer. They were super crunchy and flavorful  and the sauce they were served with was so creamy. They also brought us out a plate of what looked like mini biscuits? Im not sure but they were great too!

We ordered baked and macaroni and cheese and ohhh jesus it was soo rich and creamy and had a hint of a garlic flavor it was sooooo good. 

For the mains we ordered the fried chicken plate and dr.pepper braised ribs. The fried chicken was like something i had never had!!! It was seasoned beautifully and each bite i took was loaded with flavor. The plate came wit green & mashed potatoes! Im not a fan of greens so I didn't eat them but the mash potatoes were really good. They also had this red hot sauce thats mild in flavor but tasted great with EVERYTHING!! I ended up buying a bottle of it for myself. The ribs were great too. It was a kind of chunk of meat that pulled apart like butter!! So good. Over all it was a great experience! Will definitely go back for brunch.
author: Xochitl T.

description: Waited over an hour for a text for my reservation for 3. 1.5 hours later still nothing as I eat somewhere else.
author: Lauren M.

description:
LUNCH. FOR. DAYS.

I love the fried chicken and the fried pickles at The Front Porch. Pair your fried chicken with their homemade hot sauce and you will not be disappointed.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Great food and service. I had the shortribs and my friend had shrimp and grits  dish .Unusual flavors  and seasonings were used  in all dishes .
Fried green tomatoes too ...
One complaint : no room for dessert !
author: Susan P.

description:
Get a bucket of fried chicken. That's all.

It's really your local watering hole with solid solid food if anything. Been here a couple times now and sure it's off the beaten path, but the food, drink, and vibe is what you get if you're in this part of town.

Let's get back to the food though. That's what you came from isn't it? Well all the other things I came for the fried chicken.

I consider myself an expert and aficionado of fried chicken (wait, who really isn't though?). This ain't my bucket from KFC or Popeye's (I might actually prefer those, my body probably doesn't) ... but it's still oh so good and pretty sure way healthier. The bucket came with some popcorn mixed in too, so that was clever, but the chicken itself was CRUNCHY and moist on the inside. Dang, I do get some KFC buckets that are dry as the Sahara sometimes, so I'm glad I got what I paid for.

Fried chicken bucket. Listen to the others too. Come get it. Come be happy.

Cheers!
author: Joseph L.

description: I got the chicken and waffles and the GF got the country fried steak. I ended up eating her share too! One of the better friend chicken places I've been to. The chicken was tender and juicy, while the waffle was soft and has a unique taste. Personally not my type of fried chicken tho, but great nonetheless.
author: Nestor H.

description:
Food was excellent and so was the service. Three of us had a great time there and it was a perfect place for us to renew our friendships. We were there for brunch on Sunday and had reservations. Our server was quick and he had a cool personality. The only thing that was a minor downside was that they were out of biscuits and we had to settle for a thumb-sized corn muffin. hahaha

BTW, if you have mobility issues, this place is not too accessible. Stairs to the bathroom and it's dark.
author: j w.

description:
I've been here twice and have been impressed both times. 

First time I had the 4 pc chicken which is amusingly served in a school lunch tray. Chicken is very crispy and moist, served with collard greens and mashed potatoes. 

Second time was family style, trialing the short rib, mac and cheese, fried pickles, deviled eggs, and bucket of chicken. Honestly not one bad thing to say except for the noise which makes it a little hard to chat.
author: Codey O.

description: This place has a delicious soul food brunch! The service is friendly, if not a little laid back and slow. Usually this is fine when you are enjoying the food but can add some frustration if you are waiting in the long brunch like. Best time to go is right when they open at 10 am. The chicken and waffles is delicious, but the Mac n cheese is the real winner!! Throw some eggs on top for an awesome (and cheaper) brunch.
author: Paloma N.

description:
This place is a neighborhood gem for Southern food. 

Right off the bat, you're greeted by a dim intimate setting, with enough funk and character to keep things casual. The service was attentive and my water would be refilled frequently and without prompting. Front Porch provides a delicious small corn muffin with homemade butter. It was already a great start.

I ordered the Shrimp & Grits and their Fried Chicken. The Shrimp & Grits were mindblowing. It truly lives up to the hype. They serve the entree with 6 jumbo shrimp cooked to perfection. The grits are infused with caramelized onions and sausage. It was packed with flavor but wasn't so heavy as grits usually are. This dish is worth ordering. The Fried Chicken was mediocre. I've have more juicy and tender chicken than this. The sides were nice but less memorable. The kale was a bit too bitter and limp for my taste but it is southern like. The mashed potatoes were pretty decent but 3 stars at most. 

I'd say come here for the Shrimp and Grits. As for the Fried Chicken, not the best.
author: Nicole J.

description:
Fooled once again by Yelp (which makes me so so sad sometimes). Came in here one night because Emmy's Spaghetti Shack had an hour wait and this place apparently had an "eight minute" wait. After I waited patiently for longer than eight minutes and the waitress/hostess just ignored me while seating other people, I decided to speak up. "Uh, hello? Some service here place?" Also, there were no inside seating and we had to sit on the outside, good thing there were heat lamps and blankets (which I did not touch because who knows who's used them?! Also there were just laying on a crate.)

Needless to say, I was not happy when I sat down with the bf, but that's okay. The food will make up for it, right? Especially since there are so many reviews and such high ratings! Sadly that wasn't the case, I think that the reason why I was so disappointed was because I was so excited. If it wasn't for the crazy rave reviews about the fried chicken (which was decent, don't get me wrong, just not 18 dollars good for four pieces!) and the shrimp and grits were just so so small, I'd actually be happier.

I think that for the price that the place was charging, the portions needed to be bigger. And for the atmosphere, it was chill and we were on a date for date night but I def. didn't need my bf to shell out 70 dollars for 4 pieces of fried chicken, a small plate of grits with kinda mushy not fresh shrimp and then a small cup of mac and cheese... No thank you. Next time, we'll bring our money somewhere else for sure.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Solid brunch fare. I had the eggs benedict with the tots and it was delicious. Recommendation for the weekend, be sure to make a reservation because the place can get quite busy.
author: Tracee W.

description: Kind of a rough start to our brunch Sunday morning because my girlfriend sat in some syrup within the first 20 seconds of being here BUT the staff was extremely apologetic, offered to pay for dry cleaning, and the complimentary flaky dessert thing with powdered sugar that they gave was excellent. The coffee is FANTASTIC and served in a large mugs . The decor is very vintage, rustic, and quirky. The music they played was all 80s - Depeche Mode, Boy George, Madonna, Hall & Oates - I die. I got the Hangover Helper (spicy chili, mac and cheese, and an egg) and it was perfect. Definitely check this place out!
author: Nicole P.

description:
Sorry, the restaurant was good but did not live up to its Triple D hype.  I did reserve a table and they had it ready for us outside (as I'd requested) but it was a bit cool and windy so we went inside.  Super, super dark inside - too dark to read the menu - a friend used his phone app light so we could read the menu.  That's kinda stupid to have to do.  

They've got a great beer selection and we all enjoyed our different beers.  Food-wise we went with Dr Pepper braised beef, shrimp with chorizo, and fish along with a side of mac and cheese.  While all meals were good, they weren't great.  At around $25 a pop with no sides, kinda expensive for average, good food.  Hate to say it but the mac and cheese was the star of the meal.  Wouldn't return.
author: Tim L.

description: Service is always solid. The specialty drinks are always fun. The chicken is some of the BEST in SF. The mac-n-cheese is also a "must-try."
author: Nick S.

description:
Sunday brunch at The Front Porch was a great choice! My first time.

New Orleans Style Beignets w/ Powdered Sugar: Delicious.

Cranberry (Corn?)Bread Pudding: Bomb!

Hangover Helper: Everything I like in one dish. No hangover needed.

Chicken: Thick, juicy, & stacked! Hella sexy.

Indoors was very low-lit so it's perfect for anyone on that post-party struggle from the night before. I wasn't, but I liked it because it felt like it'd be all romantical... if I didn't bring my parents. So of course they made slight comments about how they couldn't see. All was good, though, after their eyes (mostly) acclimated to millennial vision. lol

The whole time, I was grubbin' and jammin' to the 90s R&B music they were bumpin', so yeah I'll be back most def. They had me at TLC and Soul for Real.

I also took advantage of the helpful Yelp Reservation function for the first time. I recommend using that.
author: Michael M.

description: This place is awesome! Great atmosphere, great drinks and great food. We were there for Easter breakfast yesterday before the Giants game and had some mimosas with fresh squeezed OJ, the baked egg and cheese grits w/bacon crack and tater tots dipped in red eye gravy. Everything there is so yummy and it has such a cool vibe. Jennifer W. who gave it a 1 star appears to be the only reviewer that didn't give it a 5. And, judging by the number of plates of chicken and waffles going by yesterday, she might want to give it another try. Our biscuits came with home made jam, there is home made ketchup on every table, the red eye gravy I ordered on the side had huge pieces of bacon, sausage and mushroom in it. It is so so good!!!!!
author: Claudia M.

description: The shrimp and grits are to die for. The fried chicken is juicy and well cooked. I would say that you need to get in there!
author: Chet A.

description:
I absolutely love Front Porch. We spent New Year's Eve here and it was an amazing, super memorable meal. I've been here many times over the years and when I visit front porch, I feel as though I've been invited into someone's warm home and fed delicious treats. 

Hint hint: Crab cake pies from the New Years menu were amazing. I don't think they are on the regular menu. But they should be!  

I recommend the fried chicken and fried okra. :)
author: Mag L.

description:
Picked up a bucket of chicken and wished I would have gotten two,
Best MacnCheese I have ever had and delish RTed beans and rice.
Wish they were open for lunch.
author: Russ H.

description: Delicious spot. I had the chicken fried steak with tater tots and cheesy grits. Atmosphere is pleasant. A little cramped but the service is friendly. I'll definitely come again. Oh and don't forget the beignets were better than the original place on bourbon street! Pleasant surprise with those.
author: Raven B.

description:
Having had decided that we, me and my hubby wanted Southern cuisine, so we decided to try The Front Porch. 

Wow, were we impressed! 

Where should I begin? The tasty fried chicken or the amazing collared greens. 

For appetizer:  fried okra
Main dishes: fried chicken, collard greens, grits and mashed potatoes

The chicken was nice and crispy from the outside, tender and juicy from the inside. NOT DRIED at all! Grits was also good it was the first time trying it for both of us. Mashed potatoes were also really good...next time will definitely order an additional side to have with my chicken.

The ambiance was great, not too loud, not too quiet. Really enjoyed the look that The Front Porch has, makes it feel like we are inside a home. ALL employees were really nice and helpful. 

We love it and we can't wait to go back!
author: Alondra J.

description:
This place rocks!   I made a reservation without knowing anything about it (last minute Mother's Day thing) and at the end of the meal by whole fam were thanking me for researching and finding such a kick ass place.   So I totally scored.  Going on Mother's Day, the place was packed but they took us right back because we had reservations. The place is funky, hipster and loud.... And I'm not complaining about any of that.  It is such a fun place.  We got seated in a booth which was made out of old car seats, seatbelt included.  Directly behind me was an old school payphone (no dial tone, I checked lol).  As a vegan, I ordered the Josey's vegan that had grit fries.  I really had no idea what that was but I went for it.  And boy was I happy I did.  Grit fries maybe my new fav thing.  It's just fried grits, hard on the outside and smooth n gritty on the inside.   Only thing better would be if I had grits to dip my grit fries in. Haha. Grits on grits.  My meat eater fam got the actual grits and omg they looked amazing.  Greasy, garlicky and cheesy.  I had a little vegan envy of them. And that's why this place isn't getting 5 stars.  I wished they had more vegan options.  Like some fried tofu or vegan grits would be amazing.   Like a small sampling of what Souley Vegan has?   Either way, the food was amazing.  It was an untraditional pick for Mother's Day but it turned out to be one of our better mothers days!   

Bathroom report: small bathroom but complete with towels and toilet seats covers.  Single user.
author: Andrea M.

description:
I'm sad. Like really sad. Like playing the blues, picking my guitar, my baby done left me sad. I wanted to be in love with you FP. I tried so hard. But from the start when I ordered chicory (my fam is from Louisiana, I know chicory) and when I asked the waitress why she brought me coffee instead of chicory she says "Oh it's in there. Each batch might taste different with stronger and weaker brews." (Is this code for we use the same filter at least two times before we change it?) Because she was right! My last just actually rated like tree bark-chicory!

Then of course being of sound mind I ordered the one thing that they're supposed to cook amazingly with their hands tied behind their backs and aprons over their faces - the fried chicken and waffles. "Well, sure no problem, but that chicken is going to take about 20 mins wouldn't you like something to start with while you're waiting?"-cood my server.  I wanted to scream "Why didn't you tell me that when I sat down?" But no, I'm cool because I'm a cook also and I know that this is a cool upsell technique, so you know what? Let's try the red beans and rice as a starter! You can't go wrong with RB & R, they're virtually impossible to mess up.... unless you just open a can and warm them up and top then with white rice and sprinkle green onions on them, which is EXACTLY WHAT THEY FREAKING DID! 

Are you serious? Like, really?
Red beans and rice is a dish that LITERALLY costs $7 to make! $.99 for the beans, $3 for a smoked hock or shank, & $4 for the rice! Put it in a freaking crock pot and walk away! You mean to tell me you're too trifling to crock pot cook some red beans and rice? I'm not talking grandma's cast iron pot with onions, bell pepper, and garlic ham hock and beans- just a friggin set it and forget it crock pot! Dry beans? I've never in the history of being a Cuban Creole had DRY "SOUTHERN" Red Beans and rice! You are just mean and evil at this point! I'm not exaggerating, (see the picture!). I looked at the waitress with contempt and pushed the bowl to the end of the table.

Then came the chicken. The very dark. Bitter skinned chicken. You almost burned my fricken fried chicken! What in tarnation, the skin is supposed to be the culmination of everything that is good and juicy in this world and you ruined it for me, not just because it was so dark and bitter but because I am dearly afraid of sending food back to the kitchen. I don't want them upset- just leave it. But the waitress saw the same thing and says "awwe, too bad... you want me to take it back?" Noooo, so I can wait another 30 minutes? No, I'm good thanks.

The waffle is the best in town. That batter is the business! Cold or hot that was a bomb waffle!  Excellent waffle!  Music was bumpin'! Chicken was over browned and red beans and rice were DRY!!!!!!!!!!!!!   I want to go back so you can repair our relationship, I don't want to Yelp this way about you, can we start over? Please?
author: Milan F.

description: Made reservations on Guy Fieri's recommendation from Diners, Drive-IN's, & Dives. The Front Porch did not disappoint. From the specialty drink of the night to the Bourbon Pecan Pie each dish lived up to its hype.
author: Laura L.

description: Decided to try a new place out after looking at the reviews and the menu looked great.  We had the deviled eggs and hush puppies for an appetizer. Deviled eggs were okay, needed more flavor in the yolk mixture but the bacon jam was awesome.  The hush puppies were good n tasty.  The hot sauces were really good.   We ordered the fried chicken which came with mash n greens.  Chicken needed more seasoning but it was cooked perfect.  The greens needed to be temp warmer but had good flavor, and the mask were just okay n Luke warm. We also orders the spicy shrimp n grits.  The temperature on the food was luke warm, the flavor was great on the grits and the gravy  but not spicy at all and the shrimp was cooked perfect.  We ended with the pecan pie minus the chocolate sauce, It was delicious, too five in the bay so far. The service was great and the environment was very nice.  Overall not bad.
author: Will E.

description:
Super friendly people!
Great food, big enough to share if you wanted too!
Reasonably price.  Loved it will go back
author: Tanya B.

description:
Upon arriving at the Front Porch, you notice that it's a restaurant built into the garage of a converted home. There appear to be people living in the units above, so my first reaction is to think - this is what my dream mancave garage, southern restaurant would be. And that reaction was SO justified.

I got here well before my dinner date so I saddled up to the bar and asked for the "Feelin' Fancy" cocktail, which is the bartender's choice. On this lovely summer evening, he chose to mix gin with a tiki cocktail mix of ingredients and the result was a stiff mai tai like drink that surprisingly lasted me all night.

Once my date arrived, we moved to our table where I found myself seated on an old car/bus seat. Definitely unusual but it added a bit of quirkiness to the setting that I really liked. Now a clarification: I am normally a glutton but don't have reason to celebrate. This was my birthday, so we decided to go big:

-Deviled eggs and blue crab hush puppies to start
-Braised short ribs for the wife, Fried Chicken with mashed taters and collards for me
-Biscuits and mac and cheese for the table

Fat city, next stop.

Tickets, please.

We waddled out of this place deeply satisfied and carrying three boxes of leftovers. We also left knowing that this would not be our last time here.
author: Aaron F.

description: First time eating here tonight, it was amazing! The fried chicken was my favorite! Will be back!
author: Sara H.

description:
The fried chicken is out of control. Very generous portion, and you will not be able to finish it (although you will want to). Try the fried corn with parmesan. Amazing crispy cheesy goodness.

Cocktails are on point, and bar and wait staff are amazingly friendly. This place is constantly busy, but you can usually walk in and find a spot at the bar for 2-3 people.
author: Patty J.

description:
Average place. Service was very bad - slow and not very friendly. The food was only average. We tried the dishes everyone talks about (except okra that they didn't have that day). Really not impressive.

In the end, they also tell us that credit card is not working so we have to pay with money. 

Will continue looking for a good southern cuisine restaurant in SF
author: Nuno S.

description:
Y'ALL.
This place is uh-may-zin-guh. 
I'm sure I'm not the only Louisiana native to eat here, but -seriously- this is the best poboy I've had outside of Sportsman's Paradise.
We started with the mac & cheese (redonkulous), then I got the shrimp poboy (the remoulade was INSANE, and it was served on GAMBINO'S French bread!!), and my partner got the spinach and goat cheese Benedict with a side of biscuits and gravy ($2 substitution fee (completely worth it!!)). We complimented the meal with Roman Holidays, a champagne cocktail, and had to take a doggie bag for the leftovers. The whole shibang, 20%+ tip included, was less than $75!!
Our waitress, Tiny Terror, was an absolute delight.
I was literally making recommendations for this place before we left the building. Go! Now! Immediately! You can thank me later!!
author: Rebecca H.

description:
Service was fast and friendly. Ordered their chicken and waffle, beignets, and fried okra. All of them came hot (temp wise), which is the best way when eating out.  I normally finish my food, but not this time, I was so full I had to take a doggie bag. Definitely going back. 

My friend's Bloody Mary was a little lighter than what he's used to but he is a lush. Also he's a bit sad that it only came with an okra. He's a vegetarian but eats eggs.  So, I don't know.
author: Jake F.

description:
This place deserves all 5 stars!

The Front Porch is a small but roomy restaurant that serves mainly southern comfort food, except their deviled eggs are from out of this world. 

Came in around 10pm to get a few bites and beers. We sat at the bar where the man next to us licked his fingers and picked at his bucket of fried chicken. Next to him on the draft handle was a sticker "fucket get a bucket". The sides he had looked amazing too, I got my eyes on the creole green beans.

I tried the Fort Point (similar to a pilsner, $7ish?) and the brown ale on draft ($6ish). I don't remember the name of the brown ale but it was delicious, like a light molasses cookie! The Fort Point was awesome too, refreshing and reminds of fresh fruit.

The deviled eggs ($6.66, of course..) with bacon-bourbon jam went perfectly with the beers - I've never had deviled eggs so delicate and yummy :D 

Aside from the beers+ bites, the decor was diverse and interesting, but somehow all tied together. It's like we were in someone's house. There were many large parties chatting away, but the noise level was perfect. I'd be back in a heartbeat.
author: Maggie G.

description: Thoroughly enjoyed our meal here. We brought our two kids with us and were pleasantly surprised to see they had crayons and a kids menu considering how dark and loud and "bar-like" it was. We had mac and cheese and red beans and rice to start; then po-boy and chicken and waffles for entrees. My husband and I also had the porch swing drinks. We enjoyed it all!
author: L. W.

description: Yummm! Went here with girlfriends and we couldn't decide so we got tons of tasty appetizers-- cornbread, biscuits, mac n cheese, and corn. Then the entrees! Fried chicken, spicy shrimp n grits, and the vegan entree were all delicious. Huge portions. The drink special was smoky and fancy, featuring a beautiful red flower. Fun, warm atmosphere with friendly staff. The embossed tin ceiling is a cool touch.
author: Claire B.

description:
Context: Thursday night. Party of 3.

Parking: Parking was a little tight. Street Parking only. ***

Wait: I was lucky that I put in a reservation. Even with a reservation, we were not immediately seated. So if you can, please do make a reservation. Just call them or even make a reservation on Yelp. Or else, you're gonna have to wait. ***

Ambiance: This place is EXTREMELY, EXTREMELY dark. It was so dark it was hard to distinguish our waitress from another waitress! I wonder what that place looks like with some lights. The Front Porch is also very, very loud. Its much better for a rowdy night out with friends. **1/2

Service: Very, very slow. I suggest asking the servers all your questions and getting all you want before they walk away. Because this place is so busy, once they walk away it might be awhile before you can wave them down again. **

Restrooms: A single stall for males and a single stall for females. They were not my favorite, the locks didn't work and they used a latch instead. And that's fine. But, it sometimes looked like the restroom door was unlocked/open even though it was not. Very misleading. While waiting in line for the bathroom, I've seen multiple people try the door only to realize that it was locked and making the patron inside feel very uncomfortable. Furthermore, waiting in line for the bathroom was also awkward, because you wait very close to a table for 2.  **1/2

Price: Very expensive for the product you get. 3 people ended up being $85 total including drinks, so be prepared. Considering what I paid for and how much I paid, I probably won't come back. $30 for a bucket with 10 pieces of chicken...that's a little bit too much in my opinion.  **1/2

Food:

Bucket of Chicken: Served with popcorn on top, that's interesting. It doesn't add very much to the flavor profile, but popcorn that tastes like fried chicken mmm yum! The chicken itself was good and flavorful, but it was a bit oily for my taste. I know, I know. ITS FRIED CHICKEN. But, even for fried chicken it seemed heavy with oil. It was so oily, three people could not even finish the 10 piece bucket. It was so heavy, one piece of chicken for each person would have been enough to get the flavor and still feel good after leaving. ***1/2

Mac & Cheese: Standard baked mac & cheese. I was not blown away, nothing extremely special. Just normal, decent mac & cheese. I could have gone without it. For most people who know they can this themselves, they usually don't because it takes a lot of time: to prep, to cook, to clean up. So they go out to a nice restaurant and buy it to appease their cravings for this delicious goodness. So if you're willing to pay the price, go ahead and get it. Its exactly what it is: mac & cheese. ***1/2

Fried Okra: Pretty good. Dip it in some hot sauce. Like the mac & cheese, its standard fare. No surprises here. ***1/2

Shrimp and Grits: Good, the shrimp was good. A decent number of shrimp on a good portion of food and But, it also seemed a little heavy. ***1/2

Sidenote: I wish I ordered less chicken. I know, we went to a Creole/Cajun/Southern restaurant, so I was anticipating fried, oily deliciousness! But, it still seemed too heavy. My stomach gurgled the entire night. So be prepared.

Overall average: ~ 3 stars. The food is fine, but dealing with everything else made enjoying the food a little more difficult. I will probably try a couple other restaurants before coming back for round two. But, if you want good food and don't mind it being too dark. Go for Front Porch.  There was an outside seating area (which is cute and very appropriate considering the name) If you could eat out there, I think that would be a better idea.
author: Vivian C.

description: I took my boyfriend to the front porch for his 25th birthday and it was AMAZING! He got the "new breakfast sandwich" and I got the famous fried chicken and waffles. We also started with the beignets and the mac n cheese which were both heavenly! We would def recommend this place to anyone looking for a cute brunch spot with hearty food but make reservations if  you're planning to go on the weekend. Also, five stars for service. Our waiter was super attentive and so nice. Overall an awesome experience!
author: C R.

description:
Came in 30 mins before closing & they were still very accommodating. Matter of fact, they got us out before closing (: talk about great service! 

Cute concept restaurant. Good for late night eats & drinks. They have a wide selection of wines & their signature drinks. & don't worry, if you're a first-timer, you can't miss it - located behind the Safeway with a chair hanging on the outside. 

Their cream corn w bacon & truffle oil definitely hit the comfort food spot. 

Baked mac & cheese - cheesy gooey goodness. If you like when your cheese is baked onto the pan, this is the dish for you. Caveat - it's cheesy & oily. So make sure you have something tart to balance it out, like their collard greens

Overall, great food experience.
author: Alyssaaa S.

description: Pretty good place, I really enjoyed our food here, the menu is fantastic, i wanted to order it all.
author: Michael E.

description: I was looking for a reservation for a party of 6.  At the time they did not have availability but stayed in touch with me each day with an update.  Thankfully they called with an opening.  Just on their follow up I would give them 5 stars, but the food was equally spectacular.  Our waitress was awesome, the jalapeno margarita is two thumbs up and the fried chicken is a must!!
author: Tom F.

description: I ordered the shrimp po boy with Cajun fries, I enjoyed it. I got to try the fried chicken steak  with eggs and grits, I liked it. The beignets with powdered sugar was also good but there is a bit sour taste to it. We were there at 11:15 am. We sat at the back of the restaurant across the open kitchen. I would have had a better dining experience if the lighting inside was brighter. The wait staff were all nice.
author: Jenny N.

description:
Tasty chicken and waffles and shrimp and grits.

Not really a fan of anything else.
Gumbo - weirdly sour and full of undercooked okra
author: Leslie K.

description:
I'm not a connoisseur of fried chicken, but I'm comfortable with proclaiming that The Front Porch's fried chicken is absolute perfection. The meat was juicy, the skin salty, and batter crispy. 

And this place is not a one hit wonder either, the baked mac and cheese was equally awesome.  The crispy baked upper layer and the saucy innards made for an excellent starter.  The only downside was sharing it with 3 other people.

Even the average cornbread, biscuits, and mashed potatoes can't bring down my 5 star review, the chicken and mac n' cheese were that good.  Thinking about them days later makes my mouth water and my heart flutter!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Highly disappointed. I wanted their fried chicken for the longest time but had to wait until I had some friends to help chow down. 

All to say I'm sorry when you pride your self on fried chicken and you serve it daily as a key to your business I have high expectations not for it to be dry, not to mention the flavor is lack luster and it's over priced. The food was meh.. Like it wasn't bad but it wasn't anything to rave about. Will never recommend them for someone looking for an amazing above average taste.   

Our server came to our table, a whole 2-3 times over 1 hour. We sat for 15 just waiting for the bill. So we tipped her appropriately. 

Bottom line they don't know that perfect balance of perfectly fried chicken and 1-2 minutes too long. That will make and break me ever coming back. Pass if you want unique southern fried chicken, if you want that go to Queen Louisiana's Po-BoyCafe (went there the week before and MAN now that's fried chicken!) 

Highly, highly, disappointed... Would be lower rating but wasn't bad, just wasn't more than a 2.5- 3 for flavor.
author: Nate M.

description: Food was not good..Yelp photos are not similar to what you get there..nothing similar to Cajun..fried chicken was very dry..crab hush puppies were not good.not planing to visit this place again
author: Prerna M.

description: The food is ok. The service was great. Place is cozy but not crowded. Parking can be challenging.
author: Dianna G.

description:
How is it that the chicken is fried without being overly oily?

My boyfriend and I came here for dinner, and the parking was so difficult that it was beyond frustrating. Eventually, we figured out that we can park at the Bank of America parking (which is relatively close to the restaurant) for $12. Trust me, just pay that $12 to avoid the frustration of finding parking. 

We made reservation via Yelp (cool!), and we were seated immediately. The lighting is very dim, and it has a southern feel as it reminded me of a couple of restaurants I've been to in Texas. Our server was great; she gave us water immediately and took our order. We were also given two hot sauces for our food. One bottle was red, and it was mild. The second hot sauce was a yellow-orange color that was habanero. Boy oh boy, as someone who loves spicy food, this sauce was spicy, and it was delicious! I would definitely recommend you try this sauce if you can handle spicy food. 

 She then gave us two EXTREMELY small corn bread; it looks like muffins, and it's ridiculous how tiny they were! They're cute, but I am disappointed in the size of the corn bread. Other than the size, the corn bread was moist and delicious; the whipped butter that accompanies it was light and delicious. 

- BLUE CRAB HUSH PUPPIES WITH SPICY REMOULADE ($11): after the corn breads were gone (which was an easy feat due to their size), we were given the blue crab hush puppies. Oh my gosh, they were so delicious! The order comes with 4. When I cut opened a hush puppy, I can smell the blue crab. The first bite I had was heavenly. It was perfectly crunchy on on the outside and soft inside. I will admit that the blue crab was not as strong as I would prefer, but it was still good. The spicy remoulade was not spicy, but it went well with the hush puppies.   

- FRIED CHICKEN 4 PIECES ($18.50): we ordered two of this because the pictures of these looked so delicious, and I'm so glad we trusted the pictures! This entree comes with 4 pieces of fried chicken, collard greens, mashed potato, and some popcorn. The plating style was cute because it was like a cafeteria tray! Nostalgia alert! The POPCORN was out of place, and I'm pretty sure it was used as a decoration. The COLLARD GREENS were tangy, and it complimented well with the chicken and mashed potato. I would say that although the collard greens were tasty, I would NOT go out of my way to order this as a side (if it was offered as a side). The MASHED POTATO was divine! Oh my. It was so creamy. The ratio between the mashed potato and gravy was off as I would have preferred a bit more gravy. Now to the holy grail: the FRIED CHICKEN. The fried chicken was so crunchy and moist. I poked one of my pieces with a fork, and the meat almost fell off the bone. It was effortless to peel the chicken off of the bones. The best part of the fried chicken is that it is not oily at all. I love fried chicken, but it always comes out oily. However, that's not the case for this restaurant. I just love the fried chicken offered here! 

Other than parking, we had a great time at this restaurant. I would definitely order the hush puppies, but I would order the bucket of fried chicken that comes with 10 pieces ($29) because it was so good! I've never had such moist, non-oily fried chicken before. You should definitely try this place if you are a fried chicken lover!
author: Susan V.

description:
I used the yelp reservation system and was able to confirm my plans simply through text.  This was handy when we were stuck in traffic and I was asked to reconfirm a few minutes after our reservation time had passed.  We arrived 20 minutes late and were seated immediately.  The group before us were quoted a 45 minute wait, so we were especially grateful they held our table and it put us in a good mood to start our meal.

Everything we ate was tasty (boiled peanuts, deviled eggs, short ribs, bouillabaisse, pecan pie).  The service was great, attentive without being intrusive.  I especially liked that the coffee I ordered with dessert came out in a timely fashion so that I could enjoy both together.  Many restaurants have trouble with this.
author: Clark A.

description: Very bad experience the Fried Chicken wasn't cooked all the way it still was bloody and pink it was three of us that order the same thing and everybody chicken it's not done the sides were horrible in the wait was extra long do not try not worth it.
author: Jansen R.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised at how good this place was. Hidden neighborbood gem! We ordered the 10-pc bucket of fried chicken that was so juicy, tender and tasty. Generous portions on some of the side dishes: mashed potatoes, dirty rice & beans, mac and cheese, biscuits, raw oysters and deviled eggs. We ate family style so we could try everything on the menu. RECOMMENDATIONS: fried chicken, mac and cheese, and mashed potatoes.

Excellent & attentive service, cute little restaurant but it's pretty dark inside, and delicious drinks. Make sure you make reservations because it seems like this place would get packed on certain nights since it's a small space inside. 

Parking is a CHALLENGE here but it's worth it to eat here. There is a parking lot 1/2 a block down from the restaurant, make sure you have cash on you and exact change $12.

I will be back again!
author: Jennifer J.

description: Not only is the food far form authentic cajun/creole it is poorly prepared. Hush puppies were burned, gumbo was bland, etouffee was overspiced (I like spicy food but the hot peppers overpowered all other flavors)
author: voodoo v.

description:
Overpriced and overrated. 
The portions are small and expensive. 
We didn't have much expectations other than the 2,000 reviews on Yelp. 
The complimentary corn bread was tasty but too tiny to make an good judgement. We ordered the shrimp and grits, which was pretty good! The shrimp was fresh and the grits was creamy. We also ordered a 4 piece fried chicken with mashed potato and collard greens. The fried chicken was no better than Popeyes tbh, which is pretty sad because this meal cost $18.50.
As far as service, it SUCKED! They forgot our meal and we waited almost 30 mins for our 4 piece fried chicken meal. The servers asked every single table how their dinner was going except for us! Nobody checked up on us, and they kept staring at us for no reason until we said something about our orders! 
All in all, food and service was overrated!
author: Jenifer Z.

description:
4.5 stars! My boyfriend and I came here twice during our most recent trip to SF. The first time was for a late dinner, around 8:45. We sat at the bar and ordered a bunch of deep-fried appetizers (because what's a vacation without deep-fried goodness?). We got fried pickles, fried okra, and crawfish hush puppies. Everything was friggin' delicious, especially the hush puppies! We also loved the variety of dips that came with the appetizers -- spicy remoulade with the hush puppies, tabasco aioli with the fried pickles, and jalapeno aioli with the fried okra. Later on, we got some mac and cheese and lemon cheesecake, which were less exciting than the other dishes. The bartender that night was a pleasure to chat with. We also ended up meeting and chatting with a few other people from the area who were sitting at the bar, and that's always fun.

We came back for brunch two days later before heading to the airport. We got there at around 10:15, and it was already 90% packed (they opened at 10). It was a very wet morning, so there was no outside seating. We sat at a regular table by the door. We started with some delicious beignets. I ordered the fried chicken and waffles, and my boyfriend got The Stoner Stack. I must say that this was probably the best fried chicken I have ever had outside of Asian fried chicken! I could've really gone along with "fucket get a bucket" if I had nothing else to do that day. Can't wait to be back to SF and get a bucket!
author: Claudine M.

description: Good food at reasonable prices.  The gumbo was a great starter, just needed a little more thickness.  The fried chicken which was crispy on the outside, juicy on the inside, but just a little under seasoned.  The greens had good flavor, but a bit too much acid.  The cocktails we had were awesome, except I don't remember which ones we had since they were my 5th or 6th drink of the night.  Ooops.  The beignets were a complete miss however, too dense.  Not crispy on the outside and light and airy on the inside like they should be.
author: Ming L.

description: Ate on the porch on a Thursday, probably a good idea to make a reservation if you're going later, but we were able to snag a table- so refreshing to sit outside! Tiny but delicious cornbread was brought to the table and we ordered fried pickles- yum. Boyfriend ordered chicken and I had the short ribs. The sides were tasty- mashed celery root, and broccolini for me, collards, mashed potatoes and a little taste of popcorn for him. It's a bit pricey if you order  apps, drinks, etc but they give you a lot of food and it was the best date night we had in San Francisco!
author: Margaret M.

description: Came here for brunch - cool atmosphere and good food. I had the baked grits and egg which was delicious! The grits were cheesy and creamy, the perfect consistency. My husband got the chicken friend steak with tots - yum! And I got to try the biscuit from a friend and it was super flaky and delicious (although it could have used more salt for my taste). I would for sure come back here!
author: Carina G.

description:
I thought I updated this ages ago and wish I had.  The food is spot on and that's why I go whether eating in or the occasional take away bucket of always great fried chicken.

The combo of Front Porch and Rock Bar is a huge plus to the neighborhood!
author: Jon R.

description:
Friend: "Let's meet at the Front Porch at 7" Me: "Wait, why are we meeting at your front porch and not at the restaurant?!" Common mistake people!

Came here on a hot day to meet up with friends. Inside was soooooo stuffy. Where da AC at? Staff were patient and polite. Space is a little cramped and dimly lit.

My friends have been here before and said everything is good. Since I wasn't very hungry and didn't want to spend too much, I decided to get some sides.

I had the Mac n Cheese and it comes in a small skillet. It was good. I think it was shell macaroni and they cooked it al dente. I was only able to finish about half this skillet. One very scary thing was the pool of oil at the bottom... but I guess it's expected because of the cheese.

I also had the Garlic Mashers and gravy. MMM I love me some mashed potatoes. Potato flavor in every bite. The gravy wasn't very salty so that was good.

Though I only had the sides, they were both very good. If I come back, I'll definitely try an entree.
author: Benita M.

description: Fantastic experience!!  I may get her name wrong, but Josie(?) one of the owners handled setting up a little surprise birthday dinner for my wife and 5 of our friends...the table was ready when we got there, she took the wine i brought with us and decanted it while we waited across the street...our server (sorry, I've forgotten his name) was amazing...he was patient with us as we all got comfortable and caught up with each other, etc.  The food was delicious!!  It all arrived at the same time, on time and hot!!  Great job guys!!  Thank you!!!  See you again soon!!
author: Jeff G.

description: Was able to get a seat at the bar at 9pm on a Saturday night-Score! Sat in the corner, where the curtain hangs, in the way a little bit & kinda stinky in that corner. The hostess helped us the whole time, she wasn't the friendliest. Very smug. I didn't get that warm & fuzzy feeling from her or the bartender. Ordered mac n cheese which was amazing & 4 pieces of chicken, mash, & greens. Served on a lunch tray which is cool, mash was ice cold, bland & had no taste. greens were way too vinegary but chicken was perfect!!!
author: Ruby S.

description:
Made a reservation and they weren't prepared for us when we got there. Service was kind of crappy. Checked on once excluding drink and food order. No refills. Roach on the wall behind our table. In their defense, it was pretty busy. Still. But we got the food, and it was well worth the wait. Super delicious. Every one of us cleaned out plates. 
Get the cheesy grits, you won't be disappointed.
author: Keegan W.

description: Delicious local spot. Super cute vibe inside. Great cocktails. Can't beat the fried chicken, but their brunch is my personal favorite! Sit outside on a sunny day and enjoy the patio...or should I say, front porch!
author: Ashley K.

description:
I know there are a million reviews for the TFP, but I'll just put my two cents in anyway, because my mom says my opinions matter.    

I was *ecstatic* when I was able to make a reservation for brunch, at noon no less--which is practically unheard of in these parts.  I was able to do it on yelp, and without having Open Table send me a nasty little message that there was nothing available at my chosen time.  Also, I detest wasting an otherwise beautiful day off (because all days off are beautiful) waiting around for a table with everyone else in San Francisco.  It makes me testy.  

We were sat promptly upon our arrival. Great.  We were likewise greeted promptly by a very nice server. Also great. Our drink order was promptly taken and delivered. Excellent. I had a mimosa and for him, a Bloody Mary.  Look, I don't really like Bloody Marys.  They are not my chosen drink, but this one was different - nice and spicy hot - perfect mix of vodka and tomato juice - just the thing one needs to get the morning going. I was also quite fond of the mimosa, refreshing, served in a big glass, nice and cold.  I ordered a coffee which arrived at my table in a "I love my godfather" mug that I was tempted to abscond with.  

Okay. I ordered the Bourbon French Toast with a side of sausage, and for him, the Shrimp Po' Boy with a side of jalapeno aioli.  The Po' Boy and side of sausage came out almost immediately, and the runner brought 2 plates as though we were going to split it. Uh oh! I was sure that our server had forgotten my order, but she explained that the Po' Boy came out too fast, quickly brought me another mimosa on the house, and brought my French Toast out several minutes later.  She apologized, the host apologized, and then both of their moms called me and apologized.  I was surprised at how cool they were being about it all--and my boyfriend remarked that although that is the way mistakes should be handled, it is almost NEVER handled that way in San Francisco.  Usually when restaurants fuck up, they make you feel like it's your fault for ordering the wrong thing or whatever.  I certainly have no recollection of any establishment giving me any hooch on the house in the past as a result of their mistakes.  It definitely made my day, although I spent the rest of the afternoon napping as I was a little tipsy when I left. 

Anyway, the food was great and plentiful, and we certainly had a lot of fun.  Highly recommend.  We will be back.
author: Sunny S.

description: The food and drinks were so yummy at The Front Porch. My bf and I split a burger, the chicken mashers and greens and both got the lovely bunch of coconuts drink. We couldn't finish the meal but hot damn it was delicious. We would come back I'm a heart beat, but would need to hit the gym first!
author: Maria X.

description:
First time here for brunch. 
I have to say I was a little skeptical when my friend suggested this place for brunch, reading some of the reviews made me a little worried. Once there I have to say
-the place is nice a cozy
- friendly staff
- food was amazing. I had the grits with the egg, mushroom and bits of bacon it was really good.
And I have to mention the Mac and cheese again it was to die for.
I always think you should at least try a place out at least once and then come to your own conclusions. 
Would have missed out on a lot of great places because of someone else's opinions.
Words to live by.
"Don't yuck my yum"
author: Luisa M.

description:
This place has a trendy vibe to it. We were seated on the porch (no wait, usually). 
We started with deviled eggs & baked mac & cheese for starters. Both of those were amazing. The fried chicken main plate also did not disappoint. 

Would recommend for the chicken!

Also they prefer reservations.
author: Atzay P.

description:
We came here for brunch on a Sunday morning and had the best time. We were worried there would be a huge wait but we got lucky and were seated immediately. 

The place is sooo cute! You feel like you're walking into your grandmother's cottage in the woods. The interior is really dark, but not so much that you can't see who you're talking to. 

My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak, and I had Josie's vegan. So sweet to be able to order a solid vegan breakfast without having to ask for a scramble without eggs... The usual. Anyway, my dish was soo good! My favorite part was definitely the fried grits fries. They were very similar to polenta fries, crispy salty on he outside and gooey moist on the inside. I'm still dreaming about those grits fries and I probably will continue to drool throughout the day thinking about them until I get to have them again.

I'm sure the chicken fried steak was just as good if not better since my boyfriend almost licked the plate clean. And he has repeatedly mentioned that he needs to try other items on the menu, so we will definitely be back for the yummy food, great ambiance, and the strong morning cocktails.
author: Angie S.

description:
Last weekend I had dinner with family always a great time. Reservations for eight at 530. Packed from the get go. Short staffed and definitely showed.

Appetizers 
Deviled eggs with a bacon bourbon jam. I liked the hint of bourbon jam, added a sweet flavor in the mix.

Fried pickles with a habanero Aelio was okay, pickles were a little to breaded and the flavor feel a little flat.

My husband had the Braised short rib with mash potatoes... Declious! Omg those creamy mashed potatoes were to die4!

I had the pork chops, they were perfectly cooked. The sauce that was on the carrots was good separately but did not pair well with the pork.

My grandma had the fried chicken. No comment.

Our bill was about $300.00- I understand that we were a big group but we were neglected.  Now I understand your busy but I feel that when you have a big group you are more likely will get a bigger tip compared to the smaller groups. My suggestions is have one waitress/waiter serve the bigger groups only instead of having them take a section. Now this is only if you are really busy and have a couple big groups at a time.
author: Christie T.

description:
I'll start by saying I'm not the biggest southern style food lover there is, but i will say if you are this is probably one of 3 places I would visit.  The fried chicken and waffle is really good. the biscuits weren't great, they were ok.  Overall, i'd say if you were in the area and were hungry for some southern style cuisine you probably should come here.
I really liked the ambiance too, i felt like i was somewhere other than SF but it was a little loud for my taste, i had to yell across the table to people in my party.  

Service was good and prices were fair.
author: .Vanessa G.

description: Authentically delicious Southern food. Come back for the shrimp grits and fried chicken every time and consistently delicious! Good service too. See my images for description. Enjoy!
author: Julie W.

description:
Underwhelmed by the food. Had the farmhouse vegan which was pretty blah. 

Service left a lot to be desired. Hostess was not very welcoming and was curt when I asked a question about the place. 

Overall disappointed. Moved to the neighborhood recently and won't be back.
author: R M.

description:
Came here on a Thursday night around 7 for a table of three without any reservations and was told there'd be a 45 minute wait, which ended up only being 20 or so! We were seated at the bar since the rest of the restuarant was packed.

The food was all I ever wanted *cries*

-1 star for a few things. The restaurant was a little too dark although the ambiance was very southern. The restuarant was also so loud that I couldn't hear/talk to my friends. The entrees also took some time to come out, but order a starter and the problem is solved!
author: Erika L.

description: Very dark atmosphere with an eclectic decor... not very appealing for brunch. Food was okay, but nothing to write home about. Service was slow.
author: Raymond R.

description:
We tried the fried chicken and the Dr. Pepper short ribs.  The fried chicken had a nice thick crust and the meat was perfectly juicy without being greasy.  The sauce on the Dr. Pepper short ribs had a nice sweetness without being too overpowering.  The short ribs weren't as broken down and tender as I would have liked, but they weren't bad by any means.  

Be sure to make a reservation on opentable.com to save yourself some trouble on the weekends.
author: Kathy C.

description:
The food is amazing, even though it is overpriced. We love this place and can't help but go every week even though it really hurts my wallet! 

Brunch is the best!
author: Eme C.

description:
Read all th hoopla about the fried chicken but it was  not as good as people said. Dont have it with high expectations. It was bready and crispy if you like that but for me was not juicy or seasoned enough. Unless i put hot sauce on it then there was some flavor. Feel like popeyes is better. As for other things, collard greens mash potatoes are good.  shrimp and grits was too soupy.  fried okra is good but again pretty bready.  lemonade had a phizz to it but not much sweetness.  And in terms of service it was good and the servers are nice however if it its busy and they need your table they kept hinting for us to leave.  yall know what im talking about. start taking away your dishes or at least keep trying while youre still eating, staring at your table as they walk by you, cheering as you leave.  but i get it cause they want to serve others. we were there 2 hrs so i guess thats the limit.  
an average experience overall.
author: paul k.

description: We found easy street parking half a block away. We ordered the short ribs, 4piece fried chicken, shrimp and grits, Mac and cheese and fried pickles. The short ribs was excellent - very tender. The fried chicken was moist and crispy and cooked to order taking 20 mins. There was not enough grits in my shrimp and grits and not cheesy enough. Shrimp however was cooked perfectly. Mac and cheese and pickles was yummy. Overall the prices was a bit pricey for the meal. I would think this casual restaurant would have table cloths or a standard uniform for their staff for the price we paid. I couldn't tell who worked there. Also -very dark inside. A few more candles couldn't hurt!
author: Donna L.

description: So delicious.Was sitting around on 4/20 watching diners drive inns an dives and this resturant was show cased so decided tp take the few min ride to check it out. Being a native of cajun country Louisiana from a lil country town close to the bayou. I love everything about my culture an to have this resturant give a native of the south an new to California a taste of home was a blessing. Everything about this menu was spot on to my home. I had the jambalaya an it was amazing, my dinner buddies had the shrimp an grits an the pork roast plate that was so succulent. I could rave about this place all day I loved it. I will be back to try the whole menu! I can cook cajun food an thats y i appeciate this place i look forward to finally have a place to get cocktails an a taste of home.
author: Brandi J.

description:
I know that people love their fried chicken. To be honest, I've had better. Their star is their pork chop. The pork chop is brined and super juicy. It is accompanied with different sides depending on the season.

I like that they keep these signature dishes but make seasonal changes. 

Love sitting outside on a rocking chair with the nice warm heaters.
author: Viyada S.

description:
I've wanted to try this place for a long time. Pretty crowded inside (and HOT), but I was super excited to be seated and start nomming.

The good:
Fried okra - this was a mixed item at our table, but for someone who LOVES okra (like myself) this is a must get!! The frying of the okra eliminates the sliminess, and the aoli it's served with provides a perfect balance.
Beignets: not a huge sweets fan, but everyone else seemed to love these
Stoner stack: fried chicken... bacon.. biscuits and gravy... home fries... what's not to love? super heavy though

The OK:
Shrimp and grits: I usually LOVE shrimp and grits, but the gravy was lacking the depth of flavor I was looking for.

Will be back for dinner :)
author: Michelle L.

description:
I made a crucial mistake and I've lived in the Suburbs so long, it didn't even hit me til we were seated and looking at the menu.

Sunday reservation for 2 at 1:00 p.m.

Yes, 1:00 p.m. and I know it now. 

It's straight up white girl hour! BRUNCH! All the crunchy granolas were posted outside and I was like, OH SNNNAAAPPP!! Almost like slow motion Matrix kinda ish. All these fools are out on the town cause it's Sunday, the sun came out after 9 days of straight Seattle rain and it's brunch time. Don't believe me? Check for yourself.

http://stuffwhitepeoplelike.com/

We sat there listening to all the McZenzie 's & Todd's chat it up about their plans for the Holidays and about their fancy office job they can't stand anymore and how they are ready to move to Portland and start a granola business from their uncle's garage. True story. 

I can't blame the front porch for being an establishment enjoyed by white boys n their gals. It's just the way it is though. 

Food was pretty solid.

Shrimp Po boy was dynamite!! Needed a spicy sauce of some kind to enhance the goodness and the fries were solid. 

Spicy Shrimp n Grits was excellent. Although, I am pretty sure you poured 2/3 more red eye gravy over guy Fierri's grits than me though. 

Sweet tea is sweet with a capital S but damn is it good with a lower case g.

Sadly, I don't think we will return. I know this sounds ever so snobish and that's not so flattering to most, but BUT I can't stand McKenzie n Todd and their ridiculousness so if that's the norm, count us out.
author: Hector G.

description: This place was amazing! The fried okra was nice and crispy. The chicken was so juicy and tasteful. The shrimp and grits melted in my mouth. I had a bloody mary that was strong and perfectly mixed. I didn't try the waffle, but I could tell it was delicious. It was a thick Belgium bacon waffle. Not one of those thin pancake like waffles. The passion fruit soda of the day was super refreshing. Side note..the beignet was ordered by the people next to us and I really wanted a piece, but we had already ordered so much food! The table on the other side of us ordered the poached eggs with these half of inch thick ham steaks that looked amazing too! We didnt have a reservation, but we were seated in less than 20mins. The servers and all supporting staff were super attentive and nice! I will definitely come back. You will NOT be disappointed.
author: Tonantzin C.

description: The chicken was extremely crispy and very flavourful and juicy on the inside. The crust on the chicken seemed to be infused with some kind of cheese which gave it an extra bit of flavour. The waffles were warm and thick. The syrup had a kind of concentrated sweetness that was unusually pleasing.
author: James S.

description:
We found this place via Yelp since we were out in the area. It's located in the Outer Mission, next to the Rock Bar which seems to be their sister bar. New Orleans themed restaurant with a matching menu. We ordered the gumbo, deviled eggs and the fried chicken. The two types of hot sauce are homemade as well; those were pretty good but not as spicy as advertised.

The gumbo was a bit thicker than I had anticipated. I have had it a few times in New Orleans and they were a bit more watery, which would be my preference. Our nice server sold us on the deviled eggs which had bacon Bourbon jam (interestingly priced at $6.66). The fried chicken game with mash potatoes, collards and popcorn. It was quite crispy but the overall flavor was nothing out of the ordinary. The collard greens were tasty with a hint of sour which helped with the saltiness of the chicken. 

The place had good service and we were seated promptly. The restaurant does do a good job recreating a southern ambience. Because it's so far out in the town, we probably would not come back unless we happen to be in the area. But it is good to know there is a spot for Southern food if the craving ever hits.
author: Jimmy D.

description: Recently visited this establishment with a girlfriend of mine. We wanted to find a place that served good Southern food and refreshing drinks. Overall it was pretty good. I wouldn't necessarily call this authentic southern food however; our food was tasty.  I had the spicy shrimp and grits which was well seasoned. The grits could of been a little less watery in consistency but it wasn't all that bad. I heard the breakfast menu is far better than dinner. So I must go back and try breakfast out. It a nice spot and the atmosphere is nice so I would definitely come back again
author: Lila N.

description:
When will I learn? I am a native of the south so I came here expecting some authentic Southern cuisine but was greeted with a very hipster interpretation of my favorite dishes that really fell flat...I should have known by the menu that this place was too cool for school when I saw the fried pickles with Tabasco aioli, but the reviews were great AND they were featured on DD&D, so I figured, why the hell not?

We made reservations for 7:30 but got there about half an hour early on Sunday night and said we'd wait but the hostess was very nice and offered to seat us immediately if we wanted to sit outside, which we did. Our server promptly greeted us, but she absolutely zero personality and seemed to be very cold...definitely a sign for things to come. They had sweet tea, to my delight, which tasted awesome, and I decided to split a bucket of chicken, with mashers and biscuits. My other friend got a cheeseburger and fries.

So how'd it all taste? In short, I was not impressed. The bucket of fried chicken was served with chicken and popcorn...clever? Maybe the popcorn was just for show because it was STALE. As far as the chicken, it tasted like it was over marinated before it was fried and the batter has zero flavor, so all I could taste was the over marinated chicken which didn't taste good at all. The biscuits weren't burnt, but they were pretty darn close. They were very hard and just crumbled when you tried to eat them. I will say, though, that the jam that came with them was amazing. My friend who got the burger said it was nothing special but the fries were awful (undercooked and over flavored), and he was not impressed by the homemade ketchup. The star of the evening, foodwise? The mashers...yum! I originally asked for the without gravy but they put it on there anyways, which was no big deal, but they were sooooo good!

After we were done, we had half of the chicken left...my friend and I were arguing over who didn't have to take it home with us...I won that battle.

Needless to say, I don't think I'll be back. The service wasn't great, the food wasn't great, and I'll stick with KFC if I want some good fried chicken in the future.
author: JD G.

description: After trying this place 2x, I don't think it's my fried chicken place. The chicken was not crispy. It was very bland... I had to trench it in hot sauce for some flavor... the hush huppies were good. Beignets were tad over cooked. The dough was hard. Devil eggs so so..not really worth getting a bucket... if it's not flavorful...
author: Ann L.

description: I give this place a solid 3.5 stars! It's a great place to eat when you're needing to fill your craving for good old comfort food. Our fried chicken was slightly overdone (and the breading was much thicker than I anticipated) and the mashed potatoes and okra were good, but nothing spectacular. I would go back if someone else picked the spot, but not of my own accord, especially at the price point.
author: Erica V.

description:
Always amazing!!!!!!  ALWAYS!!!!!! The Mac is cheese is Devine 

Super good beers and nice people!
author: Fred R.

description:
I'll admit coming into this place, I had high expectations. I mean 4-star review and praise for fried chicken all around? Looks like a sure bet!

Well...first of all parking is a bitch. Especially on a weekend night, expect at bare minimum 15 min of circling around the block. Also, waits are long so if possible would definitely recommend a reservation. It took us almost an hour plus to get seated? I also wasn't told when our table was ready - I had to call the restaurant back to see if it was, no one called me. When we sat, I'm guessing peak hour had finished as there were multiple tables open.

We started with cocktails cause cocktails. About a whiskey ginger in, the appetizer we ordered came out - sausage cheese balls. Now that sure sounds folksy and down-homey. Guess what gang? Tastes like sausage. I mean...really nothing special there. Would certainly pass. Go to the Safeway across the street, about the same.

Moving along, it took forever to get our mains because the kitchen screwed up. People that were seated after us, and whose orders were placed after us got their food before we did. And I mean...their food as in our order of fried chicken. As in the table ordered fried chicken and something else and the kitchen screwed the ticket/there was miscommunication with the waitstaff and they delivered our plate of fried chicken to them. 

We only finally got our order because a lost server was walking around with a plate and I had to holler out "Hey I think that's ours". He then walked the plate to the back of the restaurant to the kitchen to double check and came back with that same plate in hand. BTW no apologies and nothing off our ticket. Also, to note the guy who delivered the food was not the same guy who took our order. The original guy disappeared. And no one checked back on us. Recalling this experience I've deducted a star from 3-to-2 as this night was pretty abysmal.

Bearing all of this, if the food was good it would be worth it unfortunately, the food here is nothing special. The fried chicken is not of the really snappy crispy crunchy skin variety but more so of like a thick cornmeal type batter. The collard greens were a bit too sweet for my tastes and needed to be cooked with more pig. The mashed potatoes, though i'm sure not boxed, was mashed to a point you couldn't tell a textual difference from if they were and frankly needed more salt and pepper. (PS. this craptacular 4-piece chicken dinner is 18 bucks. WTF.)

Call it a fluke if you will but service was pretty crappy - in fact, I did not feel as if I was provided service at all. If you're a neighborhood resident I can possibly see why you would come here; say at an off-hour, if they had specials. As an out-of-towner; I can definitively say that this is not a destination restaurant. You should spend your time finding some other place to get into because I'm sure there are better fried chicken joints in SF - there has to be.
author: Mike Y.

description:
I went here with my daughter with a serious appetite and a huge craving for Cajun/Creole food! Comfort and fire...and some  "laissez les bons temps rouler"! However what we got was not what I was expecting. 

First, walking into the place is was seriously dark...dive-y looking. All eyes turned as my daughter and I waited for someone to seat us. This is clearly a locals joint with a somewhat Hipster-ish patronage.

Anyway...the wait staff turned out to be super friendly...and when I mentioned it was our first visit there...our waitress quickly changed her demeanor and settled in to tell us everything about everything! Not for a second did I feel that nervous energy many wait staff get when having to spend extra time explaining the menu! 

So, while I was very disappointed that there was no Etouffee or Jambalaya on the menu...we were told it does make an appearance from time to time as their menu changes frequently. Disappointment set aside,we took our waitress's suggestion of having the fried chicken and Dr Pepper braised short ribs.

Did I mention I was hungry? I also spotted crawfish hush puppies on the appetizer list as well as deviled eggs with a bourbon jam. 

Here's the short of what could be a long drawn out foodie orgasm of excited gesticulation...

Crawfish hush puppies...F#%king awesome. Made the 9.00 price for 4 suddenly seem a bargain.

Deviled eggs...my daughter doesn't like eggs, hates them in fact...but she downed half the order after I insisted she at least try them. She took one bite and I expected her to make a face and tell me the rest were mine. Not the case...she bit into one...her eyes sparkled a bit and a half smile crossed her mouth. We almost asked for a second order...I will be heading back here simply to get these again!

Dr. Pepper Short Ribs...amazing, spoon tender, deliciousness squared. Served with very good mashed potatoes...and a sauce/gravy made from the short rib braising liquid. This also came with perfectly cooked broccolitini. Any restaurant that can actually put out flavorful and completely cooked through veg while maintaining its Al-dente texture...just means you've got chefs in the kitchen who really give a shiznit about putting out good food.

Last...the Fried Chicken was great...we had to wait a bit for this order as its made scratch...which is something that automatically impresses the hell out of me because most restaurants as a rule won't do this because its a wait.  Anyway...if I had one complaint t it was the fried chicken...but wait!...as a complaint this really doesn't count. So, my complaint? The chicken was too crunchy! So, you're thinking burnt, right? Nope...the chicken was cooked to perfection...the coating was delicious, flavorful, crunchy skin, yet for me...just a bit too crunchy...but its purely a texture thing for me. I think 95% of people would have to say its perfect...but I'm telling you my one miniscule issue...which isn't an issue as I'd order their fried chicken again and again.

I could have eaten myself sick, but fortunately...or unfortunately...the portions aren't crazy in either direction...meaning that it is so much food you have to take home leftovers...or those pansy ass French portions which mean a stop through a burger joint is happening immediately after leaving the restaurant. The portions were a good balance...which initially in my starving state made them seem small...not true at all.

This place has easily provided my most flavorful and satisfying meal I've ever had in San Francisco...

To all the staff and chefs...OH and even the bus staff...you guys and gals are awesome! Thank you, each!
author: Richard J.

description: My second time here and I loved this place. Really good food and their service is excellent. A place where cool folks hangout and they play the jams!!! Fried chicken was on point and their porkchop was fat and delicious. Jambalaya was a taste of NOLA in the City!!!
author: Joe M.

description:
You just have to be in the mood for getting your fingers dirty, eating in the dark, and greasy food. It's better KFC and really good boiled peanuts. Prices are decent for a good date place. The shrimp and grits are ok; flavor was wonderful but shrimps weren't the size I would have preferred. The mac and cheese is a bit on the dense side and I prefer my mac and cheese a bit more sharp. The bacon wrapped dates are good and the burger is delicious. The oxtail poutine is ok but there is just not quite enough meat. 

Stick to the basics and get a bucket of chicken and some boiled peanuts.
author: Marlene T.

description:
Truly the best service I've experienced. The ambiuance was AMAZING. With that being said, the food was...dispicable. I am not sure why this restaurant is listed under "soul food", when it clearly is not. From the weird tasting season on the fried chicken/mashed potatoes to the cold cornbread muffins, was just horrible. Whomever decided to make this place a soul food restaurant, clearly does not know what soul food truly is. 

If you do want TRUE soul food, then go to Hard Knox Cafe on 2526 3rd St. in SF! It's worth the drive and the wait. Trust and believe you will not be disappointed. I am not sure why this place is rated high for their food. It is asinine to me; however, for their service, I'll give them 100%! If only their food matched.
author: Tony D.

description:
F*** it and get a bucket! Love that saying, and it holds true at the Front Porch. Their fried chicken is executed so well when it comes to breading, spice, and the juiciness of the meat.
