I have a strong appreciation for places that can make deep fried chicken breast taste like a thigh. Be careful when biting into these bad boys, cuz your tongue will get blasted by the piping hot juicy goodness that is their fried chicken. 

Also on the menu for our night were the blue crab hush puppies (oh mai gah!), mac'n cheese (good, but not life changing), and mashed potatoes (suggestion to staff: please serve with more gravy!). I also ordered the porch swing (cocktail) and my fiancee ordered the old fashioned. The porch swing was a bit whatevers in my book, but we both agreed that their Dr. Pepper braised old fashioned is a must! FYI we had a good amount of left overs to take home. 

Please note that although they can accommodate big groups, I wouldn't recommend walking in with one unless you have a reservation. There isn't a ton of space in there. 

I'll be back for those short ribs!
author: Andrew E.

description:
This place is NOMazing!!! The chicken was fried to perfection that still contained the juice inside until you take a bite. The shrimp and grits were creamy, spicy, and addicting. And their special hot sauce is really the KEY to everything because it goes with EVERYTHING!! I even en up getting a bottle to take home with me because we need it!!!!

Words can't describe how good this place is, it's something that you have to go in person to taste the deliciousness. Parking is not the best so expect to circle around a little bit. Staff is friendly and attentive. Indoor atmosphere and dimly lit and very casual. Grab some friends and enjoy a bucket or two (may only seat up to 10 so grab your best friends only)!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
FAVE PLACE IN SF TO GET BRUNCH!! We go here for every special occasion. I recently went for my birthday dinner as well, meaning to get something not on the brunch menu -- but I still had to have the shrimp and grits. I'll try again this Friday when we celebrate my boyfriend's birthday!

But seriously, this place is a treasure. The vibe is great, the people are nice, the music is legit, the smell should be bottled, the food is hyper-delicious to every homemade detail, and you can hit Rock Bar across the street while you wait for your reservation -- what's better than that?
author: Juliette S.

description:
I go every where and anywhere for a solid brunch
This was just ok
If it was in walking distance I would come often but it's far so I more than likely will not be back
I ordered the country breakfast with eggs the eggs were GOOD the sausage was a hot link which is strange because any restaurant in the south would let you know it's a hot link 
The home fries were ok nothing great in fact they were bland
The biscuit was good
The raspberry jam tasted like it had too much lemon
The grits were soupy
The bacon was also just blah
If you are nearby go here but if not don't waste your gas ;)
Service is ok I sat with an empty drink for most of the time
author: Kelly A.

description:
The first time I came here was amazing, but the second time was utter disappointment. 

- I ordered the Sweet Potato and Pulled Pork hash and it wasn't even hashed! The potatoes looked like they were boiled. None of the vegetables were cooked, the pulled pork was very flavorless as well. The poached egg on top was overcooked too.  The previous time I ordered this was amazing, but this time it was so bad that I didnt even eat it.

- Beignets - hard, chewy and doughy. Too much powdered sugar. It was very hard to chew it. Would not order again. Didn't even finish the order, I had to leave it there

- Their OJ isn't fresh squeezed, fyi hahah

-They seated us by the door and it was freezing!

There are a lot better brunch places than this place!
author: Carmen C.

description:
I LOVE southern food (well I'm from Texas so I grew up eating southern food)! A local friend recommended this place for great fried chicken. I'm actually not huge on fried chicken, but decided to give this place a try.

This place is pretty popular and crazy and I was lucky to grab the last reservation spot. 

When you get there, they give you a plate of corn bread with herb butter. They were good and so moist.  My friends and I were a little too excited so we ordered everything on the menu.

For apps, we got the fried okra with jalapeno aioli, bacon-wrapped dates, and an arugula salad.

- Okra: These were pretty good. I liked the fried batter. The aioli was a bit mild for me but I like things spicy
- Dates: OH these melted in your mouth! AMAZING! Even my friend who doesn't care about dates really enjoyed these
- Arugula Salad: nice refreshing salad but nothing special
- Biscuits: I had to get a side of biscuits but I was expecting it to be drenched in gravy. But I was happy with the jam and herb butter :)

For the main entrees, we got:

- Spicy Shrimp and Grits: This was delicious and I wish I could have more now! The grits were so smooth and creamy. The andouille sausage had a good kick of spice and were tasty. The shrimp was cooked perfect!
- Dr. Pepper Braised Short Ribs: These were good and I would say worth to try but I probably wouldn't order it again. It was a super rich dish, which is expected in southern cooking. This was my fiance's entree, but he seemed to enjoy eating my spicy shrimp and grits dish more ;)
- Fried Chicken Plate: We thought it was amusing that this was served on a lunch cafeteria tray instead of a nice white plate like the other dishes. I tried a piece of the fried chicken and the batter was tasty and light surprisingly (it wasn't oily at all). The chicken was also super flavorful and moist. 
- Flounder: I'm not sure how this was but my friend seemed to enjoy it

We had to finish our meal with some good ole desserts. We ordered the brown bag beignets and the pumpkin brioche bread pudding. Brown bag beignets were good but not memorable. The bread pudding was delicious but it was alot more dense than I was expecting.
author: Kristina L.

description: We were disappointed that there were items on the menu found online that were not on the menu in the restaurant.  It's an interesting place in terms of the decor and menu items.  Where else can you get fried pork rinds as an appetizer?  We didn't have to wait for a table for five, which was really nice.  The person seating us didn't bother giving us kids menus even though we clearly had a need.  Thankfully our server took the time to let us know that was an option.  The Mac and Cheese was awesome but the rest of the food was just okay.  Not a bad experience but not the WOW experience we were hoping for.
author: Nancy M.

description: So bummed about this, The Front Porch used to be one of my favorites- delicious cocktails, solid food, and good service.  Service remains stellar, but the drinks and food really fell off.  We got the deviled eggs, fried pickles, and bouillabaisse.  The eggs were bland, pickles ok, cocktails were no bueno, but the bouillabaisse was a super small portion with not enough bread, and, unfortunately, a rotten clam(told it was sand but either way).  Not sure if they got too busy or rent went up, but the quality was not what it used to be.  Hope it was just a fluke.
author: Ellen M.

description: The hush puppies I have to say was the best part or the meal and they were the appetizer!! The fried chicken was off the hook and I'm picky bout my greens and these where real good!!! The shrimp and grits oh man was  tasty but a lil to much gravy!! Not a knock on it cause the gravy was good to.... nice intimate setting an good chill music... Would definitely go back to try the whole menu!!!
author: Greg N.

description:
Being that I just recently went to Charleston, SC I needed a southern cookin' fix. 

My bf and I pigged out and while it was good food, the atmosphere just wasn't the same as the good ol' South.

We had:
* Boiled peanuts (just ok, not the same as eating them in the South. These almost seemed smoked with a hint of BBQ flavor)
* Fried pickles (YUM!)
* Spicy shrimp and grits (Great! I'd eat it again. Good size shrimp too.)
* Fried chicken plate with the mashed potatoes and collard greens (Chicken good. I only tasted mash and greens - I was too full at this point.)

I'd definitely go back for the fried chicken.
author: Bianca D.

description: This was our first visit w/ good reviews I was excited to visit. I'm all about southern food. The restaurant itself was very cute but very dim and small. The parking is a bit challenging. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. We started with the fried pickles the breading was thick and very oily. The mini cornbread that was brought to the table was delicious. The chicken was very tasty and moist. The collard greens were my favorite. The Mac n'cheese was not impressive. Shell pasta and at a loss in flavor. The mashed potato and gravy was average. The biscuits were very good not dry at all even though they almost looked overcooked. We had beignets to top the meal off very hard and disappointing. The coffee was horrible I recommend passing. Dinner was enjoyable I would enjoy visiting again and trying some of their other items as they are a cozy lil place.
author: Jessica V.

description:
My friend took me to her favorite fried chicken spot in all of SF, and I do have to agree, it was to die for! The batter was so crispy yet the chicken was super moist. You can order a bucket of 10 to share or simply order a dinner which comes with 4 pieces plus collard green & mashed potato. Everything was excellent. They even have a red wine that specifically goes with their fried chicken which was very good. 

They have a dog-friendly outdoor patio with 5 or 6 tables. The restaurant itself isn't big so I highly recommend you get on open-table and make reservations. They do accept walk-Ins (you might end up at the bar) and the wait time will probably be over an hour. 

The meal isn't cheap but for the quality and good service, it's well worth it.
author: Mel D.

description:
I've been wanting to try Front Porch since I moved up to SF. But what really made me actually go over there to try it was their feature on the SFist-- they were named one of the restaurants with the best fried chicken in SF.

First time my friends and I swung by-- there was a 1.5 hour wait. Best thing you can do is make a reservation, because when we did, there was no wait at all. They're also very flexible and would accommodate your timeline, say, if you were stuck in traffic and needed an extra 15 mins to get there.

Really friendly waiters/ hosts. The restaurant was small, but it felt cozy. We got the 10 piece bucket of fried chicken to share amongst the three of us-- along with the mac and cheese and biscuits. Their complimentary cornbread was also amazing. 

I've had a lot of fried chicken in life, and let me tell you-- their fried chicken was out of this world. The spices on that chicken was on point. The crispy skin had a crunchy perfection to it, and the chicken itself was hot, juicy, and tender. It was so tender that when I bit into it, it could barely stay on the bone. 

The food was really good, but I just don't think a bucket of fried chicken should cost $29/30. My friend said he's probably better off with Popeye's Tuesday deal, but the quality of Front Porch's chicken was just too damn good :)
author: Grace H.

description: Service and foddies was good... the bloody marry was excellent!  Parking meh lol! Would definitely recommend!
author: Paul G.

description:
If you ever visit San Francisco and you like southern food, I highly recommend that you have dinner at The Front Porch!

Starters
*Fried okra with jalapeño aioli: good and crunch. The jalapeño aioli adds a true kick

Mains
*Fried Chicken 4 piece with mash potatoes and ham hock collards: The chicken is spicy, juicy and delicious. 

Sides
*Baked Mac & Cheese: gooey, cheesy and 100% goodness. We did have to add some pepper to the dish.

The only down side to the Front Porch is the noise level. I wouldn't recommend coming here for a first date. Lol
author: Norm J.

description:
Superb fried chicken. Mmmmmmm good.

The 4 piece portion is big enough to split. The Frito Pie is literally a Frito pie but it's tasty nonetheless. The staff was friendly. Decent beers on draft and a few interesting looking cocktails.

Complaint and the only one: the Mac and cheese. It was bland. It wasn't creamy. It was overcooked shell pasta with some melted cheese. Lucky for them they've God bomb chicken.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Freeway was eerily empty coming back today. Strange. Where was everyone? Got to the Front Porch 30 minutes earlier than I had planned. Waited for fifteen while worked. Great setting in a very cool neighborhood, one which I had not revisited since the mid 90s.  Boy it had changed, a lot. Parking was still relatively easy which was why I chose Bernal Heights rather than the Mission in my recent eating expeditions. R lived on 15th and the Mission and he was easy as far as where to meet up, as long as there was vegan dishes on the menu. For years I had hosted large New Years eve parties and he'd bring his then girlfriend over for dinner. Three years ago when I remet him, he was once again single, and moved back to his condo in the Mission and experiencing a surge of renewed confidence: good looking educated smart men with a sense of style and kink, was apparently the winning ticket in the city. I was beginning a new chapter of my life as well and we started to hang out in varies parts of the city after long day of work to swap stories of the city. 

Always fun to try new places. Always good to know where to get your fried okra fix without having to travel to the South. Always know no matter where you eat, vegan options in this part of the town is aplenty. Over dinner I learned that several girlfriends later, R remained single yet cautiously optimistic. He also learned there was no change in my life.  There was always going to be a group of people who were transients in my life, they enter and exit through a revolving door, within months I forget their names or my experiences with them, but the core group of people remained the same. Those who I guard and protect fiercely, those I would do anything to be with, those I remain faithful and loyal.

I summarized the state of my being over fried chicken and collard greens. He chowed down his vegan dish while giving me his. We capped the evening with Mitchell's strawberry sorbet. 

This is not a date restaurant. This is a place you could hang with your best buds, and be social and be yourself. Another satisfied evening. Look forward to many more evenings like this with my real friends in Bernal.
author: Victoria E.

description:
Didn't live up to the hype. The theme of the restaurant is supposed to be like you're eating in someone's front porch in Lousisana or somewhere south. The restaurant was really dark and you could barely see the menu. Water didn't come with any ice, no fans on. I was trying to enjoy my food while baking in the heat and with impaired vision. 

BUT, the fried chicken and waffles was good but not good enough to get me to come back.
author: Chelsea Y.

description:
Doesn't everyone bring their teenage daughter to a dive bar for brunch?  No?  Come on people, don' t hold them back.  We wanted to have something different for breakfast so we headed down this way and landed at the Front Porch.  I keep hearing about the fried chicken, and man, fried chicken on a sweet potato waffle was definitely worth the wait.  My daughter ordered the eggs and grits with mushrooms, goat cheese, spinach and bacon crack.  Yes, not only do i bring her to a dark bar for brunch...I introduce her to bacon crack.  And yes, it is addicting.  

Don't forget to come back for dinner.  The bacon wrapped fried dates are must have.
author: Maria S.

description: This place has great cocktails and fantastic southern food. Their cocktail list is very interesting and my personal favorite is the Midnight Sun. As for the food, the fried chicken is pretty darn awesome. You can also get this dish made gluten free. Also try the deviled eggs, side of brussel sprouts, the short rib, and the jambalaya. Basically, everything I have had at this place has been good. You won't go wrong if you grab food at The Front Porch.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Absolutely love this place. The food is so very "comfort"-able with Fried chicken and Mac and cheese as the staple go to. I have not had a bad meal here and we have gone for dinner and brunch and just love it.
It is a bit dark but I will take that over bright lights any day.
Staff is always very friendly and attentive and if you just want to have a nice mellow brunch and/or dinner where consistency and delicious food are a must then The Front Porch is your place. Enjoy.
author: CR S.

description:
I really want to give a zero review if I can. I just had a horriable experience ever in a resturant. We heared a lot of good stuffs about this place before and that is why I decided to bring a good friend of mine to this place. We made a reservation and get seated right the way as we walked in.... After me and my friends finished up what should we order, we put the menu asidr, and waited for the waitress, we waited and waited, nobody came at all... Finally I saw one waitress came over to my table, and stopped at the table that next to us, and asked them how was everything for them. (Not even look up to us, and just walk pass through us)But after that, she just ignored me and my friend and standing in a corner look for if other customer needs help......We were sitting for 20 mins, no water, no service,So what the fuck?!! That is kind of service that I should deserve? Or because I am a Asian, they do not feel happy to take my order? I felt extremely uncomfortable, and just cannot stand for it. I told my friend we should just leave for another place to eat.... 
  I really do not care how amazing the food they were serving over there, they failed the customer service part...
Just so pissed off
I would never go back, I mean never.
author: Gloria Y.

description:
Below are the dishes they do well in my book:
Cornbread
Fried chicken (duh)
Collard greens
Mac and cheese
Mashed potatoes 
Shrimp and grits
Mulled wine (during the holiday season only)

Food and service are great. The booth seatings however are very uncomfortable.
author: Mei S.

description:
Food is pretty darn delicious. I love their name and they do have a little front porch.  Parking is hard to get , as usual since it is SF, but just park at the Safeway on the hill and walk your but down.  Make sure to buy something at Safeway just to be safe.

I thought food was great, the fried chicken was one of the best fried chicken I've ever had in my life!  I shared it my nephew and he scarfed every single piece I gave him down! Haha.

The grits were also very taste.  Savory and just right and they give you big prawns. 

Iced tea taste good and southern.

The service is good but a little funny because they serve like a sit down restaurant, but their servers look like they being in a dive bar.  Note comaplianing, it was just a semi funny sight, they were super nice and courteous though.

Warn beignet in paper bag at the end is cute.
author: K T.

description: Deviled eggs and deep fried pickles really stood out, highly recommended. Great service and the dishes were bomb.
author: Miguel G.

description:
First I like to say we were seated by the kitchen of the open door and we were the first ones there I don't get it. We requested to move and we got a better seat which was much quieter. Only complaint I have is the greens look like lettuce and there was highly too much vinegar. Oh let me not forget that...my gf shrimp & clams dish was cold from the beginning asked to have it reheated and it came back still cold...‍Ugh!! 

So, besides all that we still had a very nice glass of red wine  to swallow down all the food that we did eat wish wasn't much....
author: Damion D.

description: They have gluten free Fried Chicken. And it was SO DAM* good! Mash potatoes were great (sans gravy for gluten reasons) and their collard greens are very different from what I'm used to, it was acidic and had accents of ham hoc in it, which complimented the four pieces of fried chicken really well, not heavy at all. $20. What more can you ask for?
author: Kasey C.

description: This was the last restaurant we ate at on our last day on our trip in San Francisco. Words cannot express how delicious their food is! I had the Caesar salad which was nice and fresh with Romain lettuce and fresh shaved Parmesan, and I also had the macaroni and cheese, which was one of the best macaroni and cheese dishes I have ever tasted in a restaurant. The macaroni and cheese had a touch of garlic in it that  just sent it over the edge. We also had The flounder dish which was divine and the arugula salad. Customer service was good.... we were overcharged on accident and they took care of it right away. All in all I'd give this place five stars and I would definitely recommend for people to try if you are coming in out of town it's a great restaurant small, quaint, cozy, and delicious!
author: Nina S.

description:
I love this spot!  Great authentic San Francisco feel.  Great music in the background (80's punk/rock feel).  Loved hearing the Ramones, Romeo Void, Stevie Nicks all in the same playlist!  

The service was excellent.  We took my mom and sister for Mother's Day on a recommendation from a friend who said their chicken and waffles were outstanding.  Being Roscoe's fans, we are always looking for a local chicken and waffles match.  We made our reservation and got there early.  They sat us right away!  We had the sweet tea, virgin mary's with "bacon crack," my personal fav, to start.  

I highly recommend the beignets!!! It's worth it!!!  We also got the blackened shrimp caesar salad and the shrimp was tasty!  

As for the chicken and waffles - perfectly cooked, and there was bacon in the waffles!!!  Hello! I can't wait to go back! What a fun and tasty experience! Gotta get back there to try dinner.
author: Christina A.

description:
I've had better. Came here for my anniversary dinner and was definitely disappointed. What's wrong with the rating? This place is salty, bland, and overpriced for simple food. I expected more on $20 dishes.

1. Popeyes taste better than the chicken they make for 1/5 of the price
2. Gumbo is salty as sheet. Taste like barf
3. Mac and cheese taste like cheap powdered cheese straight out from an instant box on top and looks nothing like in pictures.

On another note, my bf lived in New Orleans, and let me tell you, their Cajun food there isn't even comparable to here. This place is nothing close to what we both had eaten.

I am not even joking. Im young close to 30s with good taste buds. Didn't hear a thanks or goodbye probably because I'm the only Asian in the whole entire restaurant. 

The review lies! You'll definitely regret it. Bet money on it. Fold your wallets up, go ahead and treat yourself to a steak restaurant like Hillstone for the same price!

This place is for people who either have dead taste buds or just people who likes to taste ocean water.
author: ABC Z.

description:
We were lucky and arrived early enough after opening to be seated right away in the courtyard in front of the restaurant. It was cozy and a bit chilly, but had a very pleasant ambiance (complete with plants and rocking chairs to make you feel as though you were truly on your grandmother's front porch). 

Ordered the spicy shrimp and grits and the blacked mississippi catfish - both were delish! The "red eye gravy" was what made the shrimp and grits - so much flavor in the sauce! The other components of the dish were good, but it was all about the gravy. The catfish was also good, but again, it was the beurre blanc suace that made the dish. Will be back to try more!
author: Priya C.

description:
Family Vacation Part XV

Title: Make a reservation... you are not as lucky as I!

I know I am so behind on my family vacation yelp reviews. And they are out of order now. It was such an awesome vacation. But with next year vacation looming. It is time for me to knock these out. 

But seriously, The Front Porch. You have to eat here. You just have to!

The Front Porch was discovered during my Food Network search for good places to eat while in San Francisco. Guy Fieri was a fan and this was the 2nd place during my trip that I visited that a food channel personality visited as well. However the 1st place was on accident. (Carmel, CA From Scratch Restaurant - Chef Robert Irvine and Guy Fieri was there) This place was research. 

I think we drove through 4 different neighborhoods on our way there. One thing about San Fran is that certain neighborhoods have a different appearance and vibe. 

First issue once we actually found the location (which is easy to miss because it is a house turned into a restaurant. And when I say house I am referring to the traditional San Francisco row house.) was trying to find a place to park. No matter what please avoid parking at the grocery store behind the restaurant. They that I get a chance to look at the pictures I guess the bright sign saying The Front Porch is easy to see. But seriously in the day time when you are looking right and left it is possible to miss it on first sight. Anyway. 

Second issue was the place was packed. When we finally found a place to park and got to the front door we were asked if we had a reservation. We didn't. Yikes! We were talking to the lady and told her that this was one of the place we wanted to eat in San Francisco. She must have pulled some strings because she manage to get us a seat. 

This place is small and tiny. People are practically sitting on top of each other. And it is dark too. The customers didn't seem to care though. I was checking out the menu trying to figure out what I was going to get. Of course, they have the Fried Chicken with popcorn, but I decided to get the Spicy Shrimp + Grits. It was weird to me because I am not a grits eating type of person. It was so good that once I was home I decided to make a savory grits recipe just to have the memory of how good it was. 

My plan is to make my next San Francisco trip a guys only trip. There was so many bars that was passed by due to this being a family trip. Best believe that no matter why I am back in San Francisco, The Front Porch will be revisited. With a reservation of course!
author: Patrick M.

description:
I made a reservation at The Front Porch for 12:30pm, for a party of 3, on a Saturday, probably about an hour before the actual reservation time. Knowing the weekend brunch/lunch culture in San Francisco, I was pleasantly surprised that I could book a table so close to the reservation time.

When my two friends and I arrived there at 12:30 sharp, the host kindly informed us that there were a couple of tables getting ready to pay, and that we'd soon be seated. This was not the case, and to no fault of the restaurant; there's no way to push people to eat faster or prevent them from taking their time, which they have every right to do. Maybe I have a higher tolerance than others for waiting for things, but the 15 minutes we had to wait before we were seated didn't seem that long at all. Furthermore, the host kindly apologized when he thought we'd been waiting too long, explaining that he could not boot guests from their seats, which was totally understandable.

Once the waiting was over, the rest of the experience was very enjoyable. We ordered the Baked Mac & Cheese starter, which was absolutely delicious! The cheese was not too overpowering, and the mac was baked to perfection.

My two companions ordered the Stoner Stack, which looked extremely appetizing. I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak with scrambled eggs and cheese grits. The Chicken Fried Steak was not too dry, and the grits were creamy and delicious as well (disclamer: I'm not really a suitable judge of grits, since this was the first time I'd ever had any). All the food we ordered was delightful, of course until the very end, when our stomachs had reached or likely surpassed their maximum capacities. The food here is extremely heavy, but that's more of an endearing quality of Southern comfort food rather than a criticism.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Crispy, juicy, lightly spicy fried chicken.
Mac & cheese smothered in melted cheese.

My only regret was that the greens were served in a cafeteria-style tray, making it too awkward to drink down the pot liquor.

Recommended.
author: Miles L.

description:
Don't waste your money!!  Service very slow and the food wasn't all that great.  Had to wait at least 15 minutes for our drinks.  If your ever in Sacramento, try the Front Porch at that location. 
Their food and service much better than S.F.
author: Morena C.

description: Great food, poor service.  We arrive a few minutes early for our 7 pm reservation and we were told it would be about 25 minutes wait time.  We have 2 small kids AND we made reservations. So we ended up taking a table outside on the porch , which was fine.  Then, our waitress was super aggressive about taking our food order and then we could find her again. We had to ask someone else for both of our drinks and reminded her about things for the kids.  It's a shame,really because the food was actually pretty good
author: M. R.

description:
4 stars for the food! 

3 stars for our nice waitress and bartender who served us since we sat at the bar. 

2 stars for the location and size of the place.

1 star for the Bitch hostess that rolled her eyes while she sat us!!! (Big white girl)
author: Ray L.

description: Visiting SF from so cal and found this place on Yelp while driving through the mission district.  What a pleasant surprise for a Monday night.  Though it was busy we scored the only open table.  The fried chicken was crispy and moist.  The pork chop was at least 1 1-2 in thick and very juicy.  The pecan stuffing was awesome.  Not a big greens guy but they were good as was the mashed taters and gravy.  Loved the biscuits.  Crispy on the outside and soft inside.  Steam rushed out when I pulled them apart and the butter melted instantly.  Yum!  The staff was very friendly.  We'll be back!
author: Sabe A.

description:
This experience started out with good vibes when we pulled up and the parking spot right out front was available, it was all uphill from there.

My wife and I took my mother here on one of her visits and of course we ordered a bunch of everything!

We started with the fried okra and crawfish hush puppies... They were fried to deep golden perfection! The okra was still slightly crisp within the cornmeal batter and with some of there house hot sauces it was even better. The hush puppies had a beautiful crust on the outside but as soon as you popped it open it was soft and delicate and oh so delicious.

We followed up with the spicy shrimp and grits... i could have just curled up and taken a nap in this one! The grits were pure perfection, big gulf shrimp that were tender, andouille sausage was a spicy salty kick, and the red eye gravy was just magical... truly magical!

For our main course we went with the bucket of chicken with sides of mac and cheese, garlic mashers with gravy and the ham hock collards.

The mac and cheese was perfection, not overly cheese and you got a good hit of cheese with perfectly cooked noodles. The garlic mashers were just creamy enough with a great taste of garlic and the gravy was luscious and velvety. The ham hock collards were some of the best I've ever had and as good if not slightly better than my mom's (Sorry mom).

The chicken.... oh the fried chicken! The chicken was crispy, juicy, flavorful and heavenly... truly heavenly! This chicken is one of those meals that if you weren't hungry, after one bite you will be starving and want to hoard the whole bucket for yourself.

Great laid back joint that just does it right without trying to be fancy! Can't wait to come back for brunch!
author: Trevor D.

description:
Front Porch offers an EXCELLENT southern fried chicken meal that is hard to pass up. Finger-licking good. The skin was crispy, packed with flavor and the chicken meat was very tender, slide off the bone and juicy! I liked that you could choose the sides, which were okay. Their fried chicken was definitely the star. Well portioned and beautifully cooked

However, the other food and drinks left more to be desired. I understood that they wanted the atmosphere to feel intimate, but the restaurant was just way too dark for me. I could barely see my friend across the table! 

That being said, if you're looking for a good southern fried chicken, The Front Porch is definitely the place to go in San Francisco. The wait can be long ~1hr or make a reservation ahead of time. If you do end up waiting, know that there isn't a whole lot to do around the area, so bring a jacket and friends to keep you company!
author: Jenny Z.

description:
My girlfriend and I did the re-return to this place for the bucket of fried chicken. The cocktails alone were delicious (and strong) enough for us to have come back but after missing out the first time on the highly recommended fried chicken, we knew we had to get it the second time around. 

I can see the bucket serving a group of three to four people as it is a whole chicken portioned into eight pieces. But my girlfriend and I usually go all out when we eat out and that night we were hungry. So a whole bucket (and two sides) served us two by ourselves. It was perfectly juicy and the fried skin was perfectly spiced with a crispy, breaded texture.

The restaurant is on the smaller side so I'm sure it helped having a reservation. The overall ambience is dark and intimate. I would like to try the outdoor seating on a warmer night in the future.

My girlfriend and I would definitely make the re-re-return to this place as it has become one of our favorite spots for good food and drinks in SF. It's a gem in the Bernal Heights neighborhood.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I've had my fair share of gourmet fried chicken in the past year or so, and I can safely say Front Porch ranks in the top 3.  The chicken was served immensely hot and fresh.  The batter was infused with good herbs (I could taste some garlic) and was crispy throughout.  The chicken itself was moist, tender, and juicy.  It's worth getting the whole bucket because you're going to want more.

As for the sides, my favorite was the mashed potatoes and gravy - fluffy with just right amount of butter worked in em'.  The baked mac and cheese, although appropriately gooey, was not flavorful.  Buttermilk biscuits were a little dry and not soft enough.  Don't get the overpriced deviled eggs.  My favorite appetizer was, hands down, the gumbo.

I also really enjoyed their habanero hot sauce.  It's a gradual build of heat and really enhanced the flavor of the gumbo and chicken.

Come for the bucket of chicken and splash of habanero hot sauce and you got yourself a perfect southern dinner.
author: Huy D.

description:
Chill environment with dim lighting because you can't look sexy while devouring their delicious fried chicken!!!! We sat at the bar as the wait was long and we didn't make reservations. The bucket of chicken was perfectly crispy and had a spicy kick. The fried okra was tasty. The burger was ok, nothing special, but they're specialty isn't burgers. 

I ordered the spicy margarita which was quite tasty, but I will get it slightly spicier next time.
author: Cheeky S.

description:
We have become regulars here at Front Porch considering we have been here a dozen times. After the 4th of July festivities we decided to get some Frrrriiied Chicken goodness. Upon our arrival the sign on the door said they were closed. 

Our relative from LA who was visiting. Decided to ask if they were taking anymore customers (because there were people inside still eating). The seating hostess (who is awesome btw) said we can take you guys in as our last customers. Woo hoo! 

The food here is great. The BUCKET OF FRIED CHICKEN IS BOMB.COM. Order a couple of extra sides and you have yourself a feast. Family style. Love this place!
author: Mr G.

description:
I think I had too much expectations for this place. 

First off... This restaurant is legitly... A front porch. They had tables outside on the porch and I was lucky enough to grab a table that had rocking chairs! Sound awesome right? Not really... Sitting next to potted plants doesn't mean pollen and sweet smell of flowers. It means bugs. It means flys around your table and the number only increases as the sunsets and get darker. It also means the smell of fertilizer. 

I ordered the 4 piece chicken. Came with collard greens, garlic mash, and... popcorn?The garlic mash was delicious, the collard greens... gross... random popcorn pieces...stale. The chicken itself actually wasn't that good. There could be more seasoning in my opinion. 

What you SHOULD order is the Mac and cheese. Personally I hate Mac and cheese with the macaroni and cheddar cheese. However... The Mac&cheese here are white cheese with sea shell pasta! It tastes more like pasta to me... Which is why I love it!
author: Jenny N.

description:
first things first - they take reservations for brunch! i can't tell you how much of a rarity this is! 

i came here with a party of 6 on a saturday and since we made reservations through yelp, we were seated right away! we were all hungry, so we ordered mac and cheese and beignets to start.

here are my thoughts:

1. baked mac and cheese - good and creamy and cheesy. can't go wrong. pretty big portion too.

2. beignets - fried dough perfection. i personally am not a fan of beignets, but these were pretty good.

3. chicken and waffles - the portions are huge! if you're not hungry, i suggest sharing this plate. it comes with 3 big pieces of juicy friend chicken and it sits on top of a large waffle. i dont even like chicken...so i dont even know why i ordered this. i ate the smaller piece and got full immediately. 

would definitely recommend for a big party. #bitcheslovebrunch
author: Andy H.

description:
DESSERT ONLY REVIEW

Cuz we didn't make a reservation on a Friday and the wait was an hour. Smelled great though and saw folks hoeing into their foods and not talking to their significant other. It was just nom, nom, nom ;) Super dark in there, take your mistress there, LOL!

The host was kind enough to take our dessert order and pointed us to the Rock bar that they owned. He called my cell when it was ready & he met me outside the bar. Now that is proactive with business! Owner of this place take note! You have good people working for you, reward them!

The desserts rocked and satisfied my demonic cravings! We got the blueberry bread pudding, flouless chocolate cake and pecan pie. I loved that the pecan pie was NOT sickly make your teeth fall sweet. It was just right! The correct gooeyness too. MMm, I'm still dreaming about the flourless chocolate cake and why the fudge did I share it?!!
The only thing was that I thought the jalapeno was baked into it, nope, it was actual jalapenos served on the side.
author: Spooky E.

description:
Food: 3.5
Service: 4
Atmosphere: 3

OVERALL: 3.5 STARS.

Came here on a Saturday morning with my boyfriend. We had reservations for 10AM and we were seated inside once we arrived. Once we were seated, I regretted not taking up the option of sitting outside. It is super DARK in there! 

Anywho, in terms of food, my boyfriend gave his meal a 3/5 and I gave my meal a 4/5. He ordered the sweet potato and pulled pork hash. I ordered the stoner stack with cheesy grits on the side. The biscuit was full of buttery goodness and really just hit the spot [mmmm!] The chicken, cheese, bacon and egg were all so flavorful! My boyfriend kept asking for a bite :] BUT the grits kind of turned me off. To be fair, I've never had grits before, but I'm pretty sure they're not suppose to completely seize up on you. The server suggested the grits over the potatoes, too! Hrm, maybe I should've went with the potatoes.. My boyfriend wasn't the biggest fan of the sweet potato pulled pork hash. He liked it and didn't mind eating it, but he didn't consider it one of his highlight meals during our weekend in San Francisco.

Our airbnb host totally raved about this place so we were expecting a 5-star brunch. Unfortunately, it wasn't but, overall, a decent experience.
author: Regine A.

description: Delicious food and an excellent staff!  Definitely a repeat. My only problem is with the price of two draft beers we had last night. One cost $8 and the other $9. That would be a reason not to drink when I'm there. I don't know if one would pay that much at a fancy hotel or even the airport, ha ha
author: Fred S.

description: Been twice and love it. Had the Dirty Shirley, great way to start out... Ordered chicken and waffles... Chicken was fried to nice crisp while the chicken was still moist and tender. The waffle was very tasty with a nice little kick of jalapeno in the batter. Shared a side of biscuits and gravy, which were also pretty good. Biscuits are made in house and taste like it! But the best part of this breakfast was the shared cinamon roll! I should have gotten one to go!!!
author: Kris Marie D.

description: I loved their fried chicken! Definitely the best I've had in awhile..or ever! :)
author: Tiffany T.

description:
2.5 stars but rounding up.
Ordered a bunch of items. 
I'm sure a lot of people mentioned this already, but this is a bar/resto in a garage.
Very dark inside and cozy.

Salty dishes:
The deviled eggs

Fried pickles. (I know pickles are supposed to be salty so why would you salt the batter too? It was salt overload. I've had fried pickles elsewhere and they were yummy.)

Bland:
The only item that was bland was the mac n cheese. Definitely needed some extra flavor. 

Just ok:
The steamed mussels.  
Flounder. 
Gumbo. Thought it was too watery. Almost like soup. 

Overrated:
4pc fried chicken. Yes, it was moist and juicy but the fried batter was not that great. The collard greens were too bitter for my taste and the mashed potatoes weren't creamy enough. 

The mild hot sauce was weirdly too sweet. And the habanero hot sauce just tastes like watered down habanero. 

It was a disappointing experience.
author: Heejin L.

description:
I love dark meat. I also love fried chicken. The Front Porch is known for its fried chicken but unfortunately, it ran out of dark meat early last night. The white meat was juicy and fried perfectly, but I couldn't stop thinking about how much more spectacular the dark cock meat would have been.

Portions are generous, so the four-piece chicken plate with mashed potatoes and collard greens (comes in a vegetarian option) is enough for two people. I did see parties of two vulgarly stuffing their faces with ten-piece buckets though. There's no way brown turtle heads weren't popping out of their asses midway through their meal.
author: Suany W.

description:
Saw lots of great reviews for Front Porch so I stopped by for some take out. I ordered the fried chicken, beignets, and my boyfriend had the burger.

The fried chicken was alright, the most flavorful part was just the breading but the chicken was a bit dry and flavorless. The fried chicken came with mashed potatoes and collard greens. Thumbs up for heavy carbs mashed potatoes and thumbs down for the collard greens. My boyfriend's burger was pretty good. The BEST part of the meal was the beignets. A donut like dessert with lots of powdered sugar. Babe kept eating them tho he claimed he was full.

Decor at Front Porch really does look like... well, a front porch.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Had an outstanding experience dining at The Front Porch last week. We found street parking close by, and our reserved table was ready upon arrival. Our server Michelle was awesome and absolutely went beyond the call of duty for us! We enjoyed the boiled peanuts (my first time eating them and I was skeptical. But they were good) followed by the gumbo and a bucket of fried chicken with mac and cheese and bacon creamed corn with truffle oil. And of course, the mud pie for dessert. All were delicious; the portions were generous and we took a lot home. The dining room is dark, and seems like a converted garage with a few tables and bar inside. Next time, if the weather's nice, I will try to sit outside.
author: L. Elise R.

description: Fried chicken was okay. I've had better.  Lots of places are better.  The drinks were okay but just doesn't compare to all the fancy cocktails SF has to offer.  Everything else was not memorable since I have no recollection of anything else we had.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Fried chickeeennnnnn is my favorite comfort food! I trek around cities finding the best fried chicken and front porch is definitely one of the best. I came here with friends on a weekend and it was packed; they had no more tables so we had it to sit by the bar. I got their fried chicken and their hush puppies. The fried chicken plate came with 4  pieces of chicken, collard greens, mashed potatoes and popcorn! Their fried chicken was bursting hot and when you bit into it, it was so moist! The breading and the seasoning was also superb! My second favorite was the collard greens! It complimented the greasiness of the fried chicken so well because it was acidic! And the mashed potatoes and gravy were delicious! I also liked how buttery the popcorn was! 

But I thought their hush puppies were just ok. It was actually kind of bready in texture. 

Tip- they have house made hot sauce! Sooo good but super spicy be careful for you have been warned!
author: Janet K.

description:
Came here with a group of 3 on a Sunday night around 6:30. We were told the wait was about 1.5 hours but we could choose to sit outside. No one else was sitting outside when we were seated, but the seats later filled up pretty quickly. 

We all ordered a different cocktail from the menu, and they all turned out pretty good. For appetizers, we tried a couple different ones and my favorites were definitely the deviled eggs and the crab hush puppies. My friend was a fan of the fried pickles. For entrees, we split the farmer's vegan, 4 piece fried chicken, and a side of mac and cheese. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the farmer's vegas. The dish itself was really dry, even if the squash and brussel sprouts were pretty tasty.
author: Amanda R.

description: It's got a kind of abercrombie vibe with the low lighting but its a really nice classic hipstery SF joint. Had some solid coffee to start off brunch. Fried okra with some kind of aioli was amazing, never had anything like that before, highly recommend to everyone. The fried chicken and waffles were pretty good, but I've had better in the area. I would have preferred boneless chicken, makes that meal much easier to eat. The waffle wasn't as fluffy as I have come to expect either. Let's just say its no Roscoe's, but it'll do just fine. Pretty solid spot, nice decor. Awesome waiting staff and great for brunch, I'd definitely come back.
author: Rohit S.

description: I'm from the south (GA, FL, VA, AL *military) this is the BEST Chicken & Waffles I've had in the Bay Area and I've tried over half a dozen spots from here to Oakland. Large portions cooked and flavored perfectly at a decent price. Work the wait. Shrimp & Grits, Cornbread and Po Boy also. Bomb.com
author: Austin Q.

description:
Any place that serves fried okra is already a winner in my book. The frickles (fried pickles) were also delicious. 

Ok let's get to the 5-star fried chicken. Literally some of the best I've ever had and I've had a lot of fried chicken in my life. Perfect and crunchy on the outside, flavorful and juicy on the inside. And you can even get a whole bucket of fried chicken!! Fucket, get a bucket.

Great cocktails. Especially the jalapeño margarita. Also really loved the mulled wine.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
What a bad ass place Front Porch is, I came here when I was on vacation in SF as I had saw it on Triple D. It did not disappoint at all. It has a great atmosphere with a laid back feel. If the place has a wait you can always stroll across the street to the bar and wait there. Which we did. 

My wife and I were going for what we saw on Triple D. I went with the Shrimp and Grits and she got the Dr. Pepper braised Short Rib.  Both dishes were fantastic, I am a sucker for Shrimp and Grits and they were spot on. The Short Rip was tender and just fell apart. No knife needed. I could of stayed and tried everything on the menu, but I was just to full. 

I wish I lived closer to this place but it would be an expensive dinner with a plane ride to San Francisco and back. If I make it back any time soon I will be popping back in here for a bite. Oh and the 40 oz bottle of water was a cool yet grimy twist. CHEERS!!
author: Travis W.

description:
I came here on a dinner date with my cousin for some good ol' comfort food and some girl talk. The decor here is awesome and you feel right at home. 
We spilt the fried chicken that came with 4 pieces and sides and mac n cheese. Even though it was only 4 pieces it was enough for the both of us. The Mac n Cheese was so on point and delicious! 
I wanted to really save space for desert and we had the beignets and some kind of apple turn over I can't remember the exact name. I definitely didn't leave disappointed here and I really want to come back for brunch. Parking can be tricky but it's totally worth the walk even if you park a few blocks away.
author: Irma R.

description:
Came here with a friend on a Sunday around 11 am, packed on the inside and out but we sat at the bar in 30 seconds. We ordered mac and cheese, and oysters eggs benedict (fried oysters) with cheese grits.

Close to 30 minutes later the food comes and i dig in. The grits was amazing, egg and oyster was good, the english muffin was a bit hard but all good. My friends mac and cheese was good as well.
author: Daanyaal K.

description: Everything was delicious! Best burger ever! Had it with the American cheese. Fried pickles were a must too.
author: Cynthia H.

description: I've been here a few times. Everything is always delicious. Love the food, ambiance, and service.
author: Gabriela U.

description:
Fellow Yelper Jonathan W organized a dinner for a group of eight that also included Fia R, Hube N, Janice S, and Mylinh N. We had a reservation and were promptly seated at the large corner table next to the bar. The interior was dim lit and very small. The décor was intimately decked out in holiday spirit, as there were plenty of tiny light bulbs that sparkled from wall to wall. 

We chose to dine family style so everyone can get a broader impression of this restaurant's Southern cuisine.  My favorite dishes start with the Fried Chicken ($34). The ten-piece bucket came with sprinkles of popcorn and the chicken was served burning hot. The texture was crisp and succulent in all the right places with a juicy buttermilk flavor that took center stage. The batter was impressively flavorful and the chicken was juicy and tender down to the last bite. All came in large pieces and there were no dry spots whatsoever. I've never paid so much for a bucket of Fried Chicken but this alone was worth 5-stars.

My second favorite item was the Mac N. Cheese ($6).  It was served in a piping hot skillet and loaded with gooey cheeses. The texture of the cheese was very good but too refined without the secondary firm blacken spots for a change of pace. The macaroni was slightly overdone due to the heat, but there was enough wow factors to keep me going for more. 

I also enjoyed the Fried Okra ($6) that wasn't too greasy and instead it was fried clean with a good mix of firm and soft textures. The same can be said about the Fried Pickles ($6) that came with the batter impressively attached that rendered a nice crunch before the soft tangy flavor started to kicked in. I'm a big fan of Sweet Potato Fries ($5) and the ones here were cut thick to allow for its natural flavor to come through. All of these items were fried clean with good texture and flavor. The only weakness was their dipping sauces. The mix of different aioli was thick and creamy but none of which were sufficient to change or add to the existing flavors. 

The items that I do not recommend are the Biscuits ($4) as they were not as dense, flaky and flavorful as expected. The Meritons ($11) was not a good item to share as the stuffed Chayote came with a good amount of crab and shrimp but the flavors were too bland for it to pair with the rest of the food.

Service was outstanding as the server recommended all the right dishes to share. Our water was consistently refilled and the dinner was nicely orchestrated under its laid back atmosphere. I've had this restaurant bookmarked for over a year after I learned about it from Ligaya T and Patra B. Good quality food that comes with hipster prices. It was a great way to kick off 2012 and I would love to come back for more.
author: Daniel L.

description:
I was excited to try Front Porch and spent the whole day musing over the menu. I even made it a point to work out beforehand because everyone knows that soul food does not do the body good. 

We waltzed in with no wait for dinner as we had a reservation on a Friday night. Surprisingly, it was not that crowded. 

Our group of three ordered the following dishes:

4 piece fried chicken - pretty damn good fried chicken. The dish comes with mashed potatoes, collared greens, and stale popcorn. This dish came out last since it takes 25 minutes to make. 

Gumbo - could have passed on this. It tastes like canned sauce over rice. 

Shrimp & grits - this was perfect! Very delicious with juicy shrimps to accompany the creamy grits. 

Crawfish hush puppies - these were good but we did not taste the crawfish. It mostly tastes like fried potato balls. 

We also received free cornbread!

Food came out fast and service was friendly. A great spot if you're craving soul food.
author: Mina K.

description:
How To Have a Mellow NYE Dinner:

1)  Refuse to spend $100+ for a NYE tasting menu and book a reso at the Front Porch instead.

2)  Wear your comfy jeans accessorized by your new Christmas bling (aka red and green rubber band bracelet made by the Nephew).

3)  Be impressed by the friendly and prompt service.

4)  Why yes that IS a poster of a pink unicorn over the bar declaring, "It's A Party."

5)  Just one Bundaberg Ginger Beer please.  I'll just have a sip of yours.  Sluuuuurp.  Sorry I drank all your Ginger Beer.  

6)  Warm mini cornbread muffins with herbed butter?  Yes, please.  

7)  New a la carte NYE menu?  Don't mind if I do.

We tried the warm Pretzels that came with little cups of addictive truffle goat cheese and grainy mustard for dipping.  Delicious but pricey for the two small rolls.

However, we both ordered and loved the Juicy and Crunchy Fried Chicken that came with mashed potatoes topped with gravy, and spicy popcorn.  Sadly, the Brussels sprouts and bacon bits were on the soggy side.  

Especially loved the presentation via the red retro cafeteria tray.  (Warning:  Flashbacks of when you had rectangle shaped pizza in school may ensue.)

8)  Waddle home for brownies and bubbly.  

(Yes, we are an old married couple already.  Sad!)
author: Amy C.

description:
Free parking down Tiffany st after 6pm

Seating starts at 5:30. What we got:

gumbo: decent ive had better
cornbread: good but small what happen to those long ones in the pics?!
greens: very good especially mixed with the spiciest hot sauce (adds the vinigar taste) 
mashed: ok 
mac n cheese: amazing! (wish I would have got another one instead of the mash)
bucket: one of the best places i've had fried chicken at!!!! 

Very good all in all.

Next time when we don't have the kids I will definitely come just to try the short ribs.
author: Wendell E.

description:
Food was very good but the drinks were watered down and tasteless.

Maybe it was today's bartender because this was my 2nd time eating here. Our 1st experience the bloody Mary's were sooooo good but not today! Today they tasted like vodka and tomato juice with hella ice. No flavor, no spices, one lemon wheel and a small okra at the bottom of the cup. Booo!
We decided to try another drink off the menu, the shake, rock and roll with egg whites and maple...again, just taste like oj with a dash of rye. No flavor and where was the maple and egg whites??
Both of my drinks looked nothing like any of the pics posted above. Both of the drinks taste like juice and ice. Yuck!
author: tiffany d.

description:
They burned the skin! It was a weeknight, fairly slow, and they burned the skin on my fried chicken. I've been hearing about this place from people, and they all rave about the chicken. Then they went and burned the skin! It was slow! Whoever brought it out should have seen it and had them redo it. I'm a little frightened that it was the chef, because it wasn't one of the waitstaff. 

Everything else was fine, but it is hard to be unbiased when they burn the skin! I wasn't wowed by anything, so can't imagine coming back for anything.

And whatever the ridiculous price was the chicken $18? $19? Doesn't matter if it's burned!

PS: the skin was burnt.
author: Matt M.

description:
Came here for one of our weekly date nights and loved the divey and southern atmosphere. It was one of those SF Indian summer nights so we sat outside, on the front porch. Har har. My inner 80 year old loved the rocking chair seats. Best part -- no wait at 8pm on a Thursday. 

We shared the crawfish hushpuppies, the deviled eggs, and the fried chicken. The crawfish hushpuppies are basically just deep fried cornmeal balls without much actual crawfish. I expected something similar to Brenda's crawfish beignets but that was unrealistic. The fried cornmeal was delicious nonetheless albeit a little dry. I surprisingly enjoyed the deviled eggs. The sweet jam complemented the saltiness of the creamy yolk. The fried chicken came with a side of mashed potatoes and collard greens. The chicken itself was decent but probably a bit overhyped. 

Might come back since it's close and I liked the cozy vibe.
author: Xinxin W.

description:
The Front Porch just keeps getting better and better.

Without hesitation, I fully recommend this homey neighborhood restaurant for both brunch and dinner. 

Yes. It is JUST that good.

From the sweet cornbread sprinkled with tiny bits of sea salt to their hot and crispy sweet potato fries with jalapeno aioli; a simple salad of arugula-red lettuce tossed in balsamic vingear and olive oil; refreshing mojito-like Lilita cocktail and the much talked about fried chicken -- EVERYTHING. IS. GOOD.

Our server checked up on us often and even remarked that it's so nice to see people who are just sooo happy throughout dinner. My brother and I couldn't stop laughing the whole time (yes, he does have CRAZY stories) A piece of advice: keep the conversation G-rated, this place is kid-friendly. 

Next time my bro is in the city, Front Porch will be our pick. Good times!
author: Janice C.

description:
OK but not enough to make the trek from the East Bay just for the food. More of a neighborhood spot than a destination restaurant. A return visit will probably be influenced more by the restaurant's proximity to Mitchell's Ice Cream. May also come back to try the fried chicken everyone else is raving about but only in the daytime.

The Yummy: Mac & cheese, twice baked potatoes, pork chop.
The Just OK: shrimp & grits, cornbread, collard greens.
The Eh: dense hush puppies and the too sweet root beer baked beans.

The good: service, aloof but attentive. Just around the corner from Mitchell's!
The bad: extremely dark interior, not enough light to read the menu. Also the deafening noise.
The ugly: customers using flashlight app on their phones, not pointing it down at the menu but directly into eyes of customers at neighboring tables.
author: Cece E.

description:
Decided to go to the Front Porch for Mother's Day.  I made reservations in advance, which was great because they were packed already at 11:45.  They had my table ready, so we didn't have to wait.  The hostess was very pleasant. 
I went with my two boys and we decided to order a few things to share.  The fried chicken and waffle was okay.  I think the price was $17.  Not worth it!  We also ordered the Mac n Cheese, which was to die for.  That came out bubbling hot and very cheesy!!!  It was the best Mac-n-cheese I ever had.  We also ordered the shrimp and grits.  The price was $17 and not worth it at all.  Neither was the baked egg and grits, $11.  

Service-Not so great.  
Atmosphere-Pretty Cool

Overall-I wouldn't go back.  There are to many other places to try! This place is to pricey for the quality of food.
author: Denise C.

description: Loved this place.  Delicious Cajun food in a low key vibe.
author: Tom H.

description:
BUCKET BUCKETs of chicken. 

By far, one of the best fried chicken in the city (in my opinion) and definitely worth the wait. I came here on a Saturday and had a seat outside the patio. I sat on rocking chairs and literally a front porch setting.

Buckets of Chicken 10 piece for $30. 

Garlic mash + bacon collard greens are excellent.

I love the mac and cheese as well.. Come here early or be prepare to wait. It's not a big place, but the food is darn worth it!
author: Adam J.

description:
You know what they say, the best southern food comes from the Bay Area--Sike! (But this place would definitely be a close second)

Definitely a cozy cafe, a place to bring a date to once you get past the don't-judge-me-because-I'm-gonna-eat-shamefully phase. This place is definitely good for groups, which I would recommend ordering family style with a bunch of plates and sides. 

In my case, came here with a group of 10. We ordered two of each appetizer/sides to share and two buckets of fried chicken. "Is that enough" you ask? We have a half bucket left to take home. AND we're full.

I'll keep this brief-I ain't no professional food critic

Fried okra-good, not too salty but not too bland. Good with the sauce that comes with it.

Fried pickles-great! Same idea as the okra, but with the sourlike taste of pickles-great balance of salt and sour 

Mac and cheese-epic! Most places mess up mac and cheese, like how to you mess that up?! Glad to say this place ain't one of em. Perfect cheese to Mac ratio, creamy not soupy. Will definitely make you cry tears of joy.

Mashed potatoes and gravy-lightly buttery, can taste a bit garlic maybe. Good.

Sweet corn-great! Sweet and addictive.

Chicken-epic! Definitely can tell that the chicken was made with love and patience. Tender. Crispy. Seasoning was on point. Makes you want to have an aunt and or mother who would cook chicken like this! Kfc is child's play compared to this.

And habanero sauce/orange sauce-GOOD WITH EVERYTHING. Nuff said.

I love you -Daryl
author: Daryl G.

description:
Went there for two fiends birthdays.  We had the bucket of chicken (5 stars) garlic mashed potatoes (4 stars) mac & cheese (4 stars), crab cakes/deviled eggs/fried pickles(4.5 stars), tamara's heirloom tomato salad(5 stars), Gulf Flounder plate(4.5 stars) fish was cooked as ordered, Baby back ribs (4.5 stars) there was a huge amount of ribs/spicy beans yum, short ribs (5 stars) everyone at the table loved them, falling off the bone, brown bagged beignets (4 stars), bourbon pecan pie (4.5 stars) chocolate brownie sundae (5 stars)...
ambiance (4 stars) service (4 stars) 
We had a reservation and had no wait on a Sat night.  Overall a great place to eat any day of the week or for a birthday or hell any day......nothing fancy, just great down home food like you were in the South.
author: Chuck A.

description: Went there as part of my Diners drive in and dives tour through San Francisco. We ordered what they made on the show. It was all as they said.(Unlike some of the other places on the list.) Even though their Mac and Cheese wasn't featured on the show it is the best around! By far!
author: Demetrius M.

description: This place is amazing! Service was fast and friendly. Got the fried pickles and loved them! And also got the shrimp and grits, so amazing. My sister and brother in law got the fried chicken and mac n cheese, we were all so pleased!
author: Ashleigh C.

description:
I chose to eat here because of the reviews and the chicken & waffles. We called ahead to ask if they would be playing the 49er game on the radio, and initially we were told no, that they only played the Giants games. I was perplexed because Giants are out of the playoffs and the 49ers were playing that evening on Sunday night football. The lady who answered the phone put me on hold, and then came back on the line and said she would put it on for us and reserved is a table by their tv.

Once we were seated it took quite a few minutes to get a drink order in, and quite a few minutes more to receive our drinks. Then after quite a few minutes more, when we were ready to order, I was disappointed to discover they only serve chicken & waffles during brunch! We ordered the bruschetta appetizer, which was tasty, however the portion size was not generous.

We decided to close out and head to the Little Skillet who does serve chicken and waffles all day long. Our servers were not friendly. I probably won't come back.
author: Mandy H.

description: Outstanding food and quaint ambiance! Limited seating so call for reservations. The fried pickles with Tabasco aioli was to die for! My son loved the homemade Mac and cheese side. The 10 piece fried chicken bucket was steaming hot and so tasty! It could've fed our family of four. They also bring out little corn breads to wet your whistle. After dinner, be sure to walk over to Mitchell's ice cream around the corner. Dinner was $87 two adults two kids
author: Stephanie L.

description: Food was spectacular! fried chicken, garlic mash, collard greens, mac n cheese... and desserts were difficult to choose but oh so good!! Gotta check them out if you want some good old fashion southern or cajun creole food, you won't be disappointed ;)
author: NoR415 T.

description:
I like the food quite a bit. As a person who frequently eats with someone who needs gluten free options, it is refreshing to go to a place where we both can eat what we prefer and/or need. Perhaps the best example of this is the gluten free fried chicken offered by The Front Porch.  

The only reason why I am just leaving four stars is both the wait usually associated with a trip here and the lack of free parking nearby. Due to the lack of space and the high number of patrons around dinner time, patrons are not allowed to sit until everyone in the party has arrived. While this is not uncommon by any means, when considering how bad traffic can be in San Francisco, this can be somewhat frustrating. (Just imagine having a hungry 5 year old with you and waiting for the last person in your party to find a parking space in an over crowed section of the City.)

Come try this place if you are looking for a fun new place to have either lunch or dinner in the City. You will not be disappointed.
author: Kourtney B.

description:
The restaurant was very easy to find. Plenty street parking on San Jose Ave. Saturday nights are very busy. Make sure to make a reservation.

We got the four pieces fried chicken $18.50. Knowing that we skipped the appetizer, our waiter told us it would take 30 min to cook the chicken. We didn't mind waiting. The chicken was absolutely fresh, hot, crispy outside and tender inside. 

We also got the shrimp grits ($24) and mac and cheese ($8). Both were very delicious.
author: YJ L.

description: The chicken we're delicious, the service is pretty good. Overall our dinner/birthday celebration was fun. Will recommend it to friends
author: De N.

description:
Is it odd not to come here for their chicken?

I came here for their Cracker Jacks last year, just because I wanted their toy surprise, while Angela and I split their fried chicken (she likes white meat, I like dark meat), and she ordered their biscuits and gravy while I had their mac and cheese.

The chicken wasn't anything spectacular, thus I'm not sure why they have so many 4 and 5 star ratings. But, hey, I'm picky.

According to her, their biscuits weren't that great, and neither was my mac and cheese. My aunt does a better job with mac and cheese.

And finally, the homemade Cracker Jacks that I came here for, well they did taste like Cracker Jacks...the only problem was the toy surprise.

Angela laughed when I got My Little Pony stickers! I mean, couldn't you give me G.I Joe stickers or a toy car instead? I know this is San Francisco...but sheesh, what are you trying to imply?
author: Jack R.

description:
My husband picked this place for my birthday about two weeks ago. It's really more up his alley then it is mine, but I absolutely loved it. It's completely casual and warm and friendly. The host was kind enough to give us a comfortable table because I am nine months pregnant, and the first table would not have been so great for me. Before I could even say anything she said actually let me take you somewhere else.

We sat in the very back across from the kitchen and you could see in at how hard the cooks were working. The appetizers blew me away, especially the crawfish hush puppies. We were seated between two very annoying parties, and I really felt bad for the server.

I didn't love the entrées as much as I loved the appetizers, but that seems to be a recurring problem for me. We got two desserts to take home with us, and unfortunately they didn't travel well. They were very tasty though. I guess it's a little stupid to take desert home.

It was awesome to go to a restaurant in the city that wasn't flooded with tourists. I would go again in a heartbeat.
author: Theresa H.

description: Amazing chicken and waffles!! It's a also a super cute spot and a great location. They even have rocking chairs in the "front porch" area.
author: Mina S.

description:
Went to this charming little place for Glen Park School Fundraiser . I must say the support the staff provided For this charitable event must be applauded  
AMBIANCE: 
Dark setting with mix matched table setting car benches with seat belts for seating . So clever and worth visiting Alone . Now to the 
FOOD 
Pork Chops : savory and thick as a steak over collard greens 
Bucket of fried chicken : yummy take it go and still delicious the next day ! But beware how popcorn is spicy !
author: S R.

description: Overall it was a great experience. We were able to reserve a table for 7 with one day notice, the food was delicious and had excellent service.
author: Erika H.

description: Great atmosphere, with friendly and helpful staff. Kevin, the owner, was very curious about my wife and I' s opinion about the food because I told him we were from Kentucky. Therefore, you can believe me when I say it's a great place to eat if you are looking for some Southern comfort.
author: Jonathan N.

description:
Super solid dinner experience. My husband and I were in town for our honeymoon and we had seen this place on Diners, Drive ins and Dives. I know, I know.. I'm not a huge fan of the show, but in this case, the food looked so good I wrote it down as a place we needed to eat while in SF.

We had a reservation for 6:30 on a Friday night and we were seated immediately. (I would highly recommend making a reservation!!) I won't comment much on ambience because as I've mentioned in other reviews, as long as it's clean, I don't care too too much about the ambience. That said, it was a bit chilly in the restaurant because they keep the front door open (they have a few tables out on the sidewalk) and the curtains they use to keep the cold air out don't really work. So, bring a sweater if it's chilly out.

The service was great. Everyone was friendly and helpful but very efficient. 

Okay, the food!

Two tiny complimentary cornbread muffins- not bad, not great, nice gesture though.

The sparkling lemonade is stellar, as is the sweet tea. It's sweet for sure but it still tastes like tea. They do it right.

Arugula salad- big enough for two people to share as an appetizer (but I'm a piglet so I ate it all myself). It was delicious- lightly dressed in vinaigrette, no wilted leaves, creamy goat cheese, crisp apples, crunchy sweet candied pecans and... gross persimmons. I just moved them to the side and they didn't detract from the salad. Lol just not a fan of that fruit..

I got the shrimp and grits. The grits were fantastic and well cooked. The gravy was well seasoned, as were the shrimp. But, I have a suspicion that the shrimp aren't exactly fresh. A bit too shrimpy for fresh. But I ate them anyway and the dish overall lived up to my expectations. 

My husband got the braised short ribs. They were super tender and flavorful. The parsnip puree was smooth and very very good (I hate parsnips and I loved it).

He also got a side of the biscuits. The biscuits were great. The little compote or jam must have been good because he didn't let me taste it. However, we both agreed that whatever herb they use in the butter makes it taste like perfume or soap. We are kind of butter purists... plain salted butter please.

I also got the collards. Not horrible by any means but they didn't blow me out of the water. 

For dessert I got the Apple cranberry galette. Yum! The accompanying vanilla bean ice cream was awesome.

So, two (non alcoholic) drinks, two entrees, two sides (biscuits and collards), salad and dessert ran us $94 before tip.  Worth it!
author: Kristin Z.

description:
My oh my how I love some good ole soul food. 

I had been to NOLA with one of my best friends on a foodie soul searching trip two years ago and proclaimed Mr. B's Bistro to have the best Shrimp and Grits I've ever consumed or could ever fantasize about consuming. However, the Front Porch's Shrimp and Grits topped THAT. So buttery and creamy without being grainy while still maintaining a tantalizing special mama's touch flavor... mmm. There's not much more one can demand out of some Shrimp and Grits. 

I went to The Front Porch with my family after we watched Cirque's Amaluna because who wouldn't want to douse themselves in ounces and ounces of butter after watching excruciatingly fit acrobats perform ab busting stunts.  

The ambiance is very low key, homey (if your home resembles a laid back pub on Bourbon Street), dimly lit (not in a sexy & trendy way but rather in a more cozy and laid back way) and there literally is a front porch at the front of the restaurant. The waitress was extremely friendly and made some great recommendations. 

Everyone in my family enjoyed all of the entrees and appetizers but I'd have to say the highlights (aside from the epic Shrimp and Grits) were the Fried Chicken (juicy, tender and uniquely flavorful), the jambalaya risotto balls (SO FREAKING FLAVORFUL and moderately spicy) and the country captain braised duck leg. 

Also, don't forget to check out the cocktail menu - the drinks are very well made!

Happy Eating, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
Came here with high expectations but sadly it didn't quite delivered. 

It's a southern style restaurant so their specialty is deep fried things. We ordered these:

- Deep fried biscuit with crawfish inside. It's a bit overcooked or it tasted like the oil has been used in awhile. It tasted a bit bitter and looks dark on the outside. It's also quite dry when I ate them. 3/5
- Cesar salad. It's quite good, but not really the main reason folks are here obviously. 4/5
- Shrimp and the grid. It's a shrimp inside mash potato like stew with a few sausages inside. It was good, but nothing out of ordinary. 3/5
- the main dish: fried chicken meal (4 pieces). Similar to the the deep fried biscuit, it tasted a bit bitter. Again probably caused by over frying or the oil being used a lot. It's also quite dry so it really wasn't good. 3/5
- a great treat is the root beer float courtesy of Mitchell' ice cream across the street!

So overall it's not as good as I expected. I was told that this is not normal and the chicken should taste much better and moist. Oh well maybe it's one of those days...
author: Erick K.

description: Great food! I would recommend this place to anyone whose visiting the city. Theirs food is all delicious, they can make you any drink (I say that because I asked for a michi, and places usually don't know what that is), the reservation set up was ready on time, the staff was user friendly and helpful, and the desserts were to die for! The only thing we hard double with was parking but that's the city in general. Try this place if you're looking for new experiences:)
author: Janeth R.

description:
Walking around Bernal Heights for coffee and ice cream, the entrance to The Front Porch caught my eye. One of those hidden gems that causes you to double back to check out the name and the menu out front.

On what became a rainy Sunday morning, the gf and I decided to indulge in some delicious Southern brunch.

*WARNING* Chicken and waffles take super long! They do mention this ("please allow 25 minutes"), but with a packed house, it seems like everyone has gotten their food, before you... and evidently except rest of your table too. You've been warned... and hope your table doesn't hate you for delaying their food.

Anyways, when the chicken and waffles did finally come out (definitely far after the 25 min mark), it was an amusing little arrangement of three small pieces of chicken on top of a waffle. Wow, I've had loads of fried chicken come out faster than this, and either in larger quantities or better cooked, or both. Were they launching chickens towards the sun, and just waiting for their return?

The sweet potato and pulled pork hash was alright. Nothing special. A little greasy, but filling for a long day ahead.

I can see this place being a really fun spot for food towards the dinner time, but it's pretty mediocre when it comes to brunch.
author: Kevin J.

description:
Ohhh lordy lord...The Front Porch has some dee-licious fried chicken! We came here for brunch and got the chicken and waffles and biscuits and gravy. This place would've been a solid 5 stars in my book if it weren't for the biscuits and gravy, but unfortunately this dish was lacking a little in every aspect. The biscuits were too hard and even though the gravy was creamy, smooth, and infused with sausage-y flavor without being overly salty, there just wasn't enough of it in the bowl to sop up the biscuits with. Plus, my dish only came out warm and not hot, so you can imagine how it might be a bit unpleasant finishing up cold, stiff biscuits with not enough gravy (see pic: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wxzx3duu1c0CcomzEOvfOQ?select=119nzF-q8qHfGuiTMkdisQ) ...quite disappointing.

But, back to the chicken. This is some of the juiciest, most flavorful chicken I've ever had. There's just enough breading on the outside to give a little crunch. And if you get the chicken and waffles, be sure to try it all together - the combination of crispy waffle, rich butter, salty-crunchy chicken, and sweet maple syrup is just amazing. I probably clogged my arteries and risked a heart attack eating this meal but trust me, I would have died a very happy person!

Fun ambience too, it feels comfy and I like that they cover the bathroom doors with curtains :). Prices are all right for a brunch place ($14 for chicken and waffles and $7 for biscuits and gravy). So definitely come here and get the chicken...other dishes may not wow you as much.
author: Clarice W.
