Delicious!!  Their food is a little more fancier than Hard Knox but still delicious.

Date night consisted of crawfish etouffee fries, gumbo, mac & cheese, and fried chicken.  My faves were the fries and mac & cheese, which is better than Hard Knox's, while the gumbo was good enough.  By the time the fried chicken came out, we were so full and the chicken just looked daunting.  It had a great crispy skin and the meat was juicy.  We also ordered the Creole Gimlet and Peach Pit drinks that were both refreshing.

On a nice spring night, I would've liked to sit outside on the porch since inside can get stuffy and warm.  Other than that, I look forward to coming back to Front Porch.
author: Jane N.

description:
Took my girlfriend here for Valentines Day and I'm glad I did. Service was great and everyone was friendly. I originally had reservations at 945pm, but called in advance just to try my luck to get in early, and the host was able to fit us in at 715pm. They had a nice little candle to set the mood, and had the lights dimmed down. Food came fast and was perfect.

The only downside is parking. It took us 15 minutes just to find parking, and we ended up parking in the Safeway parking lot around the corner, but be careful because there are a lot of homeless and random people lurking in the area. 

Other than that we will definitely be coming back!
author: Jordan S.

description: Just like on the TV Show Triple D. The DR Pepper braised short ribs were amazing.
author: Tommy A.

description: Good food but they have NO heat! Its an icebox inside and not recommended for winter!
author: Ann O.

description:
Overall a good dining experience. Lighting was on the dim side, but the food definitely delivered. Servers checked up on us regularly which I appreciated.

Fried Chicken - Perfectly fried skin with a juicy and flavorful interior.
Fried Pickles - On the greasy side, but the Tabasco aioli was great
Deviled Eggs - The bacon jam was a nice compliment
Frito Pie - Good mix of crispy textures with the savory chili and cool sour cream.
Hazelnut Bread Pudding - Warm and hearty without being overly sweet.
author: Tim G.

description: Excellent service and food. We slipped in without a reservation and snagged an outdoor table for two with rocking chairs at around 10:30 on a Saturday morning. No wait. We tried a couple of brunch cocktails and coffee, all yummy. But the highlight was the stoner stack, which came with a perfect biscuit and nice crisp bacon. We also got the chicken and waffles. The waffle had a nice savory flavor but wasn't as crisp as it could have been. Overall though, great experience.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Finally got around to trying this place and totally glad I did. If you can I do suggest eating on the porch because i swear it gives your food a different flavor just because of the ambience (which is really why I'm giving this place 4 stars). We started off with the hush puppies because that's what I saw most popular on the reviews, let me save you, DON'T order them. I was so sad that I didn't love these because I wanted to so bad. They seemed dry to me and lacked a lot of that crawfish flavor you'd expect. We went on with ordering a bucket of chicken, mashed potatoes, Mac n cheese and biscuits which were overall satisfying and comforting. The chicken is delicious with it's crunchy flavor packed exterior and so moist and tender inside. The MAC n cheese was extremely cheesy (and greasy) I like it but not sure if I loved it. But overall great ambience and comforting food. I would recommend someone to give this place a try. 
P.s. Order biscuits, you just have to. Sooo good
author: Reina C.

description: Mmmm. This place is so good it will make you smack your mama! I'm serious. I actually called my mom and scolded her for no reason after eating here.  The food is authentically southern, which I didn't think was possible to recreate in the West Coast.  You really can't go wrong with this menu.  The seating space outside is small and not too convenient.  But otherwise I can't complain.  I would eat here again.
author: Hen T.

description: I liked the front porch. However with so much hype to the place it really made it difficult for me to have my own true opinion. With that said...lets start this review. It's a Saturday afternoon on a busy pride weekend. We have had a lot to drink and are now hungry and realize hey we're close to the front porch let's call and see if we could maybeeee get in. Luckily it wasn't so busy yet because it was early, they said sure come in we'll get you seated right away and sure enough we showed up 30 mins later and were seated at the bar. We gander the menu and make a couple of decisions. I ordered a bourbon ginger beer and my partner got a water. The drink was made stiff-perfect. Now on to the food. I ordered the 4 piece fried chicken with collard greens and mashed potatoes. My wifey got a hamburger with their own homemade American cheese, now normally I'd be like Hunnie...American cheese? Lol but she seemed pretty dead set on that decision so we went with it. My food came out on a tray with a line of popcorn on the side. I would've throughly enjoyed that but I have braces so I had to refrain, a bit odd to be there but I think my wife thought they were good. The collard greens were not my favorite, they weren't chopped up like I'm used to and they simply tasted a little funny to me. The mashed potatoes came with a scoop full of gravy which always pleases me so brownie points there and the friend chicken was crisp on the outside and tender on the inside which was great. BUT the big winner for us was the hamburger. The fries were just ok as they seemed to be a bit soggy but the hamburger itself was on a semi sweet soft bun and it was juicy, but what made it really special was that darn cheese! My goodness! I would definitely come back for the burger.
author: Guisela L.

description:
I can't get enough of this place. The shrimp and grits with a side of gumbo (hell yea!), the bucket of fried chicken (UH-MAZING), the collared greens, fried okra, the crawfish hushpuppies, baked mac n' cheese, the HAMBURGER--omg, it just don't stop! Even the nice little cornbread bites they give you with jalepeno butter to kick off the meal, EVERYTHING here is ridiculously tasty.

Sit out (literally) on their front porch and turn on the heat lamp if it's cold for a fun dining experience. It's cozy and the service is top notch. Or, hang inside for the semi-dive bar vibe; get a drink, score a table and get ready for one helluva food coma.
author: DJ P.

description: Food was amazing. Fried pickles was nice but the chicken and greens were to die for. Service was cool and the inside was very surprising.
author: Terry E.

description:
Dinner was ok, I left feeling meh. and yelp says meh is 2 stars.

Everything was OK. The potatoes, mac n cheese, hush puppies, chicken. Nothing stood out to me. I was expecting to be blown away by the chicken. For the price, I was just expecting something a bit better.

I have no problem with the food, just nothing to write about. I'd rather go to Popeyes.

 I went at 5:30, so it's that perfect time to get parking spots, but in general it can be tough to park there
author: Glenn M.

description:
It's okay.  Fried chicken was actually really good, though it takes about 20- 25 mins to make.  But boy is it crispy....and oily.  Guess it has to be!  However, it's pretty expensive, going for about 18 bucks for 4 pieces.

I also had the duck leg, which was also good.  Nothing to rave about, and certainly not worth the price.

Service was friendly, and it's a nice place, but I just can't justify spending quite a bit for something that was mediocre.
author: Andy V.

description: I have mix feeling about this place. Second time coming here, and we got the fried chicken which is really good. unfortunately, I wasn't to happy with the side and the appetizer I got. The fried appetizer (forgot what I got) was burned , and it was black ( I can see it was really dark inside the restaurant).
author: Jasmine Y.

description:
Pretty darn awesome eating here. Oh and the service is right up there too.  With the help of SeatMe via Yelp, the experience from beginning to the end was just perfect.

We arrived for our Noon reservation via SeatMe and we were promptly seated in the dining room.  The restaurant is very dimly lit; I probably would've prefer sitting outside, but outside seating is limited to 4  tables. The menu consisted of small bits, their specialties, mains, Benedict options, and a po'Bot Sammie section.  Given there are 4 of us, we opt to share a little of everything.  We ordered the beignets, fried okra, and gumbo to start...oh and I did try their Bloody Mary with candied bacon rim.  The gumbo came first, then the okra and end with the power sugared beignets.  My favs were the gumbo and beignets. The paras were good but I didn't really taste much flavor in the okra.  They also use the okra in the Bloody Mary and I didn't think it did much to the Mary...maybe I'm a traditionalist.

For the main course, we chose chicken & waffle of course, the egg and grits, and the crab cake po'Boy. They were all delicious. The grits were all cheesy and buttery creamy goodness.  The Chicken and Waffle was cooked to perfection.  The meat was juicy and skin was crispy combined with the bacon waffle...yes there are bits of real bacon in the waffle.  The crab cake  po'Boy was served between a soft baguette and also served with home cut fries. The crab cake is fried to perfection and the sandwich is lightly smeared with remoulade.  The food were just fantastic and they were timed perfectly since we were sharing and enjoying our conversation. We never felt we were overloaded with food nor did we feel like we had to wait forever for the next course.

Our server was a young girl from South Africa.  Very pleasant and attentive.  Making sure our beverage was refilled and to check in on use from time to time. It was a perfect start to our SF adventure day. Will definitely be back to try other yurmmy items on the menu.
author: G K.

description:
Just went- server(s) were insulting. 
 
Pros' - Reservations process was easy even with adjustments, food was very good. I rate on food. Everyone is an asshole sometime.

Cons- Staff was spread too thin, was a bit slow but that's understandable it was the end of Sunday brunch time. Less understandable but not horrible as we sat and chatted we didn't realize they were closing. Instead of asking us to wrap it up they turned up the music super loud and shot us contorted looks as they walked past our table. was actually insulting, was as we left the waitress exclaimed loud enough we could hear it outside "ohhh soooo nice, thanks for the big tip, sooooo generous, 10 dollars." Mind you I'm a repeat customer and have lots of ppl I have referred to this place. My mom asked me if I tipped well cuz clearly the woman was upset/shouting after us (and my mom raised me to tip well) also the behavior was pretty shocking. I pulled out the bill and showed that I had left a tip of %15. It was weird and embarrassing in front of my family.
author: Malachi G.

description:
Tried some new additions to the menu this last time.
The creamed-corn-with-bacon-and-truffle-oil side was mind blowing.
author: Heather Y.

description:
i barely brunch, we just never wake up in time and would rather sleep in.. when friends were in town and suggested we brunch, of course we obliged

ordered:
-beignets: not bad but they should be way fluffier, kinda dense

-french toast sticks: everyone preferred these over the beignets

-chicken and waffle: pretty good and huge portion! big enough to feed 2, or eat half and bring the rest home

-stoner stack: fried chicken, bacon, sausage gravy on a biscuit.. same as above, huge portion and oh so filling

-shrimp and grits: grits are really creamy and best i've had in a while.. nice big juicy shrimp as well

wash it down with
-housemade soda: soda of the day was blackberry

-bloody mary with bacon crack rim job: everyone loved the bacon crack, wish we could buy some!
author: Raquel T.

description: I learned about The Front Porch through Groupon.  Upon arriving we were seated immediately.  The place is pretty dim....dimmer than other restaurants for sure.  We decided to try the Mac and Cheese, the Holy Shit Burger, the pork chops, and the chicken.  The Holy Shit Burger is HUUUUUUGE!  I took two bites and was done!  It looked like it was made for 10!  Ok I'm exaggerating......but there was no way I could conquer eating that burger by myself.  The Mac and Cheese was extremely creamy and hot out of the oven.  I didn't try the pork chop as I don't eat a lot of pork, but my boyfriend loved it.  The fried chicken wasn't bad, but it was a bit dry.  This place can get pretty loud and pretty packed so try and make a reservation ahead of time.
author: Christine D.

description: Came here as a group of five for my birthday. Amazing food and drinks. Loved the shrimp and grits. Also-great service. Kevin, who was seating people, let our party sit outside and start drinking while waiting for our table. Thank you to all!
author: Kate A.

description: Amazing! Glad I stumbled in here with a friend on NYE and was able to get a table. We both had the shrimp and polenta, so good. I still dream about it.
author: T J.

description: Great spot for a weekend brunch. Came here for the first time today and was blown away! Started with the fried okra, really good and the jalapeño aioli was the perfect compliment. For my my course I had the stoner stack...wow was it delicious! Chicken was perfectly fried and seasoned and the gravy was very tasty. Really impressed with the Front Porch, definitely coming back for dinner, highly recommend this place for its authentic savory southern style food.
author: Josue V.

description:
Amazing brunch!! I've been here for dinner but had no idea what I was missing by not coming to brunch.

We started with mimosas, which were served in wine glasses but were very generous portions.

Food:
- Sweet potato and pulled pork hash with poached eggs: amazing smoky pork flavor balanced with sweetness from the potatoes, then with runny egg yolk. It was like bbq pulled pork but without the sauce, and it made a great non traditional hash
- Stoner stack: BEST breakfast sandwich I've ever had. It's a juicy fried chicken breast that's perfectly seasoned, topped with a runny egg, melted cheese, bacon, a creamy gravy, all stacked in between buttery biscuits.  It must have been over 1000 calories, but it was so worth it.  I was actually sad when there was no more of it left, and I'm definitely getting this next time I come back.

Unlike most brunch places, you can actually make a reservation!  I was able to get a last minute reservation pretty easily on Open table, and we totally bypassed the line of people outside.
author: Marilyn T.

description:
Nice, cool, kinda unique ambience, I was laughing at myself bec. the place is too dark that I couldn't even see what I'm ordering and what I'm eating, probably I just need an eyeglass.

The food are excellent, corn bread is really really a must, fried chicken is excellent, the mac N cheese are also great but I'm not a fan of their greens, it's has a different flavor that I can't understand, but to sum it all food are really great, aside from that the price is also reasonable.

Server are all friendly and fantastic, thumbs up !!!
author: Marie R.

description:
The bf and I decided to skip out on the flugtag event to grab lunch instead.  I've been wanting to come here for the longest time now but it was always packed or closed.  On a beautiful sunny day in San Francisco, I was expecting to wait in line for at least 30 minutes.  We arrived at the Front Porch at 12:30pm and guess what, no lines!  

We ordered the chicken & waffles, mac & cheese, and baked French toast.  I am on the hunt for the best mac & cheese in town and this by far is thee best!  And the chicken & waffles here barely topped Famerbrowns Little Skillet.  The french toast was ok, although they did have a tasty bananas foster dipping sauce.  This meal was more than enough for the two of us; we could've passed on the French Toast and still leave with a full belly.
author: Linda N.

description:
This place did not disappoint.

I ordered the 4-piece fried chicken, fried pickles, and the side mac n cheese. I overdid it and ordered too much. The portions are huge.

I thought all the flavors were incredible. The fried chicken was so moist, definitely the best thing there. The fried pickles with the aioli sauce were delicious as well.

Would come back for sure. The food (southern) was just really heavy, so it's only for nights when you want to be gluttonous!
author: Carleen W.

description: This is a great little spot for some delicious home cooking. Very hearty comfort food served in a dive-like setting. Shrimp and grits are awesome!
author: Sam A.

description: Service was good but food was overrated and overpriced. Went to try to the famous dr.pepper short ribs after seeing it highlighted on the food network. Ribs were dry and had no flavor..  very disappointing.
author: Shilla A.

description: This place is amazing. Delicious food! I had the fried chicken and waffles; that chicken was cooked to perfection - the outside was so crispy yet tender and juicy in the inside. The Mac and cheese is simply sinful! Soo flavorful! If you're in the vicinity or just want some good creole food, this place is IT.
author: Nita C.

description: Went there July 15, 2016, specifically for their shrimp & grits!!  Only place in San Fran we could find serving this.  It was a very quaint place!!!  The shrimp & grits were good but very spicy compared to what we were used to from Florida.  The menu outside had reg.shrimp & grits, then spicy shrimp & grits, but when we went inside they only had the spicy, and that they were, and the price on the menu was wrong by 4.00!!  I think they should update their menu inside!  We won't go back
author: Karen T.

description:
Tucked into a hip, local street in Bernal Heights, The Front Porch is located on the first floor of an apartment building. The decor is absolutely adorable and homey, with rocking horses, a diverse array of potted plants, and small windows with curtains. This is the type of restaurant that belongs in a movie where the characters go on a perfect first date.

- Fried Okra with Jalapeno Aioli ($7.50): I loved the contrast in texture between the fried breading and the squishy okra. The jalapeno aioli is not too spicy, and really gives a good kick of flavor.

- Biscuits ($4.50/2 biscuits): These come with preserves and sage butter. Nothing special; I guess KFC has ruined my biscuit standards.

- Baked Mac & Cheese ($8): I liked the shell-shaped pasta they used as the mac, and the cheese is not too overpowering. I did find this a bit undercooked.

- Apple + Spice Brined Pork Chop ($21): I appreciate a good savory and sweet combination, and I'm really impressed by how much the apple flavor comes out in the meat. The homemade cranberry mustard on top of the pork chop is actually amazing (I don't like mustard, especially the grainy stuff, and I never choose to put it on my food). The bed of brussel sprouts and cornbread continued the savory and sweet trend.

- Mulled Wine ($8): Those small moments of London always make my heart break. The wine is heavy on the spices and lower on the sweet factor than what I was expecting, but this is probably the most similar I've had in the states.

All dishes come with a mini cornbread with sage butter. They also give you their two spice sauces (the lighter bottle is more spicy), which you can buy by the bottle for $6 or 8. The place was quite crowded on a Saturday night at 7:30PM, so make a reservation if possible.

Stare fondly at the rocking horses. Front Porch rocks!
author: Jessica F.

description:
I would eat at The Front Porch every night if my wallet and waistline could afford it!

My boyfriend and I went for the first time in January 2015 for his birthday after reading a bunch of reviews.  From start to finish, our experience was everything we could have hoped for and more!

We had the spicy grapefruit margaritas, which were so delicious I had to have two.  To start we split the fried okra and the fried dill pickles.  Each came with an aioli dipping sauce, and the jalapeno aioli was unbelievable!  It tasted great with both items.

For our meals, Zac got the fried chicken with greens and mashed potatoes.  He was a big fan!  I got the shrimp and grits and ate the whole plate!  It was fantastic!

We will definitely be going here again; maybe for my birthday...
author: Daphne W.

description:
Horrendous service. Acceptable food.

We had the misfortune to be served by a very rude bearded waiter (Cyrus) that literally threw the desert menus on the table, without looking at us.  His subsequent attempt at an insincere "apology" added insult to injury.  Very unfortunate in our beautiful and friendly city.

The food itself was okay. We got the flounder and the 4-piece fried chicken.

Will not be returning and will not be recommending this place to friends.
author: Stefan R.

description:
Heard about it for years, but never got here, until last night.

Went early, around 6PM on the recommendation of a friend. Boy was she right.

When we walked in there were a couple of folks at the bar and a few tables taken. Seated in a booth, just the two of us. Prompt service, and then a couple of coupes of sparking rose appear, and then menus and then a couple of corn muffins.

Liking this a whole lot!

Spicy food, yum yum, and so Southern, I felt like I was in some high class place in N'Orlens, I did. Shrimp and grits, fried stuffed squash blossoms, hanger steak and oh my goodness the fried chicken. Anybody who can make white meat chicken taste that good is a hero in my book, and these folks can. Amazing.

Love the okra, love it so. 

Great wine list, well selected and priced bottles and glasses available.

Decadent desserts, next time I wll save room to try one or maybe 3...

Good eating, nice staff, friendly crowd, and did I mention the fried chicken? 

Enjoy Y'all!
author: William M.

description:
Not only do I love comfort foods, but also love sharing those comfort food favorites with others. Especially when we have the same taste in good food, we seek it out and want to share our experiences. On a recent night out, we decided to take a little walk to the Front Porch for some fun and good eats. 

We arrived at Front Porch, while we were waiting we snagged some seats at the bar and ordered a bottle of Duvel for us to share. We were not as hungry, so we decided to split an appetizer and a meal to split.

To start we had the Blue Crab Corn Fritters w/ Criolla Remoulade - which were great. I love my crab and was happy to get a little seafood fix as part of the meal. 

They serve you cob shaped mini corn breads with a flavored butter. I only wish they were a little bigger, but they were tasty. 

For the main course we split the chicken plate, 3 pieces of juicy breaded fried chicken, garlic mashers and collard greens. Although they are not boneless chicken breasts, they cut the meat perfectly so that there are minimal bones and seemed like decent sized portions of food. Especially for two to share. 

The 3 Front Porch sauces they serve should be sold to the public, I want a set. I loved the green chili, the red sauce and the yellow habanero. Colorful yet very flavorful sauces are key and I love it spicy!!! 

We even made it out with some leftover, which I took a little leftover fried chicken which we diced up the next day and served on a homemade pizza. It was the bomb, next time I'll order the bucket and take the rest home!
author: Rebekah T.

description:
This is really closer to 3.5 stars, but just couldn't give 4. 
Highlights?  Crawfish hush puppies and the fried chicken.  (My petite girlfriend cleaned her plate!! 3 huge pieces of chicken, mashed potatoes and some greens that she devoured before I had a chance to see much!)
Low-lights:
Skip the deep fried pickles.  All batter-- disappointing because I think they make their own pickles.. So it's perplexing they slice thin little strips and then drench in batter.  Why not a healthy circular slice with a more meaty pickle?  Hmpf. 
My friends ordered the shrimp and grits .. Wasn't terrible wasn't memorable (I had brought one of them here because he was raised in Louisiana..
And he said it wasn't worth returning to have again)
I actually had the burger based on Yelpers and it was good .. Just ridiculously large. Had the other half for breakfast. 
We all had the spicy margarita -- it was just ok too.  I'm super bummed.  I wanted to give my friend a taste of real southern and he felt it fell painfully short.  
Also.. I didn't feel very tended to by our waitress.  The food runner did more for me than the waitress ever did.  She was very pleasant, but didn't seem to feel like working too hard. 
The neighborhood IS sketch randomly.  Just waiting outside briefly I had an encounter with a homeless woman trying to grab at my purse then proceeded to get into cars.  Just a random aside but it was a little sketch.
author: Kelly C.

description: Went there for date night, had a great time. They own the bar across the street so you can enjoy a drink there while you wait for a table. Had the deviled eggs and fried pickles to start, the poke and burger for entrees. Satisfaction taste buds all around. Staff is friendly and down to earth, and I have to mention, the bathroom was super cute! Next time we hope the weather is good so we can sit on the porch :)
author: Kaylene B.

description:
Sub-(sub) standard service,  took 3 people at the table to call the water out on the poor service and attitude for them to reluctantly apologize. 

Food was adequate,  a bit on the heavy side. 

Unlikely to return or recommend
author: M S.

description:
My recent experience at Front Porch has helped me to reassess my concept of 'comfort food' which usually makes me feel a bit queasy, in an excessive, beyond-fullness type of way.  However, my Shrimp and Grits: with garlic, spring onion, bacon, wild mushroom, and truffle ragout offered the perfect amount of sustenance and balance without being too overbearing on any specific flavors or oils, which has usually been my experience with southern food. 

If not for this dish again, I would happily return for another glass of the Malbec from Argentina, in which the peppery, barrel taste complimented the savory qualities of my meal.  Delicious.
author: Ty T.

description:
The waitstaff was friendly and helpful. They are so busy yet they kept up fine! The first one that helped saw we had little kids and brought us some menus that were better suited to their taste! Thank you for that! 

Lets start with the appetizer! Fried okra with a dipping sauce you want to spread on everything!! You can't go wrong getting this! It's small though ...so for a party of 6 maybe Two or three servings! 

This is actually my third time coming here in the last few years. The first time I tried it out I had just moved here and being born and raised and living whole life in and around New Orleans I needed a taste of home. 
The shrimp Poboy at the time did not disappoint! It was delicious and fresh!! 
The BF got that this time and loved it! 

The second time I came here I got the Shrimp and grits and also this time I ordered the same.  The reason why. It's like being home. A little spicy a whole lot of comfort!! I mix the sunny egg all the way through mine and add hot sauce to it and I swear if I close my eyes it's like my grandma just made it and set it down for me. I wish it had a bit more sausage but that's just because I'm a piggie when it comes to Andouille sausage! There's is a bit different than the Cajun Andouille I am used to. But all in all still delish! If you are Southern ...stop in and get a little bit of home! If you aren't Southern ...stop in and taste some Southern food!!
author: Crissandra K.

description:
Having lived in Atlanta for several years, my fried chicken palette has been thoroughly exercised. Choleeeeesterooool. Anyway, the fried chicken here is pretty good but any southerner might be a bit miffed to put down that much cash for a few pieces of fried chicken that is mediocre by dirty south standards. This is a strange criticism but the chicken just tastes a bit too clean/californicated? By clean I mean bland. Just used to a stronger pork lard taste in my fried chicken.  

Favorite part of the meal was the fried okra and macaroni and cheese. The mac and cheese was so bubbly good. You can practically do anything to okra and it'll be awesome. 

The place has a really laid back atmosphere but is a bit dark. If they increased the lumens just a lil bit, it would make a huge difference.  So, simply put, if you've grown up in the South and are a west coast transplant (like me), this will help to satisfy your soul food cravings. Personally, this acts as a painful reminder of what I've left behind in the ATL.
author: Linh S.

description:
Incredibly underwhelmed with the entire experience here. We left disappointed and spent the rest of the night questioning how this place received such high accolades on Yelp. 

Food: The food was disappointing. We had the Fried Chicken, which was basic and if blindfolded you wouldn't be able to taste the difference between their chicken and Roscoe's chicken. The Mac and Cheese was decent but wasn't anything to write home about. The Side of Biscuits was really the only saving grace at this place as far as our experience went. The biscuits are heavy, dense, and dry but the butter and jam that is served along side is very good. We decided to give the food one last shot and ordered the Beignets, but again we were underwhelmed. If they had been served with the jam then maybe they would have been a little more impressive. 

Service: The service was sparse and subpar to say the least. The Giants game was on at the bar and the entire staff spent most of the time watching the game. Getting their attention was a major challenge. It was so noticeable that the head chef even said something! The chef couldn't even see the entire staff watch the game from his viewpoint, but the fact that he noticed shows just how bad it was. He even told one of the waiters "it is more important to feed the guests than watch the Giants game." AMEN! 

Atmosphere: Their take on the front porch atmosphere is how I imagine a run down house's front porch would look like with a ton of crap on it. The inside is decorated with an odd variety of items. The booths are the back seat of a car equipped with seat belts and they serve your food on an assortment of small plates and cafeteria trays, which is unique. We were seated back by the kitchen and it was uncomfortably hot!  

Overall: This place receives a 2. This is one of the lowest Yelp review scores I have given but unfortunately it was earned. The service really lacked and the food was underwhelming. In a great foodie city like San Francisco there are so many wonderful options of places to eat and this is not one I would go back to. For the same price you could have a lovely meal in the neighborhood at Delfina or Flour+Water and have much better service, food, and overall value.
author: 50 State By 30 T.

description:
Solid fried chicken joint with equally strong side dishes. This combination is rare in my opinion. We ordered the fried okra, biscuits and benign to start. Everything came straight from the stove. The benign and the biscuits was perfectly golden and scorching hot. The texture is slightly more doughy than what I remembered from Cafe Du Monde in New Orleans, but amazing in its own right. I ordered the classic chicken and waffles (you can ask for all dark meat, no extra charge) and the chicken was tender and juicy with a perfectly crusted skin, not too much breading. The waffles are tough and a bit dry, not enough moisture and texture. I also tried the grits mixed in with cheese and eggs....yummzzz.
Perfectly fulfilling weekend meal with 100% complimentary food coma
author: Alice C.

description:
I'm not sure why this whole hipster thing annoys me so much. I just can't believe it hasn't blown over yet. Anyway the Front Porch was ready good and charming so the hipster crowd didn't even annoy me. In a Saturday brunch even! 

The shrimp and grits were great. Super flavorful red eye gravy. It was a little chilly today but I was just happy they didn't refer to their food as 'provisions'  

Oh yeah,  the 'stoner stack' looked amazing but I just wasn't feeling up to it. I might try it next time if I'm feeling brave.
author: Victoria W.

description:
My husband and I were looking for something different and tasty. I am so happy we arrived at The Front Porch. The atmosphere makes you feel at home and the service is on point, they leave a 40 of H2O and they give you corn bread to begin your meal with awesome butter! 

Our meal came out in a timely manner, we shared the heirloom and watermelon salad with feta cheese-huge portion completely sharable. We then ordered the cotija cheese fried CORN-tasty,deliciousness in your mouth. We also shared the 4 piece fried chicken meal with mash potatoes and okra, this portions were huge and the chicken was super tender in the inside and super crispy on the outside. We then ordered braised short ribs which were accompanied by a celery root puree with horseradish on top. ( I'm not a fan of horseradish so I removed it) The Meat was super tender! We didn't have enough room for dessert but I bet it's amazing.

If you want a great meal, you must go but just keep in mind it's pricey to eat Great food created by Great Chef's. My husband is a Chef and usually critics a restaurant from the moment we walk in, this place was the first place he had no negatives about except for no air conditioning but then again its SF and bldgs are old.  

If you're a group you can order a bucket of fried chicken!!! I will be back!
author: Iliana S.

description: Really bummed out that we had a reservation for 10 adults and 5 kids and when we showed up the hostess wouldn't even let me husband bring in the twin stroller (long one not double wide) and and they wouldn't let us bring in the car seats. They knew in advance about the kids and has said they would accommodate but it wasn't the case in person..... We missed the birthday party and drove 30 minutes for nothing. Huge let down.
author: Denise B.

description:
The Front Porch is a cozy, friendly restaurant. The staff is really friendly and the decor has a southern homey feel. Our waitress was really helpful. One downside to this restaurant is the fact that all the fried foods are cooked in the same fryer. Meaning that anyone with a shellfish/seafood allergy is unable to try any of the menu items that are fried. I wanted to try the fried chicken (duh! southern yummy) and when I informed the waitress that I had a shellfish allergy, I was told that ALL of the fried foods are prepared in the same fryer which means 1/2 of their menu was no longer an option for me!! I understand the kitchen is small but there should be an option that does NOT exclude certain customers. 
I ordered the short rib with broccolini and the mac and cheese. The short rib was cooked very well; very tender and it fell apart. BUT - the mac and cheese was disappointing. It was cheesy but that's about it. The mac and cheese was bland. Another downside: Southern cooking uses seasonings and this didn't taste seasoned. 
My friend had the blue crab hush puppies and the fried chicken (she doesn't have food allergies, lucky girl) w/garlic mashed potatoes and collard greens but was not impressed. She said the hush puppies were more corn meal tasting than blue crab. The fried chicken and collards were okay but needed more seasoning as well.
Overall this restaurant is just okay and for the amount we spent per person, we should have been blown away!
Again, a major plus to our experience was our waitress!! Very friendly and really helpful; however, we will not return.
author: Nicole C.

description: Me and my roommate decided to check this place out Friday evening. We drove by the place and realized that we already love the place. We asked for the table inside, since we really liked the interior design of the place. Food was delicious as well. My schnitzel was perfect, rommate's burger was good as well.
author: Natasha R.

description: Found this restaurant on yelp and based on the reviews I had to give it a try. Made reservations via open table and our table was ready when we arrived (no waiting on a Saturday night-score!). My boyfriend and I shared the gumbo, 4 piece fried chicken, Mac and cheese, and the bread pudding for dessert. Everything was amazing! This place is more on the expensive side but well worth it for the delicious food. Definitely will be back again.
author: Tracy C.

description:
So, the husband and I recently went on an impromptu date night and we wanted to have fried chicken...like really good chicken.  Since we had only been to one other place in San Francisco that had good chicken, we thought we'd try something new.  We searched on Yelp and found this place.

We were immediately drawn to the interior and the smells coming from the kitchen.  We hoped that the taste would match the yummy smells...smells that immediately transport you back to your childhood.

We were presented with a menu of comfort food...mashed potatoes, mac and cheese...standard stuff.  We saw a bucket of fried chicken and had to order it...along with a few sides.  The chicken was FANTASTIC!  Perfectly crispy on the outside and moist on the inside.  It was heaven.  The bucket came with 10 pieces and I since I only eat white meat, the breasts satisfied me to no end.  Nothing tasted greasy or unbalanced, but remember, this restaurant is all about comfort food.

The staff were great, the atmosphere very conducive for conversation...but the food was a home run with us.

I wholeheartedly recommend it.
author: Jake B.

description:
Maybe in order to justify eating southern food it needs to be sooo good that I don't feel guilty. I'd say the best thing we had here was the shrimp and grits - probably the best I've had. That said,  I like shrimp and grits ok and I was really here for the fried chicken, This was a little disappointing. It was really crispy and comes out fresh, but there wasn't as much flavor as other spots. I compare all fried chicken to farmer browns. 

Anyhow, overall a nice meal - but for my fried chicken fix I'll stick to farmer browns.
author: Komal B.

description: For brunch, had the beignets, chicken and waffles, and the catfish po'boy.  Beignets were light, airy and still hot.  Chicken was cajun seasoned and almost surprisingly tender.  Catfish was deep fried with a light batter, moist, and cooked just right.  Service was friendly, attentive and efficient.  Overall a nice experience.
author: S S.

description:
We were a party of 5 so I was able to try a lot on the menu. I thought their fried chicken was way underseasoned. I actually wondered if it was seasoned at all. I really liked the shrimp and grits but that's about it. Everything else was fine but nothing stood out.

It was a friday night and it was packed. The decor was really not my taste. It's messy, dark and grungy. We had to constantly wave down our server. She hardly came back to check on us.

I was not impressed.
author: Andy W.

description:
I have very mixed feelings of this place. The service went without a hitch, and I like the atmosphere. Going in at dinner time, I was able to sit at the bar without waiting. The food was all very well-assembled and presented, high in quality, and all exactly as described.

That said, let's talk about the food itself. I'm from the south, and was looking for some food that would remind me of home. I ordered the fried chicken dinner, which comes with greens and mashed potatoes, and an appetizer of deviled eggs. The food here suffers from what I'll call "San Francitis". There's such a pressure here for your food to be unique -- to have some hipstery/foodie gimmick -- that almost every dish has some kind of twist. In a tradition-driven comfort-food cuisine that reaches its greatest heights through simplicity, adding these twists can be a big risk. The deviled eggs, for example, have a dollop of jam on them; not a deal breaker in principle, but flavor-wise it completely doesn't work. The semi-tart sweetness of the jam overrides everything else in the savory egg. The main attraction is the chicken, and to be frank I am not a fan. The chicken is seasoned with lots of garlic. The chicken is pungent and almost spicy with garlic. It's not outright a bad flavor, but it's too intense. "Garlic chicken", the menu ought to say. Overall, it left me disappointed.

I understand why it's like this; there are other places frying chicken in the city, and each one has to do something to set themselves apart. But I'm still looking for the place whose gimmick is simply that they fry it the best.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
Is Bubba in the HOUSE?

Although I've never been to the South, The Front Porch gave me the "feel" of being in a rustic Mom and Pop Soul Food restaurant in the South. 

On Saturday, 6.5.10, my friend and I wanted to go grab a quick bite to eat before getting ready for a Saturday night out. We were headed to "Good Frickin Chicken", but thought it would be worthwhile to see how long the wait was at TFP since it's just down the block. We arrived at around 7:30 PM and was lucky enough to snag the last open table. 

FOOD:
*Blue Crab Corn Fritters w/ Criolla Remoulade ($11): YUMMY! The fritters were lightly battered and fried to a dark golden fried; although a bit over fried for my taste. It was filled with sweet and tender blue crab shreds and crisp yellow corn kernels. The remoulade was creamy, tangy, sweet and savory from the mayo, pickles and Worcestershire sauce and the horseradish gave a slight zing and nose tingle.   

*Fried Chicken w/ Mash potatoes and Collard greens ($16 for 3 pieces + $4.75 for an extra piece + $2 for all dark meat): The chicken's crust is very crispy and a bit on the thick side, yet it manages to not be greasy. The chicken is so moist and tender that as I took a bite into it, juices started to dribble down my chin--YUMS! It's already well-seasoned, but you can use their hot sauces (house and habanero) to add a fiery kick to the chicken. The mash potatoes were creamy w/ small chunks of potato for texture and had a hint of garlic flavor. But, the collards were a little too bitter for me. 

*Mac and Cheese ($6.50): OMG, if you love cheese, this is A MUST ORDER! Even w/o a breadcrumb topping, TFP's version has a gooey crunchy crust from the cheese that has broiled to a golden crisp in the oven. The elbow noodles are plump and al-dente and the béchamel sauce is creamy, savory, and decadent. This served alongside w/ the fried chicken is an epitome of what Southern comfort food is in my book! 

*Biscuits for Boobies ($6 for 2; all proceeds got charity): It was good, although I normally like my biscuits light and flaky. TFP's biscuits are very hearty, dense, and buttery. Served w/ sweet cream butter which may clog an additional artery or two. 

SERVICE:
It was ok, although it can be improved. Our waitress was friendly, however she seemed very overwhelmed. It took about 10 minutes to order and then she pretty much disappeared from there. I didn't get my ice tea until after our app was served and we had to flag down food runners for our bill.

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:
Rustic, funky, and cozy. Everything about TFP screams "The Old South"; from the wooden rocking chairs on the outdoor patio, potted plants, saloon style bar, and cute little porch chair ornaments scattered around the front bar area. LOVE IT!

PARKING:
TFP is located in Outer Mission where street parking is much easier to come by than around the Valencia and 16th Street area.

If you're looking for Southern comfort food that trumps Farmerbrown and 1300 on Fillmore (in a low-key environment) and that is a notch above Hard Knox, I highly suggest The Front Porch!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
We walked in on a Saturday afternoon around 1pm & the 3 of us had no problem getting a table. We were here strictly for drinks & all ordered a bacon blood Mary ($9). The drink was perfectly spicy & had candied bacon on the rim, yum! A thick cut piece of bacon would have been nice to have as a stirring device...

As we were enjoying our drinks, we kept seeing amazing food come out of the kitchen. A quick glance at the menu revealed southern delights like fried chicken with bacon and gravy over biscuits, Mac & cheese with chili, shrimp & grits. Everything looked awesome and all within the $10-$15 price range, pretty typical for a nice brunch. Definitely not the kind of meal you would eat if you were health conscious in the least bit, but more like what you'd eat after a long hard night of wine & bourbon!
author: Lori N.

description: This place has the absolute best burger I have ever had in my life. They make a homemade American cheese that is absolutely amazing. If you go here you MUST get a burger with their American cheese. I also had it with bacon. This is hands-down the best burger I've ever eaten, which encompasses New York, Los Angeles, Philadelphia, and San Francisco.
author: Mike S.

description: Decided to try some southern food. The chicken would take 30 minutes to cook but we had no patience because we were so hungry :(  But Instead, we ordered the fried Okra, mac and cheese, jambalaya, and a steak entree too...  Basically, just appetizer's for me because nothing else looks more appealing than the breakfast and lunch menu. Well.. The corn bread was good!
author: Yennie L.

description: Been here many times and just discovered it's one of the better brunch spots.   Great chicken fried steak and Bloody Mary.  Dinner also great. I love the vibe here and the people are uber nice
author: V N.

description: Perfect place for Sunday brunch, easy to find parking (such a bonus!).  Country Breakfast -  A+, Cheese Grits -soooo smooth, Mimosas  - yummy, Sweet Potato and Pulled Pork Hash -- ahhhhhh - yes please!  Seating outside in the front in rocking chairs is very cool.  All in all really great -- we'l be back!
author: Lisa W.

description: I did enjoy the place. I went for the fried chicken and it was very good. Not five star, for me , but four. The breading I did not like. The chicken was juicy and moist. The shrimp and grits were popular.
author: Miguel D.

description: Food and the atmosphere was great. Staff was nice and consistent. Came for dinner with friends. Got a bucket, mac, biscuits and shrimp and grits. Shared it between three people and had a little left over. Definitely will be coming back. Hopefully will try the brunch soon.
author: Jason B.

description:
Overall my experience at the Front Porch was great.. the food is the reason however. We had reservations for 11:45 am on a Sunday for brunch. The reason we made these reservations is because my friend had a flight that left a few hours later. We arrived early, informed the host she replied your table is getting up we will seat you immediately....

25 minutes later, after seeing others seat w/o reservations I begin to get frustrated, I approach the male on the floor and he states we didn't have you as arrived... 5 minutes later we sat at our table...

So besides the frustration of making reservations for NO REASON, we enjoyed a pretty good meal. 

We tried their soda of the day & their beignets, which made me feel a lot better about waiting so long.
author: Lei F.

description:
This place is so cute. It reminds me of Mono Loco in Charlottesville. Super chill, non-pretentious and I love the decor. They were cool about me bringing a pup with me, too. So, kudos for that one. 

Drinks, yes. Chicken, yes. Servers, yes. I love it. Oh, and the new (I think) owners seem super chill. Try out their bar across the street. Dig.
author: Elle N M.

description:
I came here with a large party for dinner on a weekend night. Given the size of our group, we called in ahead of time (1 hour), and the staff was so nice to set aside our table. Warning: it may have been the largest table they had -- anything over a party of 10 would have difficulty fitting in the restaurant around one single table.

The server was extremely friendly, and brought out more cornbread starters upon request. The dishes came out all at once, albeit it was more than a 25 min wait (approx. cook time for the fried chicken). The portions here are enormous (!!!), perfect if you are ravenous and craving some southern comfort food. I had the burger, that came with a nice helping of veggies and fries. The fries were so warm and hot -- they also had a special spicy powder on them that made it extra flavorful. The burger was very juicy, tender, and the veggies basically augmented the size of the whole burger 2x. (I was super hungry when I received my dish -- very piping hot, so watching out for minor scalding roof of the mouth if eating too quickly...)

All in all, would come back again for awesome food with good company!!
author: Hurnan V.

description:
YUM!

Fun, laid back atmosphere.  You can bring your furry babies if one of the porch tables is available.
author: Sarah H.

description: Staff is always friendly.  Reservations are always honored timely.    The hamburger is fantastic.  The Farmers Vegan is also wonderful.  A little pricey for what you get.
author: Karen K.

description: Just enjoyed a date night here with my boyfriend. It was our second time eating here together & being able to make a reservation ahead of time made the experience even better! The restaurant seating is quite limited as the place is small & the tables are pretty close together, but it's all part of the experience eating here. We enjoyed the fried okra and pork belly confit sliders as appetizers and they were both great, the sliders were my favorite. I had the 4 piece chicken dinner that comes with mashed potatoes and ham hock greens while my boyfriend had the Dr. Pepper braised short ribs & both dishes were amazing! Their serving sizes are generous and the service we received was great. We will definitely be back & will always recommend!
author: Danielle S.

description:
When people ask where is good fried chicken I tell them to come here! I love this place. Found out about it on Triple D a few years ago. I've been hooked ever since. Real chill atmosphere,  great service.  I always sit at the bar. Bartenders are super cool and the music was good.I had a couple of their signature drinks and they all were really good. 

Now for the main event.....The CHICKEN. It's made fresh to order, they tell you it's going to take about 25 minutes for your order to be ready. When you get it it's hot and fresh, super crispy, and juicy. You get9 about 4 pieces or so. I usually don't finish them all. The mashed potatoes and greens are a great addition.  You literally will want to lick the crumbs off your plate it's really that good! 

I've also tried the macaroni and the shrimp and grits. They were alright. I would just say stick with the star of the show and you will not be disappointed.
author: Brittany B.

description: Fantastic Food for Omnivores and Vegetarians alike! Fried chicken, okra and pickles, Mac & Cheese, biscuits, and the farmers vegan -- oh my! De-LISH!!!
author: Ranee T.

description: Finally tried this place and I luckily scored a seat outdoors in the "front porch". We had the crawfish hush puppies with some sort of dip. These 4 balls were fried with batter and had pieces of crawfish. These were just okay. Maybe I've been too spoiled by Brenda's crawfish beignet. We shared the 4 piece fried chicken plate with mashed potatoes w/ gravy and collard greens. Chicken was good! Then we had the shrimp n' grits. It was definitely missing the cheese. And the "sauce" or was it soup? It was too watery and the shrimps seemed a little overcooked. We skipped dessert because we wanted Mitchell's. I'm glad I finally got to try this place but I wouldn't come back.
author: Amy L.

description:
Food was excellent. The fried chicken was perfect: Crispy-crunchy on the outside, perfectly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Mac and cheese was delicious. And the banana pudding for dessert, omg, that was awesome....perfectly chilled, topped with whipped cream and nilla wafers, it was heaven in a cup. I didn't want to share, but because I'm nice and supposedly on some kind of diet (and ate way too much already), I decided to be nice and share with my darling cousin. 

Service was awesome. 

Will go back one day soon, hopefully.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Food takes over an hour. So plan ahead. Owner continued to remind us to leave by a certain time and told us that we couldn't order items because we wouldn't be out by the time she needs us out. She even asked us to move out party to the bar they own across the street! Rude, what kind of OWNER does that? Why would we want to put more money into one of their establishments. Our server was chill, that's the reason why I rate this place 2 stars instead of 1. Horrible customer service. Don't think I'll ever be back here. Not pleasant to dine In a hostile environment. Hey Front porch. like your stickers on your waters say "Chuck it in the fuck it buck it" and treat your customers better.
author: Hannah G.

description: After a decade since being hit in the chest with a cork from a celebration across the room, I have to say.. they still pop my top. A bucket of fried chicken. There need no other reason or excuse or justification, just get some fried chicken, and order The Porch Swing while you're at it. Also, my dad must run this place as the perfect mac n cheese is made with pasta shells.
author: Jon A.

description:
The Porch NEVER disappoints ! Just took another couple of mates here for SF Southern style and it rocked as hard as every other time. 

Fried chicken you'd sell your 18yo half blind vegan shitzu to get at. 

Cornbread of the gods, 

garlc mash and okra that makes love to your face and 

Service off the richter. example: server got our order wrong and delivered us bacon wrapped dates so we scored them GRATIS plus getting our original order shortly afterward... and now have a new fave appertiser.

Dont go changin to try and please me...don;t change the colour of your hair !! Porch FTW
author: Gordon E.

description: Wow what a modern twist on good ol' country food. The decor is new aged but the food makes it feel like home. The dr.pepper short ribs is a home run for your taste buds. Everything from the start to finish was amazing. I highly recommend
author: Giovanni R.

description: This place USED to be amazing, and I mean driving over the bridge for Sunday breakfast for months kind of amazing. The stoner stack was killer. However things have changed.  I'm not sure if it has changed ownership or cooks but the food is nowhere near the same.  Used to be amazing fluffy biscuits for the stoner stack, which are replaced with dry thin wanna be bread biscuit, fried chicken is not as fried, potatoes are not seasoned at all anymore, & skimpy on the gravy.  I don't know, it's not like the food was terrible but its turned into an overpriced mediocre just like every other SF breakfast place.  The service was great, and still continues to be great, its just the actual food that really has changed to mediocre.
author: Lindsey C.

description: Fantastic place off the beaten path.  Great food and well mixed cocktails. The southern food is totally legit!!!
author: Jeff R.

description: This place is fine. I'm writing this review to hopefully balance it out a bit because this place is nice and lovely but I wouldn't say it's amazing. I came here because someone told me they thought the friend chicken here was amazing, and personally I thought it was just fine. The meat wasn't really flavorful enough, not enough salt for my taste, and the crust, again was just fine. Don't understand the hype.
author: Dee K.

description:
Cool vibe but I was not super impressed with fried chicken. Had a nice texture but lacked any spice or pop. Collard greens and Ham had a strong vinegar after taste and as hard as I tried could not find a single piece of ham.  Baked mac was good and the frito pie was good as well. 
Bummed still on the chase looking for a really good fried chicken spot in SF.
author: Will W.

description:
I used to love this restaurant, until I visited the South.

My fiancée is from South Carolina and I learned that no one in the South would pay $30+ for fried chicken, unless it fed 15 people.

Southern cooking isn't supposed to cost much. I've been to Husk (look them up on YELP) in Charleston, SC, that has been featured in many food and travel shows and didn't pay that much.

However, the food here is good. Just be ready to pay for what is supposed to be Southern Comfort Food at uncomfortable prices.
author: Nino P.

description:
I took my girlfriend here on a whim and we were BLOWN AWAY. I've been craving New Orleans / Creole food since I moved to the city and The Front Porch really exceeded our expectations.

Everything from the appetizers to the main course meals were fantastic. A few highlights:

- Fried okra appetizer with jalapeno aioli - a MUST try
- The aioli in general, that came with the appetizers (tabasco + jalepeno) 
- The table-side hot sauces - they're no joke and are respectable to anyone who likes to play with fire.
- Spicy jalapeno Margaritas!
- The 4 Piece Fried Chicken meal was delectable - you have to try it at least once
- Shrimp & Grits - I'm getting this next time because I kept picking at my girlfriends bowl the whole meal.

In addition, I was really digging the intimate / social atmosphere of the place. The  lighting is semi-dark, with tables positioned closely to each other so the restaurant was full of chatter and there was never a dull moment. If you want more space, there are tables outside under a canopy.

DEFINITELY coming back here - this might very well be our go-to place in San Francisco whenever we want some "us" time and a kick ass meal.
author: Zachary S.

description:
A friend had heard great things about the Front Porch so we decided to give it a shot on a Friday night.  Although we didn't get reservations in advance, he was able to get a two top pretty easily around 8pm.  Fortunately it was a nice night so we were able to sit outside, the interior is fairly small and I can understand how it might be difficult to get a table.

I've never truly enjoyed fried pickles before, but this was definitely an exception.  Instead of frying the entire pickle, they slice them into thin chips and then fry them.  While I wouldn't have ordered this myself, I won't complain that my friend did.

The short ribs and vegan risotto cakes were quite good as well.  The ribs were tender and tasted great with the celery root puree.  Both meals were pretty large so we weren't able to finish everything.  I definitely feel like these are the type of dishes you'll want to share.

Get the biscuits!  Seriously some of the best I've ever had.  It took them a few extra minutes to come out and I thought to cancel the order, boy am I glad I didn't.  So fluffy and delicious.

Important note - do not park in Safeway!  Two people were getting towed as I got back to my car and I just thank my lucky stars that I didn't.
author: Michelle K.

description:
For Him: Fried Chicken with greens, mashed potatoes and a popcorn garnish
For Her: vegan risotto with a Cajun flair 
+ yummy cocktails
+ cornbread bites with deliciously infused butter
+ crawfish hush puppies
+ hot sauce increasing the flavor by a power of wow
+rocking chair out door seating (dog friendly!)
= 2 Stuffed bellies
author: Loren K.

description:
SO GOOD.

Fried Okra = delicious
Sweet potato Hash = delicious
THE GRITS ARE AMAZING
Fried Chicken was good

The hot sauce was so good we bought 2 bottles to take home. We will definitely be back!
author: Michelle D.

description:
The Front Porch is one of those places that I have come to adore. I am not the biggest fan of Southern Food so I was feeling a little meh after a few dinners. Then we discovered their brunch.

No matter what I am in the mood for at brunch time, Front Porch can satisfy. 

More Lunch than Brunch: Caesar Salad with Shrimp
Hungover Eating is Hard Edition: Hangover Helper
Hungover but Feed Me Edition: Stoner Stack
I Need Boring: Eggs Benedict with Spinach and Goat Cheese
Starving: Burger with Fried Egg & Bacon
Veggielicious: Seasonal Scramble

Big fan! Be warned that their coffee is Chicory coffee. I stick to Sweet Teas or Bloody Mary's instead.
author: Ge O.

description: The interior decor was quite homey.  Porkchop was good, wish they would've put the horse radish on the side tho, that kind of ruined the flavor.  Fried chicken was pretty decent, collard greens were ok ... nothing too special about this place.  A bit pricey for some Southern food.
author: Chio S.

description:
Pulled together.

Sweet potatoes. Pulled pork. Bell peppers. Onions. Poached eggs.

Not my usual combination but perhaps it should be. So rich and so good.

Reasonable $13 considering it was big enough to be both breakfast and lunch. Such is the beauty of brunch. Extra $4 for two homemade biscuits and jam was worth it too.

On such a mild January day it was nice to sit out on the literal front porch as the overhead heater kept things toasty.

Server was attentive, personable and friendly. Calculating my tip afterward thought it was above 15% but actually left 14.8%. My apologies Brianna, you were great.

Will pull it together better next time. As you all certainly did today.

- - - - -

2/1 Update: Reconciling credit card receipts discovered an extra $3 was charged to my card. Letting it go because of the short tip. Mistake might have been mine.
author: Jason B.

description:
...first time there, and brunch did not disappoint.
Spicy Shrimp & Grits washed down with spicy Bloody Marys was a winning combo!

We definitely want to come back for dinner so that we can try the Gumbo and the fried chicken, that was not available for brunch. Chill vibe. A tad too noisy, indoors but the patio is sweet with good weather.
author: David G.

description: Our family came for lunch and they were even able to bump up our reservations because we got there really early due to our game getting rained out. The food is delicious, excellent fried chicken. Just spicy enough, but not mouth burning hot. The only thing is it took a really long time to get our drinks and we felt like we all needed booster seats because the booth was so low in relation to the table height. Otherwise a great place for some southern style food, shrimp and grits, country fried steak, but they do use a tad too much butter in their scrambled eggs, so go with a poached egg or something if you don't like butter forward eggs.
author: Lisa B.

description: Good stuff! 9pc fried chicken, shrimp n grits, Mac n cheese, fried okra, and a pimms Georgia peach. Chicken was not your typical KFC oilyness and didn't require any hot sauce. The shrimp was cool, nothing too special. Mac n cheese is a must side. I'd come back.
author: Minh H.

description: The ambience is nice and that's about it....this is NOT southern creole food....I ordered Greens and Mac and Cheese, and the greens tasted like they had been doused in vinegar....the Mac and Cheese was very bland. Also my date had the burger and fries and the burger had no flavor at all.....I say these guys get better recipes or better cooks
author: Char B.

description:
The fried chicken is ABSOLUTELY to die for. I do not think I've had better fried chicken. It's so crunchy and flavorful on the outside, and so even more flavorful and juicy on the inside, even the white meat! I love how it comes with sprinkles of popcorn. The chicken was not greasy at all which I love. It's definitely enough for three people, a bucket of 9 pieces. 

The other thing I love about the Front Porch is there freaking biscuits. How do you do it? They're flaky and dense at the same time, and when you spread that butter and then the jam on top of it, it's like a religious experience (and I'm not religious). 

Mac and cheese. Yum. Cheesy. Goodness.

Definitely too much food for three people. I do have to say that I did not like the collard greens, and it's not to say that it wasn't good, I'm just not a collard green person. Can I sub it out next time for mac and cheese? That would be perfecto!
author: Vanessa K.

description:
The fried chicken is heaven.  It is a little sad that I will never know what else is on the menu.  Because I am never going to order anything else.  BEST FRIED CHICKEN EVER!!

Oh yeah, the atmosphere and neighborhood is so uber cool SF.  Awesome....
author: Gabriel B.

description:
I can't believe it had been so long since the last time I was at Front Porch!  There are so many restaurants in San Francisco to choose from that it can take awhile to come back to the same place twice even if you like it a lot.

This place was perfect for my friend and I to meet and catch up since it is near to where she lives, and it is also convenient to public transportation (Muni J and 49) for me.  

Plain and simple, we wanted everything FRIED!  :)  We got the bucket of fried chicken (love how it comes with popcorn sprinkled all over the tasty fried chicken, great as leftovers too), fried pickles (tasty tangy pickles in crispy batter), fried okra (love fried okra period!), and dessert (I forgot what we ordered, I am not a big dessert person plus I was so full I could only eat a couple spoonfuls - but my friend enjoyed it!).  

We also had a couple cocktails.  They added vodka to sweet tea - loooved this (I LOVE sweet tea)!  And then later we both had mulled wine, which is warm, slightly tart and comforting good!  Cheers!

Service was real nice and friendly, and Front Porch is definitely a fun, lively place to go for a yummy meal.  Loved it!
author: Maile N.

description:
I ordered the fried chicken for dinner and it was delicious. The decor is unique and very artsy and certainly is a cool spot to go to on a Saturday night :)

Everyone should try this place!
author: Eric L.

description:
Came in for dinner with a group of friends here the other night.

The food - 4 stars
The service - 1 star
Averages out to - around 2 stars

Let's start with the good! The food. We had fried chicken, collard greens, mac and cheese (had to ask for another serving of this because it was too good), mashed potatoes, bacon wrapped dates, and maybe one other thing.. all of it was super yummy and filling and hot. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it! 

Try a Sazerac cocktail if you haven't before. They make a pretty decent one here. It's big in New Orleans. It's strong and medicinal.

Now we have to talk about the service. Our waitress made us feel extremely unwelcome. She showed very obvious attitude anytime we had a request for her. Service was slow. You could tell she hated us and hated being there. At the end of the meal we asked her to split the bill the way we had written it on the back. You would have thought we asked her to comp our entire meal or something. I know it's annoying when it's busy and people want to split the bill, but you are in food service and treating your customers like they are horrible little children is not acceptable. She and another colleague also made sarcastic comments to us as we walked out the door. Not sure what we did to piss her off, but even then it's not okay.. I can't think of any other time in my life that I thought somebody deserved less than a 20% tip.

Other notes: It is EXTREMELY loud in here when it's crowded. You must shout quite a bit to be heard.
author: Sonya Z.

description:
If dinner on my Birthday here was a representation of the quality of food they put out on a normal basis then I do not know how they two stars let alone four.

I ordered the Spicy Shrimp and Grits, the grits had so much butter that some bites tasted like I was eating a stick of butter. Moreover, the shrimp were mushy like they had been frozen then defrosted many times over and they had a dirty dishwater taste about them. The sausage flavor was lost under their use of their Habanero hot sauce to make it spicy. Hot yes flavorful, no. 

One friend ordered the Dr. Pepper Braised Beef Short Ribs and man were they ever tough and flavorless. The only redeeming feature was apparently the grilled broccoli rabe. 

The other friend ordered the 4 piece fried chicken and it came out greasy, dipping oil greasy. The coating was crisp but had practically no seasoning and the chicken was moist but was void of any flavor. Plus the pieces are so small. I have seen chicken breasts that had more meat on them than the pieces on the plate had. The mashed potatoes and collards were the best part.

I would be hard pressed to try this place again other than Mitchell's Ice Cream being a short walk away.
author: Ray S.

description:
In town for the sole purpose of completing my husband's promise to take me to his list of the best restaurants in San Francisco.  Gary Denko was on the agenda for tonight, so we wanted something entirely different. We wanted something less precious than most Of the fare offered in San Francisco, so we decided on, what we thought would be, Southern cooking.  Mac and cheese, collard greens and fried chicken, what could be more Southern?

We were seated right away outside at a bar table.  Perfect size for drinks, our table was a whole twelve inches wide.  We immediately took off all the stuff that was on it and set it on the ledge next to us.  Since we knew what we wanted, we ordered quickly.  Mac and cheese, fried pickles, biscuits and the chicken plate.  We weren't asked if we wanted drinks, so we forgot to order them.  

Out came the first item quickly enough, the biscuits.  

Really. The biscuits?  Where were the pickles? 

The biscuits were fine.  I have had better, and Lord knows, I have had worse. 

Then came... Two of the tiniest corn muffins I have seen.   I couldn't help wondering if I should eat mine or take it home to plant it to see if it would grow.  

Still, no pickles.  

Then, foot tapping silence.  

The waitress came and the hubby asked for soda. 

More waiting.  Soda came.  

Then the chicken plate with, you guessed it, the pickles.  

Thinly sliced, the pickles were not at all oily.  Nor did they have any flavor.  I wondered how dill pickles could be flavorless.   Had I liked the sauce, they might have been fine, but I didn't.  

The chicken was tender, crispy and not oily.  Nor did it have any flavor.   I was starting to see a trend.  

The mashed potatoes had less flavor than what one gets from a box and the collard greens,  with bacon, no less, had the same flaw.  

I finished what I wanted of my husband's dinner and was ready to leave.  

But wait.   Do you see the problem here?

Yep. That is right.  

Where the heck is that long awaited Mac and cheese?

I was full.  The cutesy decor, the tiny bar table, the bland food- I was long ready to go before I had even seen the Mac and cheese.  Just as I was going to ask the waitress for the check, out it came.  

I hesitantly dug in, hoping it would redeem our visit.  

Sigh.  

Down home cooking is filled with flavor.  It is heavy, fattening, and tasty.  I really should have known, looking around at the clientele and seeing only skinny hipsters, that this was just another San Francisco darling little restaurant pretending to be something it isn't.
author: Polly P.

description: Very tasty brunch and dog friendly, which is always a plus! I'll definitely repeat here. I'm not a huge fan of cajun food, so that's saying something! I'm looking forward to trying the fried chicken. The biscuits and gravy was good, but the biscuit was too "cakey" for me, maybe little too much egg for my taste, I like a very dry biscuit with gravy.
author: Kurt R.

description:
Free cornbread to start
Tack on a basket of fried pickles with a kickass sauce for $7
10 piece bucket o fried chicken for $29
Mac & cheese on the side for $7 more
Racer 5 IPA to wash it down

Two people leave happy and full for $50

Healthy, No
Delicious, Yes
Should you eat here, Absolutely

Oh, and they have other food too, but just say fucket and get a bucket
author: Frank J.

description: Food was very good. The food has the good home cooking feel. The service was a bit slow. If you are in the mood for southern cooking this is your place. Everyone is very friendly.
author: Paul D.

description:
This might be the BEST fried chicken I have ever had. This isn't some fantastic crispy -coated "one trick pony" fried chicken - there is much more here - there is real flavor imparted into the moist and tender meat - all the way to the bone. I asked and the server said the lemon zest in the brine. I'm convinced there is more of a secret here...Hot sauce maybe and something else I cannot put my finger on.. I've had (and subsequently re-created) the Ad Hoc fried chicken, I think this is about 20% better. Really REALLY (really) good.

We also had the short ribs, the mac and cheese, and a couple of unique cocktails (that I might otherwise rave bout) but really the story here is the chicken. 

Bravo Front Porch...mucho Kudos.

xxoo,
Amy
author: Amy W.

description: Ah, the Front Porch. There aren't enough words to say how much I love the food! This place is a regular rotation of my favorite places to eat in the city. You HAVE to get the fried chicken. Seriously. Get the 4 piece or fucket get a bucket. Get the sticker. The baked mac and cheese. Fried green tomatoes. Jalapeño deviled eggs. Shrimp & grits. Chilaquiles. The porch swing. (It's a drink) GET IT ALL!!! Unique and tasty with a cool ambience. Service is always friendly. This isn't your typical mission hipster hangout (THANK GOD)... It's a fun place to eat some good grub with good company. I'll see you there...
author: Kaliah C.

description:
Laid-back staff.  Good Southern food, only slightly Californized..  And excellent cocktails, especially the sazerac.

Sitting on the porch at Front Porch is the way to go, if it's warm enough, and there's only 2 in your party.  We had 6 people, though, and they took care of us.  

Plus it's a block from Mitchell's, so ice cream for dessert!

(warning, though: there's not much for vegetarians -- basically two appetizers and one entree)
author: Josh B.

description:
Had a date night with hubby on Monday. Even tho our reservation was a little later, they were still able to sit us when we got in. Very friendly staffs.

The starters was great! one of the best shrimp and grits I've had. Not very heavy but yet very flavorful. Fried chicken was very yummy as well, but we were way too full to finish everything. 

would definitely go back there again!
author: Lillian K.

description:
We came after 8 on fri nite and thankfully just about 15 mins wait. The servers are very helpful and friendly. And yes I got to sit in the rocking chair outdoor dining and the heater was just right. So it's a good start 
We came in from the yelp reviews and enquired about the house favorites. The nice server recommended the popular fried chicken and that's really lived up to the reputation. And she did warn us that it will be some wait for the fried chicken. I suppose you would have to wait for the good stuff. Chicken is crispy outside and super juicy inside. Yummy. Even the side of mashed potatoes and collard green are so yummy. 
Overall thoroughly enjoyed the yummy famous fried chicken especially when I am rocking away on the rocking chair. 
Saw some pictures of the fried chicken with waffles and the sweet server informed us that is served over the weekend. So we will be back for the brunch.
author: Nelle L.

description: This place is seriously dope! Came in here on a random Tuesday night so the place was  light, not empty but not packed. I ordered the shrimp and grits and my husband order the fried chicken meal with mashed potatoes and greens. We were but equally pleased with our meal. My shrimp was cooked to perfect and the grits were sooo creamy and flavored really well. The icing on the cake was that they were playing Tupac as back ground music, but just loud enough that it was like ohhh snap! I can't wait to get back to try something else on the menu!
author: Kristian H.

description: Hands down one of the best in San Fran. Mac & cheese is to die for! This place deserves 5 stars!
author: Jenna P.

description:
This place was pretty good. The chicken was some of the best i've had in the city and I am from Texas so that says a lot!

The greens, mac n cheese and chicken were perfect! The fried pickles on the other hand were a hot mess. They tasted like they were fried in old grease or the same grease as the chicken and the batter was not good at all. I have had fried pickles from dozens of places and these were by far the worst. 

The service was also lack luster. She barely came by when she wasn't hanging out at the bar. My boyfriend drinks a lot of lemonade and she wasn't around to refill it ...ever.

I would go back because the chicken was so delicious. If you live in the area, go here. If you live closer to the heart of the city, go to Farmer B's. The drinks weren't bad either!
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
Looks like my 1st 2012 review is awarded to some Soul Food in San Francisco =).

If you're gonna have a friendly foodie fest, my good Yelp buddy Jonathan W made a shrewd move in reserving a party of 8, which included Jon, Daniel L, Janice S, John, Hube N, Mylinh N, Ian & myself.  Behind this modernly artless Front Porch up to 49 occupants (49--coincidence, alright), including one elongated table, & one triangulated-like wooden table that comfortably fits 8 epicures--i.e. us--can imbibe, cozy up & enliven the following Southern cuisine--and cocktail.

-Porch Swing ($8)-
This alcoholic, citrus-y "delight" reminded me of both a margarita & upper-class mimosa, except that it's not champagne w/ a rim of salt.

-Fried Pickles ($6)-
I've munched them previously in a notorious restaurant (Hi, Slaters :P), & I LOVE these grease-eliminated, superbly battered, deep fried salties w/o much of the salty side.  I enjoyed the nice touch of Tabasco Aioli to dip, but I made it a bit more adventurous by liberally adding Front Porch's very tolerably spicy Habanero Sauce.

-Sweet Potato Fries ($5)-
Exquisitely dense & tasty w/o trying so hard, I forgot about dipping these Vitamin A-rich fritters into the Creh-ole aioli.

-Fried Okra ($6)-
The most extraordinary finding with this unexpectedly tantalizing fried veggie, going together with the jalapeño aioli, was that, if cooked wrong, you'd be faced w/ okra's naturally slimy mess.  Ahh, hallelujah to its absence xD.  Okra's one of my favorite veggies, & fried or otherwise, this appetizer's also a 5-star gem.

-Biscuits (2 for $4)-
One word: Skip.
Two words: Had better.

-Baked Merlitons ($11)-
Don't know what a Merliton is?  I had no clue, either, until our Nicole Kidman look-and-sound-alike waitress expatiated that it's aka a Creole Chayote w/ numbers of ways to spell "merliton," that had that consistency of squash.  But frankly they're not shabby yet the shrimp & crab mixin' could be way more impressive than the careful presentation.

-Cornbread (FREE)-
That's Front Porch's bread & butter; I think I'll be fond of them if served caringly warm. 

-Baked Mac and Cheese ($6.75)-
