 4 pieces of Fried Chicken, garlic Mashed potatoes, greens and cornbread. 
By the  time I got home in the pouring rain, my meal was still warm and finger lickin' good.
I am excited to go back and give it another try,  too bad parking around there is almost next to impossible.
author: Sofia D.

description:
Great meal.  We started with the fried okra.  I really liked the breading but they were a little slimy.  Not horrible, but slimy nonetheless.

I had the fried chicken which was a very generous portion.  I think there was a breast, thigh, and leg.  Again, the breading was very good.  My GF had the shrimp and grits and she really like that too.  

The mac and cheese is a good side (or make it your entree).
author: Larry L.

description:
I really wanted to love this place. It's cute and ramshackle inside and the staff are so friendly and happy, there's a nice little porch area with heaters outside and rocking chairs. Unfortunately the food was just not good. We ordered the crawfish etouffee and it tasted very fishy - like off fishy. Maybe it's meant to be like that but it was very off-putting. The main dishes were pretty underwhelming for the price - $25 for the braised short rib, which was a big portion but the beef was very dry and the gravy very salty. My husband had the flounder ($22 I think), which was good but nothing to write home about - again the portion was big, so that's something. 

It seemed like this place was more about the fried chicken and cocktails and atmosphere than really good food.
author: Y A.

description: A casual and comfortable neighborhood spot with indoor and outdoor seating and delicious New Orleans style and other southern dishes. The crawfish hush puppies were super delicious, served with three different kinds of hot sauce: one mild and red, one mild and green, and one habanero. The spicy shrimp with grits are everything they're cracked up to be in the other reviews here: juicy, succulent shrimp (I'm guessing they are real Gulf shrimp) like you don't usually get in SF with a wonderful balance of flavors. And the only word to describe the fried chicken is PERFECT, worth writing home about, served with garlic mashed potatoes covered with gravy and a side of collard greens. We wished we had room for dessert, but there was no chance. We will definitely go back to try other dishes.
author: David K.

description: Love coming here with my grandma it makes her so happy to have the small homie feel. She loves there "hot sauce" even though it's not really hot. High quality soul food for a decent price. Make sure you get there early because it isn't a huge chain restaurant and it will fill up quickly.
author: Matt F.

description: Feels like a small town inside this lovely little cabin. The Dr Pepper braised pork chop was definitely the best thing I had here.
author: Asaf N.

description:
What an amazing place. Food was wonderful. Friendly greeting staff. Heard about this place watching triple D (thanks Guy)

Recommended, chicken & waffles, biscuits & gravy....so yummy

Also make reservations place get really crowded
author: Brian F.

description:
The Dr pepper steak - to die for. Its a place far from
Anything else, both geographically but in cosines and foodie-wise. Best dinner in SF.
author: Joakim A.

description:
When it comes Southern cuisine, I can already feel myself gain 10 pounds from the massive amounts of fried whatever and excessive butter and grease. However, Front Porch makes me overlook that because it is GOOD enough to gain 10 pounds for!!!

Came here on Saturday afternoon for lunch. I sat outside, which was fine, but the inside was really cramped, dark, and just super divey and janky looking. Tried the beignets, mac n cheese, chicken n waffles, and sweet potato pulled pork hash. Beignets were meh, but the other stuff tasted great! Mac n cheese was hot and creamy, but not overloaded on cheese (just how I like it). Chicken and waffles were delicious--the waffle had a bacon flavor to it and the chicken was lightly breaded, not greasy, and fried to perfection! The sweet potato hash was a interesting combination, nonetheless still good. I liked the fusion of the sweetness of the sweet potatoes and the savory taste of the pulled pork and bell peppers. Everything was priced around $10 - $18 ish.

Service was a little slow--no one came out to take our order so I had walk up to the waitress inside to tell her what I wanted, hence minus one star. Regardless, I will come back!!
author: Cheri S.

description: It was date night for Hubby and I.  We wanted to dine at a local place and was searching on Yelp and came across The Front Porch.  It had great reviews and the pictures was very convincing so we decided to try this place out....NO regrets.  First, the staffs were very welcoming and friendly which means great service will be provided.  The decor was very cozy.  Full bar so if you want to get your drink on this is the place.  The food was excellent.  Lots of flavor and fresh!  Hubby ordered the Porch Chop and OMG, it was juicy, tender and full of flavor.  I ordered the Farmer's Vegan dish and it was fresh, cooker perfectly.  The tofu was fried perfect and the sauce was excellent with the dish.  We are will be back to try other dishes.
author: Jan S.

description: I had heard from others that this was the place to go for southern comfort food that also took reservations. Sold!  We were seated immediately upon our arrival with reservations.  The service was pretty good and so was the food.  It was very satisfying to the palate and a spot hitter.  Loved the cheesy grits, fried okra and beignets plus the fried chicken was very moist and juicy.  No disappointments with the food except for the lighting.  We were seated in the very back which was fairly dark.  It would have been nice to have a bit more lighting.
author: JADE L.

description:
A year or so ago I thought it would be a good idea to start bmx'ing again, hitting launch ramps and jumping stuff.
Yeah. That wasn't a good idea 
but when I was young I thought it was great.
This year I will do the safe thing and go back to skateboarding.
Anyways...sometimes things are better the first time around or with the right person or people.

No matter how good the food is or isn't, no matter how good the service was or lacks, no matter how nice the restaurant seemed...If you don't experience it with the right person at the right time...
It just isn't the same.
It isn't the same.

With the right person this place can be the best place you ever dined at.
Perfect fried chicken and ribs with ice tea that tastes like it was brewed in heaven.
Or it could be too dark. It could be too cold. 
It could be too warm. It could be too crowded. 
It could be too noisy. Blah blah blah....
and you are stuck with a bowl of ho hum I have had better Mac n Cheese, while you keep looking at your watch and waiting for the check.
Or it could be the best dining experience you ever had.
It could.
Maybe.
Just maybe be the best.
Life is what you make of it.
This place is okay.
author: Rossi H.

description: This was our first time trying this place and it was a great experience.  I was able to make a reservation about 30 mins before I arrived.  Parking can be an issue I believe but for us, it was just our lucky day.   Hostess was very friendly and seated us right away.  The menu was mouth-watering and I decided to try the chicken-steak, I was going to try the Chicken and Waffles (highly recommended) but I wanted to try something different.  The staff were so upbeat and very friendly the whole time, this place was super busy and the kitchen was backed up, but they put on brace faces and made sure customers were well looked after so huge plus for me.  I enjoyed the Chicken-fried steak,but I did think it was a little over-cooked but the taste was amazing all the same.  It came with seasoned fries and they were just as good.  The food was great and the service was outstanding, the staff at this place always smile and really look after you very well.  I look forward to a return visit in the very near future!!
author: Alan H.

description: A lovely restaurant and conveniently located. This is good cooking with a lovely Southern flare. I highly recommend trying this place, although having been there twice now, I don't have a favorite dish, but I also don't think you can wrong with anything on the menu. The kitchen does a fine job of ensuring flavor in every bite, the food is seasoned well, and the drinks are also enjoyable. The price point is slightly interesting compared to the portion size, alas, if you can get a seat in this cozy and often crowded space, I believe you will enjoy yourself tremendously as I did.
author: Marques R.

description: Wasn't impressed this place didn't have a back porch, no back is just whack, But the food is good.
author: Brittany A.

description:
I hardly write bad reviews, and  for me to give a place 1 star, it meant I was really pissed. 

This was supposed to be our second time dining at The Front Porch (my husband and I). Knowing that it was a Friday night and we didn't get reservations, we were happily surprised that the hostess told us it'd be a 45 minute wait for a table at 715pm. Score! 

We were able to get seats at the bar, but decided to hold off on eating at the bar since our table was coming soon. 45 minutes passed, and no table...1 hour passed, and no table. At this point we were getting really hungry and contemplating just getting food at the bar. We flagged down the hostess and she said that we were the 1st in line to get the next table. Ok, not so bad, we can hold off for a few more minutes. 1.5 hours passed and still no table, but our hopes were high since we noticed that the patrons at the tables were getting their checks. But too our dismay, once the patrons left, the hostess didn't seat us, and instead seated other couples. We flagged her down once again to ask about the situation, she said that the those tables were for the reservations....so why did you tell us we're 1st in line to get a table HALF an hour ago?! 

Trying to stay calm, I asked her how long the wait would be and her reply was...drum roll please..."I have no clue, could be another 30-45 minute wait. Why don't you guys just order food at the bar". WTFFFFFF!!! At this time, steam was coming out of my ears! Obviously we wanted a table or else we would have eaten at the bar an hour ago!! 

Even though my stomach was crying out for attention and my head was spinning because of starvation, my husband and I decided that we rather take the risk of waiting at another restaurant than waste our money at The Front Porch. We paid for our drinks, gave the bartender a good tip, and hastily left, never to return. 

At least I can thank The Front Porch for one thing that night, and that was introducing us to Contigo (great Spanish tapas place). 

Tip to the restaurant: Train your hostess better. The hostess should always over estimate wait times rather than under estimating. The ladder will leave you with hungry and pissed off customers (or ex customers in our case). Also, train them to be more attentive. When we walked out the restaurants, there were seating available outside the patio. NOT ONCE did she offer the choice to be seated outside. UGH!!!!
author: Hong N.

description:
Watch out Brendas...you've gone some serious fried chicken competition! Perfectly crisp and wonderfully seasoned - get a bucket. And, if you have leftovers - make some waffles and call it breakfast. 

Pass on the deviled eggs, they're nothing special and overpriced. But, do get the dates because they're pretty amazing.

And most important, get the mac and cheese. Served piping hot in a cast iron skillet.
author: Marit S.

description:
Excellent food! Service gets 4 stars.

 We had a reservation for 5:30 on a Tuesday night so there was no wait. Excellent cornbread, excellent fried pickles. The sauce that came with the pickles was just eh so I ate them without. We also had the bacon wrapped dates- amazing. My friend had the fried chicken with greens and Mac n cheese instead of potatoes and I have the pork chop with creamed corn and broccolini. Fried chicken was excellent, Mac n cheese wasn't the best we ever had. My pork chop was pretty huge and cooked perfectly. The creamed corn was delish and the chow-chow sauce that came with the chop was a perfect accompaniment. 

Make a rezzy, you won't regret it.
author: Stephanie W.

description: Way too expensive for fried chicken, nothing special about the batter, the service is extremely slow, the rosemary butter for cornbread is very perfumey, best thing about the meal was boiled peanuts, another trendy expensive hipster joint with not so great food.
author: Giovanie R.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood dinner/bar spots. There's a nice outdoor area where we bring out dog and eat under the heat lamps. Pro-tip...you can get individual pieces of fried chicken for $5 each. Two should do the trick. Whatever savings I get, I blow on the drinks. I was loving the cigar cocktail, but I think they're out of the tobacco bitters for now.
author: Josh L.

description:
I booked a group of 10 at The Front Porch and the staff were so accommodating and gracious in handling us. As many times as I told my group to leave enough time to get there (traffic, parking, Friday night, etc.) most of the group ran late. The host was more than understanding about the issue and just handled it splendidly. He informed us that we only had the table for two hours and if any of us wanted to order the fried chicken that it takes a good 20 - 25 mins for it to cook so we may want to order it sooner rather than later.  About half of the group arrived 30 min. late so we just ordered for the table since time was a tickin. 

Food was amazing as well as the drinks. Everyone at the table LOVED THE FRIED CHICKEN. Seriously amazing. I want to know their secret for keeping it so moist. Fried pickles, Mac and cheese, bacon wrapped fried dates. Hummmm baby! Can't wait to get back there.
author: Erin L.

description:
This place is just awesome!   Great southern comfort food, well presented with good service.

We came here for a birthday dinner and had a fantastic time.  The bacon-wrapped dates were an appetizer from the Gods.  The wife ordered fired chicken, which took a little long, so they brought us some complimentary ribs while we were waiting.  The ribs were the best we've ever had in SF.  

For the entrees, we had fried chicken and the pork chop. Both were out of this world good.

This place is definitely worth a try.  Parking can be tough in this neighborhood but it's worth it.
author: Jim K.

description:
On the way to to try Goood Frikin Chicken and stumbled to The Front Porch. There was a mexican man playing his little guitar outside and I wanted to walk in and see what the place was all about. To my surprise it was a soul/cajun food place. Very cute restaurant, low ceilings, dimmed lighting and it seriously made me feel like I was in someone's home in the South.

Fried Okra was very intersting, It was good but it had that weird slimy seed texture once I bit through the batter, it's just a okra thing. I know this place i known for the buckets of chicken but I wasn't in the mood, I had the Porkchop, i never really order porkchop because it's always dry but MAN was this place good. It was super soft and flavorfull. I cut through it was ease, like butter. Even the blubbery fat part was good, it was crispy and fried.

Brussell sprouts and molasses was interesting too, I've never ate anything like this before. It was boiled exactly right, still hard and firm sitting in a sweet sauce.

But the highlight of the night was a trip in my mouth. The Rhubarb Goat Cheese ice cream. I was all about trying new things but man this dessert sounded so foul in so many ways. But luckily the waitress encouraged us to order it. It was a glob of goat cheese ice cream sitting on a pile of like grnola type deal. It was warm and the ice cream complemented it so well. It didnt even taste like cheese. It was beyond amazing!!!!

Front Porch we must meet again.
author: Tam T.

description:
Food was amazing.  My favorite dish - dirty rice, flounder risotto and chicken gumbo.  The one dish was raving in Yelp was the Hash Puppy but it was unavailable.  The fri3d chick3n is ok, not that special, KFC is better.

Service was great.

Parking is a challeng.
author: anita s.

description: This is a solid place with some southern funk. The food is good and interesting. Everything we tried was flavorful and enjoyable. Some of the items would lead you to become a regular (fried chicken, fried okra, deviled eggs, gumbo & bacon wrapped fried dates). The only challenges were the noise level and getting a table due to the small size and popularity of the place.
author: Kevin R.

description:
Kate, oh Kate.  What'd ya do to me with this tempting little joint with actual rocking chairs on the front side of the restaurant (complete with throws)?

The owner is cute and charming and welcoming.  And he knew Kate.  The servers are ALL hot (tattooed or not, male or female -- everybody is a hottie mctottie).  And hoo boy.  Nice as the dickens.  (or Dickens, if you're feeling literary).

We ate spicy shrimp with grits and other yummy stuff.  Started with a round of Donkey D's Hot Ass Margaritas.  Yeeeeehaw!  Then had crawfish hushpuppehs (NOT the way THEY spell it) and ended with chocolate bacon bread pudding (NO RAISINS, thankyouverymuch) with maple creme anglaise.

Walking distance.  Fanf***ingtastic.
author: Persimmon V.

description:
In a city full of uniqueness, this is certainly a unique restaurant.

Recommend the okra, dates, fried chicken, and mac & cheese.

My wife and I will come back some time soon. Thumbs up!
author: Francis M.

description:
When I started on this review, the review count was 1,000... guess it's a slightly popular spot.  My neighborhood landmark is Mitchell's Ice Cream, just a short block or so away.  The parking is not too bad during the day as there are residential and metered spaces.
Love the wallpaper/vinyl design and booth; definitely an old school feel.  On weekends, there is live music during the day, which makes it difficult for conversations when dining.  It's slightly better at the three tables closer to the kitchen upstairs.
Tried the following:

a) Pulled Pork Sandwich - Great lunch or snacking item that's available in large and small sizes.  The slaw is a great mix with the tender shredded pork and extra barbecue sauce is given.
b) Gumbo - Thick, chunky, and flavorful
c) Chicken and Waffles - The star of the show in my eyes.  Piping hot, the waitress told us about the twenty minute wait, which was well worth it.
d) Mac N Cheese (side dish) - Creamy rich, but like mine a little more crusty on top.

Weekdays are probably the best time to dine here to avoid lines and crowds.  If you like condiments, make sure to try their variety of tableside sauces.  Solid neighborhood brunch spot!
author: Mike C.

description: Seems like the best spot for a hangover. Great southern food. I'd recommend the chicken fried steak. They also had awesome chicory coffee with baileys.
author: Shreyan S.

description:
Disclaimer: This is my first experience with southern food but I came here with a friend who has frequented numerous southern food restaurants in socal.

Party: 3
Time: Monday evening, around 6. 
Wait: None
Food: Corn bread (complimentary), Crawfish Hushpuppies, Biscuits, Baked Mac n cheese (x2), bucket of fried chicken
Service (5/5)
They were great! We had trouble deciding what to get and they very patient with us. They frequently checked on us. 

Cornbread (1/5)
They were in fact mini corn muffins, which were cute but not good. Because they were so small, the outer layers were dry and a bit rubbery. The inside was dry and didn't have that mealy texture that I normally experience with corn bread. 
Overall, meh. 

Crawfish Hushpuppies with spicy remoulade sauce (3/5)
First time eating hushpuppies. First bite, no sauce: it was good! It was flavorful and had a good balance of crispiness from the skin and the softness of the inside layer. But as I kept taking bites, the harder it was for me to enjoy the hushpuppies because it got bland really fast and the soft and some-what dry texture of the inside layer made it hard to swallow. So I decided to use the sauce. Again, sauce tasted great with the hushpuppies but it overpowered the taste of the hushpuppies.  Using the sauce, it sorta became eating sauce with hushpuppies much like dipping tortilla chips in salsa or pico. Lastly, I ordered this dish under thinking that it would have a creamy center much like some of the pictures posted but all 4 pieces were dry in the middle. Kinda disappointing. 
Overall, the dish is great but only in moderation.

Biscuits (1/5)
I'm going to be straightforward: I did not like them at all. They were hard and dry and didn't taste like a stereotypical biscuit (soft and buttery and so on). It felt more like I was eating a European biscuit with jam and butter. 
Overall, meh. 

Baked Mac n Cheese (4.5/5)
My friend and I both thought the mac n cheese was delicious! They shell pasta was neatly covered with cheese with a good stretchy layer of cheese on top. The shell pasta was a bit overcooked but I thought it balanced well with the soft creamy layer of cheese. However, there was something about it that made it really heavy as we kept eating it and we both felt that it was too much, even before starting the second order of mac n cheese. 
Overall, the dish is solid and you should get it!

Bucket of fried chicken (3/5)
I don't remember the distribution of the pieces but I do remember there being 2 drumsticks and some wing and breast pieces. The chicken is freshly fried and so take caution with the first bite! The skin of the chicken was something we all enjoyed: it was flavorful with a good crunch. However, the meat of the chicken could use some flavor. The meat of the chicken was quite bland and some of the pieces were a bit dry (breast pieces). Also, the breast pieces were more like a single big breast cut into 3-4 pieces and spiced and fried and added to the bucket of 10. So, the bucket of chicken was not a bucket of 10 whole pieces of chicken that you normally get from, say, popeyes. 
Overall, it's okay and more on the mediocre side. Not the best fried chicken any of us had had.

Overall, we thought that this place is okay. Not something I would go out of the way for and isn't really anything special. We all thought that the meal was a bit too expensive for what you are getting. However, I may return to try their brunch menu since it had some dishes that looked really good!
author: Terrance C.

description: The burger melts in your mouth. They're known for the fried chicken and just as I had expected, it was delicious. Also had the crawfish hush puppies which I recommend. Our waiter was very friendly too! We called ahead to make a reservation but they take walk ins, although you might have to wait for a bit.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Amazing! Really quality southern food... we took 3 people from South Carolina and they even raved!!  We shared the fried chicken, which had a great crispy but not too heavy, skin... salads (the lolla rosa was great), corn bread, mac & cheese (had a truffle flavor to it), pulled pork sliders (phenomenal), biscuits.... literally, one thing after another had us all raving.  Two of the group had pork chops and said they were even better than the chicken!  I HIGHLY recommend the bacon wrapped fried dates (appetizer) - they were out of this world!!!  The brioche bread pudding was outstanding.

Truly outstanding food!  Literally every single dish was raved about by every person at the table and there were 6 of us. If you can get a southerner to say it's as good as his grandma's cooking.... you're doing something right!
author: Aimee D.

description:
What a gem! This place is fantastic. The vibe is chill, service is great, and food is delicious. If you're downtown, its worth the trek out to Bernal Heights. 

Highly recommend the fried okra, baked mac & cheese, fried green tomatoes, biscuits, deviled eggs, and complementary corn bread.

The standout gem was by far the spicy margarita. Will definitely be back.
author: Nadine H.

description:
Greg and I enjoyed our last dinner in the city before leaving SF and heading back home to So. Cal/Orange County. 

The restaurant is dark, small, with a great friendly vibe.  We started with drinks. I had a Hurricane (by tradition, this drink sneaks up on you), and Greg had a glass of wine to pair with his entree. We ordered the Fried Okra as our appetizer.  It came with a Jalapeño Aioli.  The House Made Hot Sauce was GREAT!  Note: House Made Habanero Sauce was painfully too hot for me.  My Entree order was Spicy Shrimp And Grits (OMG, the best I've eaten). Greg ordered the Fried Chicken dinner. It came with Smokey Collard Greens and Mashed Potatoes with Gravy.  Chicken was Crispy, Moist, and Delicious. Collards were delicious as well, as was the taters.  Our very sweet server told us that they are the two most popular dishes. 

We had to have dessert, although room in our tummies was sparse. We ordered the Brioche Bread Pudding.  All I can say is YUM!  Great finish to an outstanding meal.  

We will be back on our next trip.  I think I'll bring the girls for a Chick Weekend.
author: Bonnie A.

description:
Wow!!! Soooo good and such a cute establishment.

Fried Chicken Bucket - crispy and tender
Bacon Wrapped Dates... Omg good
Gumbo - savory 
Biscuits--- so soft and flaky
Crawfish Fries - the next best thing to finding poutine in the city
Fries Pickle - still good but not as good as all the other dishes.

Follow-up meal:
Mac and Cheese - quite possibly the best Mac and Cheese ever. So cheesy and crispy. 
Crawfish Balls - fantastic but a bit too crispy for me. 
Deviled Eggs with bacon and Jalepeno -  good compliment to start the meal. A bit expensive for eggs. 

Cannot wait to take more of my friends here to PIG out. Must remember to make reservations.
author: Winny F.

description: No wait...we ate at the bar. The bartender was awesome...he was on point and was around when we needed him. Started with the arugula salad and chicken gumbo...my boyfriend and I fought over the gumbo!! We shared the fried chicken...yum yum yum!!! Washed it all down with Porch Light and a Porch What Porch Who. We are going home happy!!!! Wish we had room for dessert...next time. Thank you for a awesome experience!!!
author: hac h.

description:
Really 3.5 stars, but would go back to try other dishes. The service was very friendly, and the decor was homey and nice with a nice bar. I managed to get a 7:45 reservation a mere 2 hours before, and when I got there it was only half full but within 30 minutes the entire place was jammed up, and every seat at the bar taken.

As we had both eaten massive burgers earlier in the day, we both opted for fish/seafood dishes. I got the spicy shrimp and grits and my friend got the sustainable fish which was halibut. 

His dish looked great and he said it was good. My shrimp and grits was extremely tasty and I would eat it again. The grits soaked up the sauce in a great way. The portion size was a little small so I'd recommend some appetizers. 

The waitress was friendly and attentive. The desserts looked good but we weren't hungry after the mains. The corn bread was fresh.

Will return.
author: Jordan C.

description:
I saw this place on Diners, Drive-In'e & Dives© and I was immediately impressed. My babes took me for my birthday and I was soooo excited!     
     Parking on a Saturday night was atrocious, so carve out at least 30-1 hour to find some if you're going at or after 8. The place is on a side steet and almost easy to miss, especially at night. The place is also very, very small. We were lucky to get seated immediately, but beware, the place is cramped.
     They served us cornbread and it was pretty underwhelming. I'm from the south and it was not anything to look forward to. It needs work. They serve it with some type of herb butter and it was, eh. It seemed as though they tried really hard with that butter when all good cornbread needs is good ol' plain butter.
    We ordered their shrimp n grits and the Dr. Pepper short ribs. The short ribs were SUCH a disappointment!!!!! For SOME reason the flavor was not there, AT ALL! Very surprising. The only thing they did right was make them tender. It was on a bed of mash that again was NOT properly seasoned and some green leaf veggies. I'm a veggie head and LOVE green veggies and they weren't very good either. The dish was a pretty epic fail, especially for being as hyped up as this dish was on t.v.
     The shrimp n grits were a COMPLETE 180 from the ribs!!! Absolutely amazing! I was sooooo surprised my grandmother wasn't back there making the grits! They were perfect. Absolutely creamy and buttery. And the shrimp, OMG! They were seasoned well, a good size, juicy, and wild, from the gulf I think. And for a southern girl, that earthiness from the gulf gave the shrimp great flavor. Hats off to the chef for the entire dish, including the sauce that came on top with the shrimp. Its a about $25.00 (average price for the main dishes). I wish the serving was bigger, and it's not because in greedy, it was just a bit small. It's a cheap dish to make, so they should give a bit more.
     The atmosphere is casual, and the service is friendly and laid back. The stars for this place however lie soley in them shrimp n grits honey! It's magnificent! I wanna go back to try their other stuff, AND have the grits again. The shrimp n grits are so good I crave them! The fried chicken looked great with a wonderful scaled and I'm anxious to see if the flavor is there. To be continued.....
author: Samantha J.

description:
This is about the only place in the Bay Area where we have found  Abita on draft.
I ordered the rib special  and it was delicious ( I think you can only get this on Sundays).
Corbread was nice and warm and tasty.
The  spicy shrimp and grits were yummy, but not spicy as the name would lead you to believe.
Chicken gumbo was very tasty - again not very spicy as it sometimes can be.
The fried chicken was moist and crispy all in one bite.

We ordered so much food that we didn't have room for dessert, however. the menu looked good!

The to go food added a lovely aroma to our car ride home...seriously the smell made me hungry all over again!

Finally, The bathrooms were a bit strange... closer to the dining area that I think may be allowed by code, but maybe that just adds to this place's urban charm.

We'll definitely be back when we're in the mood for some cajun cuisine!
author: Bernadette W.

description:
great service. fun atmosphere and good food.

upgraded to 4 stars after a bachelor party brunch where we were treated like kings.
author: Zk K.

description: Came in here for brunch! Great service great ambiance food was awesome  I ordered chicken and waffles it changed my life  my boyfriend ordered the spicy shrimp they were ok the gravy was a bit much but over all had a great experience and will defiantly come back!
author: Jackie R.

description:
I'm always looking for a good po'boy outside of New Orleans. And with a good looking po'boy menu and more, I was so excited to try this place! 

There was a decent wait (about 30 mins) outside and I overheard two patrons speaking highly of their chicken and waffles. I didn't intend on having this but now my mouth was watering in anticipation of a nice flavorfully breaded piece of chicken and crunchy yet chewy waffle topped with a just right sweetened syrup - not too maple-y.  

It's a great menu with lots to choose from. I started to get confused. My dining companion was going to get the chicken and waffles so I thought I might try something else. In the end, my tastebuds were directing me to the c & w, and I decided I didn't want to be disappointed if I didn't get what I truly wanted. So we ended up with two c&w and a 6" oyster po'boy to try it out. It also came with french fries.

That oyster po'boy was a winner! I'd definitely get that again! Perfectly seasoned and coated batter and not to the point that the batter overpowered the oysters. We threw on some hot sauce which made it even better! After this sampling, I was ready for more and figured the c&w would be just as good.

Unfortunately, I can't share the same enthusiasm with the c&w. It comes in a big bowl with three pieces of chicken atop a waffle. I almost wish they used the same seasoning to batter the chicken but it wasn't the same. It just didn't bring out the flavor of the chicken despite the fact that they were juicy pieces. The waffle, though for the most part good, was a bit soggy since it sat underneath the chicken. Delicious syrup though. Not to sweet and definitely not maple-y.

So all in all, even though I was let down with the c&w, I would definitely dine here again. There are so many other menu selections that I'd love to try like their muffaleta, other po'boys and shrimp with grits. The service was good but it was a busy Sunday so our server was pretty pre-occupied. But the host (who could perhaps be the owner) was friendly and warm and sat patrons while his little girl was in his arms. Nice down home feeling. Great restaurant vibe.
author: Anna R.

description:
The best southern/soul food I have had in the city to date. Everything I got was absolutely amazing and very unique and everything else on the menu looked just as good, definitely have to go back sometime soon.
The service was quick, friendly, and great with suggestions. Tasty cocktails, the atmosphere is very hip, but not to the point of over-doing it.
Had the dates as an app and OMG I have never had anything like that. So good! Fried Chicken for my entree and it absolutely blew me away. Best friend chicken I've had in the city.
author: Luis B.

description:
Learned about this place on Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives (I can't peel my eyes away once Guy Fieri's in the kitchen with the chefs). 

+ Major plus: They take reservations! 
SERVICE: Came on a weekend and the waitress seemed rushed ("Are you ready?" but walked away mid-sentence as I was saying, "No, but I'd like to order coffee.") Then came back, "memorized" our drink/food orders and then inevitably forgot said coffee. Why must restaurants insist on having their waitstaff memorize orders, especially for a group? Just write it down! It's not impressive esp. when they forget!
FOOD: Probably not as good as the DDD hype; tough bites out of the English muffin in the eggs benedict and the sausage, while tasty, was overcooked. Got to try the other signature dishes and have just had better grits & less soggy potatoes, that's all.
author: Cheryl A.

description:
Nice atmosphere for a small place. Friendly service. The fried chicken is good not knock your socks off fried chicken but respectable. Fried green tomatoes and fried pickles were also good. Greens passable. Beans and rice solid.  

A decent representation of southern cuisine.
author: Coral H.

description:
What they say is true! The fried chicken is freaking amazing !!! We got a bucket for $33 and it could easily feed three people, maybe even four if you are not large eaters though you'd definitely need an extra order of the side of chards and mashed potatoes. The chicken batter crust was very well seasoned and crispy while the meat was tender and juicy with the spices having permeated the meat deep inside --- I am pretty sure it was well marinated in the buttermilk for a fair amount of time. This dish alone deserves a 5 stars rating!!! The mashed potatoes were creamy and silky and I wouldn't hesitate to relabel it whipped potatoes. The chards had the right amount of, I am guessing, vinegar and that little sour taste offset the chicken and potatoes very very well!

K had the shrimps and grits of which I got a spoon full and I have to admit they were awesome too. I would love to have it the next time I am there but I fear I will cave in to the call of the fried chicken instead.
I. must. be. strong.

For dessert, the beignets were good but below my expectation and chocolate sauce was too little. For something similar, the house donuts with Godiva chocolate sauce at ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/ottimista-enoteca-cafe-san-francisco#hrid:UBbVwIFc0DNrzANda2glwg ) at ottimista-enoteca is unbeatable. 

The mud pie too was disappointing as it was dry and not moist as one would expect.

Including a drink, it was a bit on the expensive side at $35/person (incl tax and tips)
author: Umesh T.

description: The atmosphere was cute, the staff was friendly, but alas, I must give this place a low rating because I am certain this place gave me food poisoning. I liked the food while I was eating it, and my husband did not get sick (because he ate something different). However, I have been sick for 4 days now and it happened right after our visit to this place. Never again.
author: Amy L.

description: Food has gotten worse since last time we were there a couple of months ago. This time, service was extremely slow - wait 10 minutes for mayo? In exchange, they brought us the check way before we were finished with our food.
author: Hugo P.

description: Finding good Cajun food in SF is tough. Brenda's is pretty much the place to go but if you have a party of more than 2, you can forget it since they do not take reservations. Welcome, Front Porch. While not as good as Brenda's, it's still a yummy place for good Cajun food. The restaurant itself is in a garage. It sounds strange, but no one seems to mind. The service is great. The food is good and the staff are very friendly.
author: Clive L.

description:
Thank you Triple D!  Another one marked off my list!!
I was the first of my group of 10 to arrive for our reservation on a Sunday morning so I enjoyed the sunshine on one of the benches outside of the restaurant.  All of the other diners were late (tick tock tick tock - apparently they are all on a different time zone!) and finally the restaurant called asking if we were coming.  I proceeded inside to claim our table and waited ... and waited ... and waited for the rest of my group.  They started arriving 10+ minutes after I sat down and continued to arrive two-by-two in 15 minute intervals.  The point is, the staff was great about keeping our reservation and working with us throughout our dining experience.

Now on to the good stuff .... oh the good stuff it is!!  We started out with beignets, mac and cheese, and biscuits and sausage gravy.  The mac and cheese and biscuits were AMAZING!!  I could just taste the love and butter in them both!  The beignets ... not so good.  Way too dense and too hot (yes, I am complaining about fried dough being too hot) - nothing like what you would get in NOLA.

For the main course, I think we tried one of everything and I am not sure what my favorite was.  I ordered the shrimp and grits with red-eye gravy - let's just say I cannot stop thinking about them and it has been four days.  Really, really good!  I am a sucker for grits and for shrimp, and for Andouille sausage.  Seriously, so good!  

We also ordered: catfish po' boy (good but a bit too much mayo for me), chicken and waffles (waffles are more like a cornbread with jalapeños and bacon!)  - YUM!!!, Eggs benedict - another YUM!, and the Stoner ... yeah, she was hung-over!  Everything we ordered was so good!  However, one of the diners was disappointed that dates with bacon was not on the menu when we dined - maybe next time!

I will definitely be coming back to this place!  Maybe for fried chicken since I read so much about it ... but then again I did love those grits!!
author: Betty D.

description:
the 33$ bucket of chicken is the thing to get here people. Just bring 3 of your closest friends and go to town on that thing.

If thats not enough - i recommend the mac n cheese its ok, solid even, but in a mac n' cheese death match it would probably lose to a Pheonix mac and cheese. 

And if its healthy choice you're after i say go for the brussel sprouts with molasses sauce - that dish is soo good that im going to make it my mission for the next month to replicate it.... but even if i do manage to come close - i think - i would still return for the original.

bonus points for the "complimentary" corn bread fingers
author: Oleg H.

description:
Cool atmosphere, kitschy decor, nice (dark-ish) lighting. We ordered a variety of things from the menu: 

Jambalaya balls (very good)
Fried pickles (skip them)
Bacon wrapped dates (delicious)
Mac & cheese (average at best, no crunchy cheesy crust)
Shrimp & grits (undercooked, shrimp was raw)
Beignets (just ok, the powdered sugar was extremely heavy handed)
Pumpkin cheesecake w pretzel crust & butterscotch (too ambitious with too many competing flavors)

I might go back for a drink (although they have a very light pour on a plain vodka rocks) before having dinner elsewhere, but would not order more than a couple of appetizers.
author: Daria C.

description:
Have been here many times and enjoy all the delicious food they have to offer. Took my partner for his birthday dinner last night and everything was up to par except for the hostess. A somewhat overweight white woman with dark hair pulled back must've had a really bad day. I observed her barking at customers already seated before she asked me if we had a reservation. She then told me in a very gruff manner to wait outside and she call me when my table was ready. Meanwhile I had received a text saying my table was ready. I observed 3 four tops available for seating. I also observed other four tops with only a party of two at the table. When I asked  her why we were waiting she said because you're waiting for a two top. Finally after 15 minutes went by I insisted that she Seat us at one of the available four tops. She could see the look in my eyes and tell that I was not going to take no for an answer so she complied. It just created a bad vibe despite our delightful server and the delicious food. A message to the hostess, if you don't like your job find another one save your attitude for someone that will take it. I felt like telling you to F off, but I held my tongue as it was my partner's birthday. Girlfriend, I sincerely hope you are reading this and will take the opportunity to step back and look at how obnoxious you can  present yourself. I never write a bad review unless there is due cause.
I don't care how good the reputation, how good the fare , A  RUDE HOSTESS can ruin the whole experience :(
author: Wayne W.

description:
This restaurant ambiance is more like a dive bar. Lil' messy and not super romantic.

Service is great.

Food:
- Fried chicken is pretty good. The meat is juicy and the skin is crispy and tasty.
- Fried okra has really good breading, but I don't think I like eating a whole okra. It's too slimy.
- Complementary cornbread is ok. Really tiny size.
- Collard green. Ugh, don't like this at all.

I think this place is just ok... a bit too hyped up.
author: Novalina N.

description: I had seen this restaurant air on Diners, Drive-ins, & Dives,  so I had to check it out! I, live in Sacramento and do NOT hesitate to drive a few miles for some good food.  I ordered the chicken fried steak which was kinda on the thin side as far as the meat and too much flour or bread on the cfs HOWEVER my honey ordered the baked egg and grits OHHH MY GEEZ was this the skillet of the year..hands down!  This skillet was so flavorful and the goat cheese, mushrooms, and spinach AND THE BACON yum yum yum!!! It was the best!! BUT also the Bloody Mary was too die for Awesomeness for real! I wanted more of that too. Very cool place to eat, kinda dark inside but worth the drive and good food! :)   :)
author: Sarah M.

description: I had an amazing dinner here when I was visiting San Francisco. I'm from Los Angeles and we don't have that many southern comfort food restaurants. So I am very glad I had dinner here. I had gotten the dr. Pepper slow cooked pork (I believe that's what is was called) and i was very happy with my dish. Perfectly cooked and delicious.
author: Kathy F.

description:
What a great meal! Perfect outdoor weather, rocking chairs, a heat lamp and delicious food...can't get much better than that!

When we ordered, the server brought out some cornbread with a pimento butter spread (I think). So, so good!

My partner and I shared the crawfish etouffe fries. If you like crawfish - well, anything Cajun/Creole, really - definitely order these. The spices on the fries and the homemade hot sauce perfectly complement the dish, too.

Since we had just eaten two dozen oysters at Mission Street Oyster Bar, we weren't hungry enough to each get an entree, so we split the very last braised short rib (when I say last, I mean they were switching the menu the next day...and it was only 6:30). Dear lord, it melted in my mouth. Paired with pureed parsnips and broccoli rabe, the beef was perfectly cooked and blended superbly with the sweet parsnips and bitter broccoli rabe. To. Die. For.

After we thought we were full, the dessert menu came...and we got hungry again. The seasonal dish was the peach and blueberry cornbread cobbler...RIDICULOUS! The look on my partner's face while she was eating it was a look of confusion. 'I can't believe how good this is...it isn't possible," she kept saying. If you go in the summer month, please order this.

And if that's not all, they even have Schlitz on their menu!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Went here for partner's bday dinner tuesday.  

Host was amazing, sat us at a booth, chatted with us.  Totally cool.

Fried corn on the cob was delicious, as were fried green tomatoes.  Entrees served hot and were great (pork chop and veggie plate).

Nice work!
author: pete c.

description: It was busy so I can understand why our server never refreshed are drinks or the fact I had to flag another server to clear my bill. But the cook went garlic seasoned crazy on the chicken. It had good crisp but the flavor was not to my liking as well as the biscuits were flavorless the greens I think had vinegar in them and for real southern cooking they need some real recipes. I will not be going back or recommending this place :(
author: Rosa R.

description:
This restaurant is great! Delicious and unpretentious! I tried it on my birthday, and was blown away with tastiness!! I even brought my 89 year old southern Grandmother and she was impressed!! 

My favorites were the bacon dates, the deviled eggs, the shrimp and grits and the pork chop! Everyone enjoyed the fried chicken (not my thing) so if you're into fried chicken I'm sure you'd love that too! 

Can't wait to go back!!
author: Maya M.

description:
Fancy fried chicken in a bucket with great French wines by the class.  My kind of place for sure.

Fried pickles were novel, but not something I would order again.

Good service.  The chicken was well prepared, but did not wow me on flavor.
author: Patrick S.

description: Was so excited to have a southern brunch.  Food was okay although the biscuits were exceptionally delicious & flakey.  The service was lousy.  We sat at the table for quite some time with out anyone offering to take our drink order.  Our waitress showed her face at our table twice - to finally take our order & bring the check.  She couldn't be bothered to refill our sweet tea until she brought our check.
author: Tammy N.

description:
The Front Porch was one of the restaurants I've been dying to try ever since I moved to Daly City a year in half ago. I found out about The Front Porch when my fiancé and I were trying to find parking in the Bernal Heights because we were on our way to El Zocalo (Best Pupusa place in SF). We walked by this cute restaurant and told my fiancé we have to eat here one day. Finally last week, we got to try their restaurant. 

My fiancé suggested to call and book a reservation which I'm glad I did because when we got there, we were seated right away and saw other people who did not make reservations, wait by the bar. 

I carefully read their menu before I came to the restaurant and my heart was set on the fried chicken bucket with mash potatoes and collard greens on the side. The fried chicken came out in a popcorn bucket with popcorn which I thought had a nice touch. I believe the bucket comes with 12 pieces of chicken and between me and my fiancé; we devoured the whole bucket with 2 wings to spare. The chicken was so juicy and nicely seasoned; I also ate the chicken skin which I almost always tear off when I eat at other places that serve chicken.  I also thought the staff here was awesome and very attentive. Definitely a place worth checking out.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
I've been to The Front Porch for dinner, their anniversary buffet, and finally came for brunch today.  Never once have I been disappointed with their fried chicken.

I love fried chicken and especially after an infuriating experience at Little Skillet that has left me boycotting that place, The Front Porch is now my sole go-to place to get my fried chicken fix.  Today I was able to experience the amazingness that is chicken n waffles.  Since it was clearly stated on the menu, I was more than happy to wait 25 min to ensure that my chicken would be freshly fried.  I ended up getting 2 thighs and a wing -- would've preferred to have some breast meat, but since these aren't mutant KFC chickens, the thighs weren't overly fatty and were actually edible.  The chicken was super juicy and piping hot, the batter was perfect, and the meat could easily be removed from the bone with a fork and butter knife.  When I took a bite of the juicy meat, crispy skin, crisp on the outside/soft on the inside waffle, melted butter, and real maple syrup, I was in heaven.

That said, I did try a biscuit and it was a bit too crispy and dense for my taste, as I prefer the lighter, fluffier biscuits.  Moral of the story: stick with the fried chicken!!

I also totally dig the decor -- the booths in the back are refurbished car seats, with seat belts and all!  Since it was Christmas Eve, they had some pleasant xmas music playing (including some Elvis Christmas song covers), and even hung up a banner saying "Happy F---ing Christmas".  Haha.
author: Beatrice W.

description: Loved this spot! I'm a southern girl from Louisiana living in Sacramento. I have tried many so called "Southern spots" only to be disappointed.  This is by far the best Southern food I have ever had outside of the south! I literally felt like I was home. The smells in this place ...... Ridiculous!!! In the best way. Can't wait to return!
author: Tina L.

description: Awesome fried chicken. The white meat pieces were juicy and tender.
author: Thomas C.

description: Went around 9:30pm on a Friday, a little hard to find parking as we had to circle and then park a couple blocks away, but we did get seated right away.  The cornbread started was good (around a 3.5), then had the mac and cheese which was a 4.5, and for dinner a bucket of fried chicken.  That's right, a popcorn bucket filled with chicken and yup, popcorn.  The chicken was a solid 4, partly for presentation, was really hot, but didn't knock you out in flavor.  The sides were mashed potatoes and greens, about a 3.
author: Jason G.

description:
Love the atmosphere at this place - very cozy and cute.  Sat at the bar and had 2 cocktails - one with peach puree and another with vodka and maraschino liquer.  Both were good but lets be honest no one is coming here for the cocktails!

Me and my dining companion shared the craw fish hush puppies - hot and delish! Not chewy, very fluffy, with great dipping sauce.

I got the sauteed wild gulf flounder - amazing rice with sausage beneath and a great green and yellow bean salad with a mustard kick.  Huge portions!

My friend had the classic fried chicken plate - I stole a bite and was very pleased! Worth the money - again, big portions.

You may not need an appetizer - but you may not be able to say no.

Come here for a good night of comfort food.
author: Tiffany W.

description: OMG holy fat ness this place is good ! and its actually all home cooked so nix that fat part. It is homey and quaint and I really enjoyed my fried chicken. My guy friend got the grits ... it was delicious and I would return !
author: Mariangeles C.

description: My worst experience ever!!! I reserved a table with my friend we went there no one greeted us! Finally some girl came and let us seated. We waited for them to take our order after 15min no one came to us! We were staring at the waitress she totally ignored us and started talking to people who were seating next to our table! OVERRATED! That's what they are! They didn't even ask us if we wanted something to drink it's like we were invisible .we walked out and ate at some other place never coming back! I got very negative vibes from them! Don't go there! Worst place ever! They don't even deserve 1 star!!! I wish I can give them O a big 0!!
author: Zaya B.

description: The Southern Fried Chicken didn't disappoint.  Perfect for a casual date night.
author: Yohdaddy M.

description:
This place was referred to me by a few good friends who had apparently eaten there before however I go in today at 3 o'clock. To be told that I cannot order because of brunch is over at 2:30, and that they are not available to serve me any food for there or to go. I called bullshit as soon as the waitress/ owner or who ever she was,saw me walk up, there was a look "NOT". I am a 50 yr old native African American male. The friends that refered are Caucasian, all I can say is wow! This shit still is alive and well even in San Francisco. 
" apparently a great place to eat unless you're Black"
author: Rodney S.

description:
I'm a huge fried chicken lover and this place is one of the best in the city. I like their dive bar decor and their 40oz bottles of water.

The chicken skin is super crispy and the meat is super moist. All side dishes we had complimented the meal really well. My friend and I split a plate so it was really inexpensive actually. The buckets of chicken seemed really inexpensive as well.

Cocktails are delicious as well. I definitely will solicit the place again when I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Patty C.

description: Absolutely awful service. The owner was rude and unprofessional. Over priced, and the cost was not justified by the service or quality of the food. Very disappointing in every way. The "owner" told us we needed to leave several times. She said we had to leave at 7pm, numerous times. Regardless of he fact that our food had not arrived by 6:45. Will NEVER go back. The owner and her attitude ruined our friends going away party. We shook the dice coming here, and we crapped out. Awful- just absolutely terrible. Save yourself the disappointment and take your business somewhere that values its costumers. Zero hospitality skills from ownership. DO NOT TRUST THIS BUSINESS' YELP RATING - we did and regretted it completely.
author: Nate W.

description: Been walking by here for ages when my husband suggested we eat somewhere we had not been in the neighborhood. Being older we opted for a dinner entree each and dessert. Stated with a martini for him a manhattan for me. Both drinks were excellent. I was pleased with the gluten free. Fried chicken, a little on the spicy side. My husband loved his short ribs. Servings were generous. My only complaint is the pie crust. The bourbon pecan filling was fabulous yet the crust was hard. The decor is funky and fun. Nice staff too.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Recommended Dishes: The baked mac & cheese is truly delicious and definitely worth ordering. I think the fried chicken is good, but a little overrated (I prefer the fried chicken at Firefly in Noe Valley). My dining partners raved about the Farmer's Vegan and the gumbo.

Atmosphere: Homey but hip/eclectic. Their tagline is "Southern Mission Hospitality" and I think the decor lives up to the name. I enjoyed the relaxed, casual vibe but beware if you don't like dark restaurants. Try for a spot on the porch if you need or prefer more light.  

Cost: Very reasonable for dinner out in San Francisco. 

Wait-Time: We had a reservation for a Sunday evening and were seated immediately.
author: Katie R.

description: Can't find southern specialties in too many places in SF.  They do a nice job. I enjoyed the fried chicken, fried green tomatoes and some tasty cocktails.
author: Joseph C.

description: Excellent food, lovely ambiance, reasonable price and convenient location. This one is a winner!
author: M B.

description: Outside seating with heated lanterns and a blanket if your still cold. There food is awesome and you get to sit in rocking chairs if you choose to sit outside. Staff is friendly and i recommend having the sparkling lemonade.
author: Love C.

description:
Pickin' my banjo on the back of Jed Clampett's truck...

"Come and listen to a story about a man named Ed 
A poor urban dweller, barely kept his stomach fed, 
Then one day he was orderin' up some food, 
And what came on his plate put him in a mood. 

Foul that is, Southern fried, Texas cluck. 

Well, the first thing you know ol' Ed's a starvin' pig, 
Kinfolk said "Ed - move away from there!" 
Said "Good ol' Popeye's is the place you ought to be 
So he loaded up his fork and moved to Civic Cee. 

Center that is. Urine pools, heroin scars."

Me n' Jamie W. went here after our last N.E.R.T. trainin' day. We reckoned we deserved some down-home vittles after a hard day taggin' dead bodies (OK...crash test dummies) and extinguishin' fires. I was hearin' that Front Porch had the best fried chicken in the city, dang nab-it, so me and ol' Jamie went n' ordered two platefuls. But first, I gotta tell ya it was so dark in here that I couldn't tell the waiter from a polecat in a briar patch.

Well doggies, we first shared the $7.75 Bajan Waldorf Salad, which was kinda like havin' apple slices and raisins mixed up with some Miracle Whip, even though the menu called it Creole mayo. It was sorta like eatin' paste. Even Ellie Mae coulda done better in the kitchen. Just as we were gonna start to whittle some wood, the waiter came with the $14.75 Miss Ollie's Fried Chicken. It was a big ol' dish with some mac n' cheese, collard greens and black-eyed peas.

Now it was so dark in here that I started to pick up a piece o' chicken with my hands. I was thinkin' that it was awful bready, and then I was wonderin' where the chicken was. It took me pert near ten bites before I realized I picked up the mac n' cheese. I felt dumber than Jethro Bodine at a Mensa meeting. The God's-honest truth was that the chicken was OK but not what Granny used to cook in our shed back in the hills.

Me n' ol' Jamie had us some $6 Champagne Cocktails with sekt to wet our whistles. Mmmm..it was sweeter than the moonshine on a pig's bottom. Boy howdy, we was thinkin' we'd go through the drive-thru window at Popeye's after supper, but it was so gosh-darn dark that we figured we'd go huntin' for some chickens since we was in the Mission anyways.

FOOD - 3 stars...fried chicken with the fixins
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...boy howdy, it was darker than Bill O' Reilly's soul
SERVICE - 4 stars...the staff were nicer than a opossum in a pot of Granny's hominy grits
TOTAL - 3 stars..."Y'all come back now, ya hear!"...yes, I heard you
author: Ed U.

description:
I have been to this restaurant a couple times now; so far, so good.

If you do venture over this way, be prepared to wait. The place is small, so there isn't much seating, service is slow, and the food takes a while as well.

I would definitely recommend getting the deviled eggs and the fried chicken.  Can't go wrong with these two comfort foods. Also notable was the mac and cheese. Although I am not a huge mac and cheese fan myself, I know a good one when I have it.

I also have tried the Dr. Pepper braised short ribs and the pork chop. Although they were good, they were not mindblowing. I've had better in the city.

Overall, this was a good place to be. Quaint and low key, with good food.
author: Eric C.

description: Service is good. Our host balked when she saw us with our baby, but she recovered quickly and accommodated us with the stroller. The grits and shrimp were delicious. I ordered a Bloody Mary and found it to be more than acceptable. I will be back. It's nice to find a place that will accommodate all types of people: not just the San Franciscan hipster elite.
author: Gnat C.

description:
Wonderful, classic meal. The mac & cheese was excellent - smoldering in a cast iron pan with a crusted top. The burger was solid. Friends were very satisfied with the arugula salad. There is something for everyone here!

The service was a bit slow but the atmosphere is great! They also give everyone a tasty cornbread muffin. Try the okra appetizer!
author: Joel A.

description:
My only wish for this restaurant is that I had a bigger appetite!

Awesome neighborhood joint with friendly staff and attentive service.

Amazing fried chicken - with a happily greasy 2 thumbs up from my hubby, a self proclaimed chicken aficionado.

Secret gem - the fried jambalaya rice ball.  Try it!

I will return with friends so we can try more dishes -  added plus - sharing is ENCOURAGED at The Front Porch.
author: Ruth S.

description:
Holy cheese grits! I had no idea this place existed until after an epic morning work out with some of my friends. For Sunday brunch, there wasn't a wait. 

Service was amazing, my water was always filled, orders went in and came out with no issue. The server presented our dishes with friendly smiles and the food was awesome. I ended up ordering the Stoner's Stack which consists of fried chicken, smothered in cheese and gravy, topped off with bacon. It came with a side of home fries which were to die for. I thought it was interesting that they stuck the knife right now the middle of the biscuit so A+ for presentation. We washed down the Southern comfort food with some mimosas and were out in about 45 min.

I would definitely come here again because of the service and food! 4 stars. 

Oh and as if this matters, the Bernal Heights Collective is a few steps away. Imagine the stoners coming here post smoke. I would think Heaven, lol.
author: Ciana P.

description:
Hello, bay area take on Pine State Biscuit's Reggie.  We're going to be good friends, I just know it.

Brunch with my cousin on a lovely SF morning.  She had the chicken fried steak with home fries, and I had the Stoner Stack -- fried chicken on a biscuit with bacon, cheddar, and gravy, with grits on the side. 

Oh sweet Jaysus, yes.  

They done did this right.

Some part of me thinks I should come back and try the shrimp and grits, because I love shrimp and grits too.  But come on.  Let's be honest.  I'm just going to keep getting the Stoner Stack.  And love it every time.
author: .caroline. ..

description: This place was lovely. I went in for my birthday having never been there before, they were very accommodating as to what was great on the menu. I ended up ordering the fried chicken which was my god so delicious. My family on the other hand decided to order, Dr.pepper braised short ribs and the 8oz Bacon Burger. Both of which I tried and were excellent. The atmosphere was great very laid back and casual. Loved this place and the food. I would definitely recommend it.
author: Gabriella M.

description:
3.5

Came here with a group of fellow southerners. We ordered:
Fried green tomato
Fried okra
Deviled eggs
Hush puppies
Fried chicken plate
Shrimp and grits
Pork chop

We shared everything. I can't say they were very memorable, but no complaints. Hush puppies and fried chicken were probably my fav. dishes. Service was pretty good.
author: Jenny C.

description:
This is a great little place to get your southern comfort fix.

I came with a friend for dinner and we were able to walk in and grab a couple seats at the bar. If you want a table, definitely book in advance because it's a small place and it gets packed.

Mac n' cheese - A must.
Fried chicken - Nicely spiced batter and super tender.
Spare ribs - Ridiculously tender. Basically falls apart if you look at it.

The sides were ok, but both mains came with the same sides, so we were kinda sick of collared greens and mashed potatoes/gravy. They had a few nice local brews on draft and I opted for a cask pumped stout. mmm....

Service was good. Definitely will have to come back sometime for brunch and I love chicken and waffles. :P
author: Kenny J.

description: DON'T LET GUY FIERI'S FOOD REVIEW FOOL YOU!! I ordered the fried chicken, mac & cheese, and greens they  were really tasty however one of the people I came with ordered the pork chops which was actually a shank. It was horrible so we asked the waitress to give us something else also I asked her if I could get a straw and ketchup she left out the restaurant and came back and still no straw I asked her again, she finally brought it. She came back with a few squirts of ketchup in a little cup thing MIND YOU her and the chefs are eating in the back and they have 4 sauces!! She had a sarcastic and smug attitude, we were treated like it was a privilege for us to be there. She acted as if she didn't want to serve and asked "anything else" we said no and she said "great". On top of that it was a cold night but they left the door open so we were freezing in this cold city of Sanfrancisco.
author: Anan W.

description:
Fried chicken and popcorn. Who would have thought?

Food: Fried
Quantity: Enough
Price: Kinda pricey for a bucket o' chicken and popcorn
Noise: Loud
Attire: Stretchy pants
Service: Friendly
Parking: Meter
Recommendations: If you don't order the chicken, there's something wrong with you. Order everything and anything fried. Greens and brussel sprouts cut the fat. Ok, no. It'll just make you feel better. 
Freebies: Cornbread!!!

Overall 4.0-4.5
author: Annie T.

description: August 25, 2016.  The server was great.  Good service and recommendations.  The four of us shared 5 dishes.  The fried chicken was crazy good.  Would go there again next time I am in town
author: J I.

description:
Surprise, suprise, another hipster refueling station in Bernal Heights. I had high hopes for The Front Porch but was sorely dissapointed. I have to say the food was just your ordinary run of the mill southern cuisine. Everything was decent but nothing blew my mind.  I recommend the crab fritters, fried okra and the mac and cheese. The apps were all better than the mains.  The fried chicken with mashers and collard greens was disappointing...they needed to brine the chicken more and the breading was too thick....definitely not the best I've had. I hate to say it but I'd almost rather eat KFC. The halibut jamalaya was also a no go for me....the fish was overcooked and over salted. The "seafood" jamalaya had one lonely shrimp in it...that's all. 

Bummer.
author: Debbie C.

description:
F*cket get the bucket is right!!

Oh and a side of Mac n Cheese and fried okra!

I make it in a 2-3 times a month, always great service, great food, fairly priced!!
author: O. S.

description: Came here late on a Sunday. It's a good place for fried chicken and mash potatoes, you should definitely order the chicken bucket. The service from beginning to end was good and the server was attentive. The portions are large, so sharing is encouraged unless you are really hungry!
author: Richard H.

description:
So I went here for the first time last night.  It's pretty crowded so it's definitely worth making a reservation.  When we get there it's pretty obvious that it's the converted garage of a victorian.  It's a tight squeeze but they did a nice job.

So we started off with the deviled eggs with jalapenos and bacon.  Yeah I like deviled eggs, but the added components really added a nice flavor to it.  Is it worth the price?  I guess it depends on how much you like deviled eggs already.  I thought they were great.

Then we got the fried chicken with side orders of greens and bacon and mac n' cheese.  I loved it all.  The greens weren't overly bitter and had a good hint of brown sugar kind of flavor.  The mac n' cheese was heavy on the cheese.  It didn't have the crusted top my girlfriend likes, but she didn't seem to care.  The chicken had a ton of seasoning in the batter they used, and it wasn't overly greasy to the point where it's hard to hold it like we see with some "southern" inspired restaurants.

Only reason I'd give it a 4 and not a 5 star rating?  The cocktails kind of sucked.  We had 3 of em and I don't think any of them were worth it.  I'd definitely go back here.  i just wouldn't get any cocktails.
author: John S.

description:
I love The Front Porch!
It's super close (almost way too close) to my house.
I always make a reservation in order to secure a booth which almost guarantees I will be ordering a couple cocktails!

The menu changes often enough so the neighborhood regulars never tire of the main dishes.

Highlights:
::  Dr. Pepper Braised Short Ribs on pureed celery root or most recently, turnip puree. This dish reminds me of dinner at my Grandma's house as a kid. So delicious and heavenly.
::  Biscuits with herbed butter and jam - light as clouds.
::  Awesome, crisp, seasonal salads.
::  Farmer's Vegan plate is always fantastic.
::  Rotating menu of delicious cocktails.

The service here is always great and I keep threatening the staff that one day I am going to come here for both brunch and dinner!  It's that good!
author: Katie S.

description:
My other and I are suckers for a good brunch; we went here on the recommendation of an office colleague and didn't know what to expect. What a delicious surprise! We had the most amazing beignets, biscuits and gravy, fried chicken over pumpkin waffles, and a chicken po'boy for later. I also suggest you try the "Breakfast at Tiffany's" cocktail (read: booze, maple syrup, bacon, and whipped egg white- actually quite light and tasty!)

Definitely coming back as its conveniently close to home as well :)
author: Brittany T.

description:
Want a little Southern comfort fix? Definitely the spot to go.

A bucket of FRIED CHICKEN please!!! I have to admit that the fried chicken-- DARK meat, is delicious.  It's super crispy and crunchy, just the way I like it.

Sides:
Oxtail Poutine -- This was pretty good.
Mac & Cheese -- This was very rich and heavy.  I think if I had more than 2 bites, I'd explode. But I had a third and survived. 

Definitely would want to sit outdoors next time if the weather permits.  Inside gets a bit smokey, especially in the back by the kitchen.
author: Jessica P.

description:
Nice to try a new "most reviewed" restaurant on Yelp and NOT be dissapointed.

Emmy's spaghetti shack was slammed Sat night about 8pm so we yelped nearby restaurants and found this place.  Happy we did.

We really enjoyed getting the bucket of fried chicken and getting brussel sprouts, mac & cheese, japaleno hush puppies, and biscuits.  Everything was borderline good-great -- the mac & cheese and hush puppies.. were DELICIOUS!!

Fun, unique atmosphere.. bar atmosphere - dark and loud music but lots of fun things on the wall to look at and admire.  Looking forward to going back with friends and hopefully getting a whirl on those rocking chairs upfront on a warm summer night. :)
author: Melody T.

description:
This place rocks!! Double YUM YUM!. I came here with a few friends the other night for the first time. 

We got seated immediately and everything on the menu looked great. 

We decided to order the following: 

Beet Salad - it was delicious (we needed veggie in our meal =P) 

Brussels Sprouts with molasses - surprisingly very good. It was kinda caramelized with just a touch of sweetness 

Fried Okra - this was good, if you like Okra. It is better when fried! 

Malt Liquor Pork - great piece of fat! YUMS! 

Crab Fritters - we ordered it and got charged for it, but didn't realize we didn't get it. SUCKS! =( 

Chicken Bucket - Fried chicken was awesome. It came out in a popcorn bucket with popcorn - 10 pieces. It also included collard greens and mashed potatoes. D-E-L-I-C-I-O-U-S! 

After eating all that, we decided to share dessert. Can't finish a meal without dessert, right? 

We decided to share the mud pie and the ginger bread pudding. The desserts did not disappoint. They were sweet but not overly sweet. 

This place did not disappoint - great food all around. I had a great company to share all the above food..=)
author: James L.

description:
I really only remember the fried chicken and it was over hyped. 
Yes it was nice and juicy but the crust was flavorless and even slightly overcooked. 

The mac n cheese was pretty good. 
The biscuits were good for biscuits... I'm just not that big of a fan of biscuits. 
Service was really nice and this was one of the first places where I saw people leave bottles of water for the table to refill. And I sure do get thirsty so much appreciated.
author: Henry C.

description:
If I'd had the same meal without the pretension (and the pretentious price), I might have been relatively happy with it.  

The thing about soul food, is that if you are going to pay a premium to have it cooked and served by obnoxious hipsters, you expect them to do something special with it.  Our food was fine, but not special.  The fried chicken was tasty, but no better than the fried chicken I've had at other pretentious- and not-pretentious- restaurants in the Bay Area.  The mashed potatoes and collards were bland and disappointing.  The shrimp and grits had unpleasantly-textured shrimp and adequate grits hiding under a cloak of sauce.  Gumbo was bland, aside from the chunks of andouille sausage.  Macaroni and cheese was fine, but no better than melted cheese usually is.  Everything needed salt.  Soul food's fundamentals are good, but this place did nothing to improve upon them.  

The cocktails, unlike the food, were not adequate.  The "aviatrix" took the delicious components of an Aviation and drowned them in enough sparkling cider that the result was like a soft drink.  The spicy margarita took some decent tequila and hot peppers and then lost them in a sea of grapefruit juice.  The sazerac was fine, if heavy-handed with the absinthe.  Don't go here.
author: William B.

description:
Underwhelming. Thank god for all those sazeracs.

Okay, the fried chicken in a bucket idea is great.. but it was just regular ol' fried chicken. A friend of mine told me that it tasted like they changed the recipe, because it USED to be amazing. Damn, I guess I missed out and got their new style.

I can list off so many places in SF with much better fried chicken....

The only redeeming factor of this restaurant? Being able to talk your friends into taking a spoonful of the ghost chile hot sauce for some cash.
author: Kazu O.

description:
Front Porch is a whimsy....its delightful, the staff are so nice....(although many are slow) and the food is terrific.  

We met here last night with a nice group of our buddies.  They set us up in one the cool booths that fit lots of folks...there were 7 of us.  We were comfortable and happy and we could mostly hear each other.  

The only con:
The bartender is very slow and or, the delivery of drinks is very slow.  The food was a bit slow to come too.  And sometimes finding a waitress was difficult.  But, she was AWESOME and just really busy.  

THE PROS:  
The decor is fabulous/eclectic...its like a museum of american kitch which delights me

Our waitress was spectacular!  
Our drinks were yumhmy for the most part.  One of us had a watered down martini and she was sad...but, they have other drinks to try like the THE FRONT PORCH:)  And, I tried a fun been :  Lucky Buddha!  Its a great bottle!  GET ONE

As for the food WOWOWOWO
Appetizers:
Fried pickles ....crispy on the outside.....melt in your mouth tangy on the inside
Friend OKRA....cooked PERFECTLY....soft but still a bite to it ...crunch corn meal on the outside
AND OMG:  Crawfish Corn Fritter HUSHPUPPIES ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD.  There is plenty of crawfish and lots of nice peppers and corn. 

Dinner was again a great win!
My hubby and I shared :
Fried Chicken : 4 pieces...generous pieces (breast, leg, thigh, wing) dunked and fried at least twice...it was dipped and done to crispy spice filled perfection...a tiny sting of heat.  The chicken was moist and delicious.  On the side with that was mashers and gravy.  And colllareds with hammocks.  They were a little sweet for our taste. 
Along with this shared order, I got us two sides:  BISCUITS from HEAVEN ...chewy, buttery, heavy yet light..accomanied by rosemary, honey butter. DELIGHTFUL
Also, ordered the MAC n CHEESE.  WOW!  It was truly the best mac n cheese have eaten at ANY restaurant ANYWHERE in the USA.  This includes many southern states; Texas, Tennessee, Indiana, Kentucky, Mississippi......its was creamy, chewy, cheesy with the perfect tinge of salt.....delightful. 
Friends had :
Shrimp and Grits ...creamy grits and fresh perfectly cooked shrimp
hamburger with blue cheese
blackened catfish..

everyone was happy and thriving after this meal:)  

we didn't have dessert cause MITCHELS ICECREAM is nearby.  Next time for sure:)
author: Erin S.

description:
First timer, a BFF took me to brunch here, the bloody marys' were good, (my bench mark is the BM at The Ramp) they fall short but not bad.  Good booze level, the bacon crumble at the top could do with a revamp, use real ground/powdered bacon instead of the crispy salad toppings they use and the pickled okra instead of celery or long beans was different but not fully appreciated by this okra hater but not a major issue for me, I just sidelined it and went on.  We started with the beignets & a side of maple bacon.  I promptly stuck a slice of bacon in my BM! The beignets were very tasty and the bacon was done just right, not stiff or hard but cooked well and still soft.  Now about the menu... do not look for anything classic, this is a change from just eggs & hash browns so be prepared to try new things & combinations.  The most classic thing you will find is chicken fried steak and the chicken & waffles, everything else is new.  I dove in with the spicy shrimp with andouille sausage with cheesy grits with a red sauce and converted the poached egg to scrambled.  And it was goooooood.  The grits were smooth, creamy and cheesy, the scrambled egg fit in quiet nicely and the shrimp & sausage had just the right spice and the red sauce just brought it all together. A second bloody mary was in order.  Now about the restaurant it self, small, dark and crowded.  Not bad as it is a small neighborhood eatery but the bar greets you at the front door and so does the swampy odor.  Having been a bartender before I can state with certainty, the bar needs some better swamping after hours, mats, wells & fixtures as well as the floor drains need some work.  Don't get me wrong, the place is clean it's just that bars because of spills get dirty and need a little extra care just like grease traps in the kitchens, and when your bar is literally at the front door greeting the public it better smell clean and fresh.  The Chef Jodi (sp)  & staff rocks a good meal, our waitress Mychel (Michelle) gave excellent service and was very attentive.  All in all my experience was good, the food was great, cocktails were good and the price for brunch was good.  I plan on going back especially for dinner as they have alligator on the menu.  So good job Front Porch, you will be seeing me again and hopefully with friends in tow!!

Cheryl
author: Cheryl S.
